loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 39 años de edad y está acompañada con el señor Merardo Paredes quién es vendedor ambulante. La pareja tiene dos hijos, un varón y una nena, ambos menores de edad que estudian y dependen de sus padres. Celia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como: frutas, verduras, panificados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, yervas, embutidos, corte de carnes entre otros.

Celia se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de ocho años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa, dónde ella realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial. 

Celia, con sus ganancias de su venta, aporta a los ingresos de la unidad familiar.  Celia comenta que tiene bastante venta, gracias a la buena atención que ofrece. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc, de este modo podrá satisfacer la demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Celia is 39 years old and is in a relationship with Merardo Paredes who is a traveling salesman. The couple have two children, a boy and a girl, both of whom are young, in school and depend on their parents. Celia is dedicated to selling all types of merchandise such as fruit, produce, baked goods, rice, sugar, oil, herbs, sasuages, and cuts of meat, among other items. Celia has been dedicated to this work for more than eight years. Her shop is located in her house, where she has made some modifications in order to have the necessary space for her store. With her earnings from sales, Celia contributes to the family income. Celia comments that she has enough sales thanks to the good service that she offers. As a result, she wishes to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise such as fruit, produce, meat products, rice, oil, sugar, etc. so she will be able to satisfy the demand in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, produce, fruit, baked goods, meat products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is a 44-year-old married housewife and mother of one, who lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines.  For a living, Alma buys and sells coconuts in a neighboring town. She plans to use her requested loan from Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, as additional capital for her buying and selling business. Her personal goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional coconuts

loans.name: Kouessan Hubert

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce  depuis 1991 le métier de la cordonnerie, son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’il maîtrise parfaitement cette activité, il fabrique des chaussures qu’il vend à ses clients, il crée aussi des modèles de chaussures pour attirer les passants. Voulant acheter les matières nécessaires  à la fabrication des chaussures, il s’adresse à WAGES  pour obtenir un crédit et acheter les matières nécessaires.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been working as a cobbler since 1991; his experience in this profession means that he has mastered his business perfectly. He makes shoes which he sells to his clients, and also creates display models of shoes to attract passers-by. Wanting to buy the necessary supplies for manufacturing shoes, he turned to WAGES to obtain a loan and to buy the necessary supplies.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make shoes

loans.name: Maria Glady

texts.es:
La señora Maria Glady tiene 44 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes que dependen de ella.  Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 11 años. Ella comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias al apoyo de su marido. Es decir, que el marido monto para ella el negocio de las ganancias que obtenía de las ventas de mercaderías, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante. Hoy día ambos atienden el negocio; que gracias a sus esfuerzos esta a nivel de la competencia y con un crecimiento sistemático.

La señora Maria Glady tiene casa propia. Necesita aumentar sus compras y así consigue descuentos interesantes y en consecuencia logra mayor margen de ganancia.

Ella manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es atravez de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razon por el cual opta por este pedido. Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espiritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Maria Glady is 44 years old, is married and has two adolescent children who depend on her. Her business is 11 years old. She began to work independently thanks to the support of her husband. That is to say her husband gave her the money for the business from his earnings that he obtained selling merchandise on foot. Today, both of them attend the business, which, thanks to their efforts, is at a competitive level with systematic growth. Maria Glady has her own home. She needs to increase her purchases and acquire discounts so she may enjoy greater profit margins. She believes that the only way to grow is through loans because it is very difficult to accumulate capital through her operations. This the reason why she has opted for this loan. She is a person who is very responsible and has desires to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and has no doubt that she will achieve all of her goals that she has set forth.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, herbs, rice, cheese, flour and starch, among other items.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Delia es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Delia junto a su esposo se dedican al alquiler de maquinarias de construcción a instituciones. Además tienen un taller mecánico en un local alquilado.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una mezcladora.
Los sueños de Delia son tener un local propio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "Golondrinas" (Swallows) Community Bank. Delia is married, is 39 years old and has five children. Delia and her husband are dedicated to renting construction machines to companies. In additiona, they have a mechanic shop in a rented store. Delia needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a mixer. Delia's dreams are to own her own shop and that her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mixer.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 45 años de edad y está casada con el señor Mariano Fernandez. La pareja tiene siete hijos y de los cuales cinco son mayores de edad. Dos trabajan en el centro de ciudad como asalariados mientras los otros tres están residiendo y trabajando en España. Los dos  menores de edad que están en la primaría, el varón de quince  años es quién trabaja en la venta de bebidas que tienen en su casa, lo realiza después del horario escolar.
 
La  familia además tienen ventas de mandioca y bebidas de todas las marcas.  Justina se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de diez años. Ella comenta que por la tarde sale a levantar los pedidos por toda la zona en despensas, supermercados, kioskos, etc.  Mientras que su marido sale a entregar los pedidos.
Justina, con sus ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, junto con su marido y  también con la ayuda sus hijos hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Justina comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad  de mercaderías tanto como la mandioca y las bebidas ya que ambos productos tiene bastante salida en la zona donde venden.
texts.en:
Justina is 45 years old and married to Mariano Fernandez. The couple has seven children, five of whom are adults. Two of their adult children work in the city center as wage earners, while the other three live and work in Spain. Their two younger children are still in school; their fifteen-year-old son works after school selling beverages from their home. The family sells mandioca (a Paraguayan root vegetable) and all sorts of beverages. Justina has made a living in this business for more than ten years. She says that in the afternoon she goes to take orders from all the local stores, supermarkets, kiosks, etc., while her husband goes to deliver orders. The profits that Justina and her husband earn from their sales contribute to the household’s income, and with help from their children they are able to meet the family’s expenses. Justina says that their sales are doing very well. It’s for this reason that she wants to purchase a larger amount of both mandioca and beverages, since both products are selling very well in the area where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mandioca and beverages.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana esta casada con el señor Santiago A. y ellos tienen 2 hijos.  Posee una despensa ubicada en su hogar hace 11 años. Allí surte a sus vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, panificados, carnes, bebidas etc. También cuenta con el apoyo económico de su marido quien es oficial de la policía y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

En esta oportunidad necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías tales como: bebidas, arroz, azúcar, panificados y otros de manera a poder aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías y así tener una mayor variedad de las mismas.
texts.en:
Adriana is married to Santiago A., and they have 2 children. For 11 years she has had a store located in her home. She provides her neighbors and friends with all types of basic needs supplies like rice, sugar, bread, meat, drinks, etc. She also counts on economic support from her husband. He is a police official, and he helps with the household expenses. She needs a loan to buy merchandise like drinks, rice, sugar, bread, and more. That way she will be able to increase her stock and have a better variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks, rice, sugar, bread, and more

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, de 26 años de edad, esta domiciliada en la compañía Tape Tuya de la Ciudad de Itá. Ella es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 7 años de edad que cursa actualmente el tercer grado de la Educación Básica.

De profesión comerciante, ella cuenta con una despensa hace más de 6 años, donde la misma trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que no le ha sido fácil mantener a su hija y a sus padres siendo la única persona que trabaja actualmente. Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera acrecentar sus ingresos para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 26 years old and lives in the Tape Tuya neighborhood in the city of Itá. She is a single mother, with a 7-year-old daughter who is currently in the third grade of elementary school. Alicia is a merchant by profession, and has owned and operated her own small store for more than 6 years. Her goal is to improve her family’s quality of life. She’s the only person in her family who works, and it hasn’t been easy supporting her daughter and her parents. She decided to seek assistance from Fundación Paraguaya so that she can expand her business, and thus increase her income and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing candies, milk, yogurt, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 46 años y está casado hace 5 meses con Remigia que tiene 46 años de edad, a quien conoció durante su juventud.  No tienen hijos.  Ambos pudieron terminar solamente la secundaria y quedaron sin posibilidades de estudiar ninguna carrera universitaria debido a que provenían de familias de escasos recursos.

Andrés tiene su propio taller en donde realiza diversos trabajos de chapería y pintura mientras que su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar.  Él comenta que se inició en la actividad hace más de un año ya que anteriormente realizaba trabajos de albañilería hasta que un día decidió cambiar de rubro debido a que se dió cuenta que su trabajo actual es menos sacrificado que el anterior. Además tiene la ventaja de que puede realizar los trabajos en su propio taller que funciona en su mismo hogar.

Utilizó el dinero que ahorró durante varios años trabajando como albañil y pintor en la capital del vecino país, Argentina, además de un pequeño capital que su esposa le entregó y que provenía de una herencia que ésta recibió. Con lo juntado pudo comprar todas las herramientas que hoy día utiliza para realizar sus trabajos.

Hoy día cuenta con su clientela bien formada y afirma que le va muy bien. Solicita un crédito para la compra de una herramienta más que está necesitando.
texts.en:
Andrés is 46 years old and is married to 46-year-old Remigia. They have only been married for 5 months, but knew each other when they were children; they don’t have any children of their own. Both of them finished high school but didn’t have the opportunity to go to university because they came from families of modest means. Andrés has his own shop where he does auto body repair and painting while his wife does housework. He says that he went into this line of work more than a year ago. He previously worked as a bricklayer but decided to change jobs when he realized that his present job would be less difficult than bricklaying. Moreover, he has the advantage of being able to work in his own shop, which he operates out of his home. Andrés started his business with money he saved during several years of working as a bricklayer and painter in the capital of the neighboring country, Argentina, along with some money his wife gave him that she had received as an inheritance. By putting that together he was able to purchase all of the tools that he uses for his work. Now Andrés has a well-established clientele and says that his business is going well. He is requesting a loan so he can purchase an additional tool that he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a tool for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Bawa

texts.fr: Monsieur K. bawa  est un gérant d’auberge, il a ouvert en 2006 son auberge qu’il a appelé « VIRAGE PLANETE », cette activité lui est très rentable, ses clients sont la plupart des touristes ou des vacanciers, il veut réaménager une partie de son auberge, pour réaliser cela il a sollicité de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour acheter des meubles. Il est marié et a 02 enfants, sa femme est une coiffeuse.
texts.en:
Mr. Bawa K. is the manager of an inn. He opened his inn in 2006 and named it "Virage Planete." This business is highly profitable for him, and his clients are for the most part tourists or vacation-goers. He wants to renovate one section of his inn, and to realize this, he is seeking (through WAGES) his first loan cycle to buy furniture. He is married with two children, and his wife is a hairdresser.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is married with two children and is educated to junior high school level. Since 2006 she has worked as a trader selling jewelry at Ankwanda near Elmina, while her husband works as a teacher. Cecilia uses her income to provide her family’s housekeeping money and, occasionally, to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more earrings, necklaces and rings for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to use some for her children's education and some to build a family home.

loans.use: To purchase more earrings, necklaces and rings to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es una luchadora mujer de 52 años de edad. Está casada hace 30 años con Daniel que tiene 57 años de edad. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, están casados y viven en forma independiente.

Saturnina comenta que solamente pudo cursar hasta el segundo año de la secundaria, al igual que su esposo, por motivos económicos y que se vio forzada a trabajar desde muy joven también por la misma razón.  Su esposo es constructor de obras y se dedica a tal actividad desde hace 20 años aproximadamente.  Saturnina se desempeñaba únicamente como ama de casa hasta que hace 6 años decidió montar una pequeña despensa en su propio hogar.

Hoy día, cuenta orgullosa, que la misma está bien surtida y le genera muy buenas ganancias.  Tiene como proyecto montar alguna vez una heladería con el fin de ampliar su negocio.  En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideo, panificados, etc. con las cuales surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a 52 year old woman who strives. She has been married for thirty years to Daniel who is 57 years old. Five children were born from their union, all of whom are married adults who live independently. Saturnina comments that she was able to study only up until the second year of high school, the same as her husband, due to financial reasons. She was forced to work from a young age for the same reason. Her husband is a construction worked and has been dedicated to that work for approximately twenty years. Saturnina worked solely has a homemaker up until six years ago when she decided to start a small shop in her own home. Today, she is proud that her shop is well stocked and generates good earnings. She has a new project which is to start an ice cream shop, with the aim to grow her business. At this time, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc. with which she may better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIA DE JESUS I. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Av. Colonización c/16 de noviembre. del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 32 años de edad, 1 hijo.
 
Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pescado y carne de pollo para vender  en las noches en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.

Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fieles que siempre consumen sus alimentos, esto porque mantiene un secreto de cocina que hace que todo comensal salga satisfecho con lo que consume.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más mesas, manteles y platos.

“Mi gran sueño es tener un restaurant creo que puedo lograrlo porque cuento con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus I. G. belongs to "Las Margaritas" Community Bank and lives on Av. Colonizacion in Calleria, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 32 years old and has one child. She is dedicated to selling food. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased fish and chicken to sell in the evenings from the sidewalk outside her home. She has regular customers. Today, she has faithful customers who always consume her dishes. This is because she keeps a cooking secret which makes all her guests leave happy with what they consume. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will purchase more tables, tablecloths and plates. "My great dream is to have a restaurant. I believe that I can achieve this because I have the support of Manuela Ramons."

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, tablecloths and plates.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 57 años y está casado con Prisciliana que tiene 54 años de edad. De la unión de ambos han nacido 5 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, solamente 2 siguen viviendo con el matrimonio mientras que los demás ya han formado su propio hogar.

Ricardo es un sacrificado hombre que se dedica a la venta de carbón desde hace 10 años atrás. Su esposa le ayuda aportando dinero para los gastos del hogar con lo que recauda de sus ventas en un puesto que tiene en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Ricardo comenta que compra el carbón en bolsas y luego él mismo se ocupa de empaquetarlos en pequeñas bolsitas para su posterior venta. Cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada a quien sale a vender todos los días en un camión de su propiedad.  También vende leñas que son utilizadas frecuentemente por las amas de casa para abaratar costos a la hora de cocinar los alimentos y también a pequeños panaderos de la zona.

Todos los días sale a vender, no importa que haga frío, calor o sea un día de mucha lluvia, lo importante para él es cumplir con su clientela.  En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de más carbón debido a que tiene una oferta que quiere aprovechar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 57 years old and is married to Prisciliana who is 54 years old. From their marriage they have five children, all adults now, with just two still living with the couple while the others have formed their own homes. Ricardo is an industrious man who has worked selling charcoal for the last ten years. His wife helps him with the household expenses by contributing money which she earns from her sales in a stall she has in the city market. Ricardo says that he sells the charcoal in bags and that he himself is in charge of packing the charcoal in small bags for later sale. He has well established clients who he visits every day to sell, in his own truck. He also sells firewood that is frequently used by home makers to reduce costs when it comes to cooking meals, and also by small bakeries in the area. Every day he goes out to sell. It does not matter if the weather is cold, hot, or if it is a very rainy day. The important thing for him is to serve his clients. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal since he has an offer he would like to take advantage of.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora C. has worked as a seamstress and owner of a tailoring shop for more than two years. She runs her business as a primary source of family income and as a way of putting into practice the knowledge she has obtained over the years.

Initially Lora lacked the capital resources needed to increase her business, and so the realization of her ambition had to be put off for some time. This situation led her husband to make a hard decision to leave his family in search of a job and better earnings abroad, a decision that thousands of other Moldovans have also reached. With the money thus earned by her husband, Lora started her business in 2007, and it has grown extensively ever since. With a loan of 30000 MDL borrowed from Microinvest for 12 months, she will buy a new sewing machine and other accessories needed for her work.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other accessories

loans.name: Marialith

texts.es:
MARIALITH G. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES CORAJE” vive en el Jr. tres hermanos Mz.I. Lt. 5, en Yarinacocha, tiene 27 años de edad y 1 hijo.  Su pareja cuenta con trabajo y apoya económicamente a los gastos del hogar.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender en su pequeña bodega ubicada en su propia casa.

Actualmente continúa con su bodega y poco a poco está implementando con más productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 1 caja de galletas, 2 sacos de arroz, 1 caja de aceite y  otros para poder abastecer su negocio.
“Soy una mama muy feliz, porque hasta el momento puedo cubrir los gastos de mi pequeño hijo y así el pueda lograr ser un profesional, cuento con el apoyo de mi esposo.  Manuela Ramos es una institución que te motiva a realizarte como una persona capaz de tomar decisiones en la vida.
texts.en:
Marialith G. G. belongs to the Community Bank 'Women of Courage", lives in the community of Tres Hermanos, Yarinacocha, is 27 years old and has one son. Her partner has work and contributes to the expenses of the household. With her first loan of 300 New Soles, she bought groceries to sell in her small shop located in her own house. She is now continuing with her shop and little by little is adding more products to satisfy the needs of her clients. With this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles she will buy a case of biscuits, 2 sacks of rice, 1 case of oil, and other goods to be able to supply her business. "I am a very happy mother because until now I have been able to cover the expenses of my small son so that he may be able to accomplish becoming a professional, and I count on the help of my husband. Manuela Ramos is an institution that motivates you to become a person capable of making decisions in life".

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products like rice, biscuits, and oil for her shop.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Itá.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir como vaqueros, remeras, championes, etc. ya sea al contado o a crédito. Se inició en esta actividad por recomendación de un familiar que también se dedica a lo mismo. Al mismo tiempo posee una olería, ubicada en su domicilio, esta actividad la heredó de su padre quien se dedicaba a ese ramo. Los dos negocios le generan muy buenas ganancias debido a que logró comprar un camión de gran porte en el que transporta sus ladrillos a distintos depósitos de materiales de construcción de la zona. 

      Necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más prendas de vestir debido a que desea aumentar el stock de las mismas y así poder ofrecer más variedad a su clientela. Así mismo necesita comprar adobe (materia prima utilizada en la elaboración de ladrillos) de manera a poder satisfacer la gran demanda con que cuenta actualmente.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge is 28 years old, single, and lives in a well-known area in the city of Ita.

He is in the business of the purchase and sale of garments such as jeans, t-shirts, sportswear, etc., on cash or credit. He started this business on the recommendation of a relative who is in the same business. At the same time he owns a brick workshop, located in his home, that he inherited from his father who was in that industry. The two businesses generate very good income owing to the fact that he purchased a truck of great capacity in which he transports his bricks to different construction sites in the area.

He needs a loan in order to purchase more garments as he wants to increase his stock of garments and thereby be able to offer more variety to his clientele. At the same time he needs to purchase adobe (the main material utilized in the production of bricks) in order to be able to satisfy the great demand that he currently has.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of garments for sale and the purchase of adobe

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana M. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma todos los días.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y por esta razón es que espera con mucha confianza que el crédito le sea otorgado para salir adelante en su negocio y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market of the city of Managua, Señora Ana M. enthusiastically attends to her business of selling fruit. She herself sells them every day. At this time, she has turned to CEPRODEL to be granted a loan for the purchase of fruits and vegetables. She confidently hopes the loan will be approved in order for her to move forward with her business and to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette femme est une coiffeuse, elle a ouvert en 2006 son propre atelier de coiffure  qu’elle a appelé « EBENEZER COIFFURE », elle  a associé à son métier la vente de de mèches et de produits cosmétiques. La vente de mèches et de produits cosmétiques est très rentable pour elle, elle veut donc agrandir ce commerce pour mieux vendre, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter 30 mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est informaticien.
texts.en:
This woman is a hairdresser. She opened her own beauty salon in 2006, which she named "Ebenezer Coiffure." Through her salon, she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. The sale of hair extensions and and cosmetics is very profitable for her, and she therefore wants to expand this business to increase sales. For this reason, she is seeking (through WAGES) her second loan, to buy 30 sets of hair extensions and cosmetics. She is married to a man who works in information technology.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: María Nieves

texts.es:
La señora María Nieves a sus 69 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en la venta de café con pan atendiendo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua teniendo su propio termo donde elabora el café. 
Ella es una dama muy esforzada qeu busca la manera de cómo desarrollarse y a pesar de que ha atravesado situaciones adversas, siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Por esta razón es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para así continuar con su negocio de venta de pan y café en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora María Nieves, at 69 years of age, is engaged in the work of selling coffee with bread. She offers this in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua where she has her own thermos with which she prepares the coffee. She is a very vigorous lady who is trying to get ahead and in spite of having met with adversity she always strives to make her way through. That's why she has come to CEPRODEL hoping to be granted a loan so that she can continue with her business selling bread and coffee in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee and bread.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio tiene 35 años de edad y esta domiciliado en la compañía de Calle Ybate de la Ciudad de Itá. Esta acompañado de la señora Bernardina de 30 años de edad, con quien tiene dos hijos, Daniel (12) que cursa actualmente el sexto  grado de la Educación Básica y Leticia, de 5 años que va al pre-escolar.

De profesión mecánico,  hace más de 12 años, donde día a día trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le ha sido fácil mantener a sus hijos ya que proviene de una familia humilde y a vez ayuda a sus  padres.  Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de herramientas como: una pulidora, taladro y una soldadora eléctrica, de manera a poder mejorar su trabajo y consecuentemente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio is thirty-five years old and lives on Ybate Street in the city of Ita. He lives with thirty-year-old Mrs. Bernardina with whom he has two children: Daniel who is twelve years old and currently enrolled in sixth grade and Leticia who is five years old and enrolled in kindergarten. Eleuterio has been a mechanic for twelve years and worked consistently with the objective of improving his family's quality of life. It has not been easy to support his children given the fact that he comes from a humble background and continues to help his parents at the same time. He has decided to trust the Fundacion Paraguaya to help him with the purchase of several tools such as: a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine. He hopes that these tools will help him improve his work thereby improving his income as well.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Rosa C. desde hace 15 años se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de bebidas como lo son gaseosas, erfrescos, agua, jugos, entre otros. De igual manera vende reposterías todo siendo comercializado en su propia casa de habitación.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de las bebidas ya que le urge actualmente. Cabe señalar que Ceprodel le ha sido de mucho beneficio anteriormente por lo que ha logrado comprar su mantenedora para guardar sus bebidas. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado.
texts.en:
For over 15 years, Mrs. Rosa C. has managed her own business in the Mayoreo market located in the city of Managua. She sells various beverages including but not limited to pop soda, water and juices along with home-made desserts. The reason she has approached Ceprodel for help is that she urgently needs funds for the purchase of beverages. It's important to note that Ceprodel has benefitted her greatly in the past, as she was able to purchase a refrigerator through them to store her beverages. She trustingly hopes that her requested funds will be awarded.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Eustaciana

texts.es:
Eustaciana es una mujer de 65 años de edad y se dedica a la costura hace 40 años aproximadamente. Tiene 3 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad y solamente la hija menor, que tiene 27 años de edad, vive aún con ella.

Comenta que desde muy joven se inició en la costura, profesión con la que logró hacer estudiar a todos sus hijos. También logró construír su casa propia y equipar la misma con todas las comodidades necesarias.

Hoy día cuenta con dos máquinas de coser y le da trabajo a un sobrino quien le ayuda con los pedidos que recibe periódicamente.  En esta oportunidad necesita un préstamo para la compra de telas debido a que tiene pedidos de prendas de vestir para invierno.
texts.en:
Eustaciana is sixty-five years old and has been a seamstress for approximately forty years. She has three adult children, of which her twenty-seven year old daughter is the only one who still lives with her. She started sewing since she was very young, and this profession has allowed her to put all of her children through school. She has also been able to build and furnish her own home with all the necessary elements. Currently she counts on sewing machines and employs a nephew of hers who helps with the regular client requests. She needs a loan for the purchase of fabrics given that her latest jobs are requests for winter clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of fabrics

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Benkadi sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 27ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire, le premier fut remboursé sans difficulté. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pomme de terre, d’ignames, d’atiéké et de l’encens.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 4 sacs de 100kg d’atiéké, 1 chargement de charrette d’âne  en ignames, une vingtaine de kg de gueni et de magnonkisèni,  des parfums et autres (pour la fabrication d’encens). Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans  les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les  différents  marchés de Sikasso, dans les quartiers de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.250 FCFA dont une partie sera mise en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Benkadi ambitionnent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres de devenir grossistes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Benkadi are married women who average 27 years of age and one child each. They live in monogamous families in Mancourani II, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their second solidarity loan. The first was repaid without difficulty. The women do a diversity of work, including selling potatoes, yams, atiéké (dried fermented cassava), and incense.

With this new loan, the group members intend to buy ten 100-kg sacks of potatoes, four 100-kg sacks of atiéké, one donkey cart-load of yams, twenty kilos of gueni (a fragrant root) and magnonkisèni (a fragrant seed), perfumes, and more (for making incenses). Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Bamako, Médine, and Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of men and women, cash and often credit accepted, at different marketplaces of Sikasso and while going door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 18,250 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Certain group members have the ambition of buying a plot of land on which to live; other members, to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Danaya de l’association Gnogondeme sont  en majorité  des mariées (une seule veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe, le premier s’est  dénoué sans aucune difficulté. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habits  pour enfants, du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe, des beignets et des savons.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent, acheter 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants, 60 sacs de charbon de bois, 250 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni),  2 sacs de 100 kg de mil et une vingtaine de kg de beurre de karité (pour faire les beignets). Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille (en épargne) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The six women of the Danaya group of the Gnogondeme association are for the most part married (one is widowed) and are on average 41 years old with 4 children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Ouayerma, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their clientele and are on their second group loan, with the first repaid with no problems. They run diverse businesses, including selling children’s clothes, charcoal, firewood, donuts, and soaps. With this new loan, they plan to buy a vanload of firewood, two dozen children’s outfits, 60 bags of charcoal, 250 pieces of traditional soaps (farakourouni), 2 bags of 100 kg of millet, and about 20 kg of shea butter (for making donuts). They stock up at the big market in Sikasso and neighboring cities. The products are sold in different markets in Sikasso and in the neighborhoods to a clientele composed of men and women and mostly for cash. They foresee earning on average 17,500 CFA francs each per month of which a portion will be used to take care of the family (in the form of savings) and another portion will be invested in the businesses. The women of the Danaya group aspire to increase their sales in order to better satisfy their clientele.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy misc. items

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es socio del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Alejandro es separado, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Alejandro realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con carro propio. Además Alejandro tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, su hija es quien se encarga de la atención.
Alejandro necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los sueños de Alejandro son comprar otro carro, mejorar su casa y tienda y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. He is 45 years of age, separated and has three children. Alejandro uses his own car to operate a taxi service in the city of Ayacucho. He also has a store in his house from which he sells mostly groceries. His daughter tends the store. Alejandro needs a loan of 2,600 Sols which will be used to buy rice, sugar and for maintenance on his car. He dreams of buying another car, fixing up his house and his store, and providing a good education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar, and for maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Deovigilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Deovigilda tiene 35 años de edad, esta en pareja con el Sr. Miguel Pereira, de profesión comerciante.  Ellos tienen 2 hijos menores que cursan le educación primaria y el tercer hijo viene en camino, la sra. se emcuentra con un embarazo de 7 meses.

La Sra. Deovigilda y su marido se dedican a la compra venta de pescado hace más de 10 años, se iniciaron con esta actividad desde pequeños ya que viven en una ciudad que su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta de pescado.

Con algunos años de trabajo y ahorrando compraron para su rodado propio para viajar y comprar a más bajo costo el pescado de ciudades rivereñas, actualmente se dedican a la distribucuión a los pescadores ambulantes y a copetines y bares.

Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de variedad de pescados.
texts.en:
Señora Deovigilda is 35 years of age, the wife of Señor Miguel Pereira who is a businessman. They have two young children who are in primary school, and a third child is on the way as she is seven months pregnant. Señora Deovigilda and her husband have been selling fish for more than ten years. They began doing this when they were little ones, and since they have been living in the city, their principal source of income is the sale of fish. After years of working and saving up, they bought their own wheels in order to travel and purchase the fish at lower cost from the river cities. Currently they are distributing the fish to street vendors and to snack shops and bars. They are requesting this loan to purchase a variety of fish.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fish.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria luz es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Maria Luz es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, vive en el distrito de Acocro, Maria Luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Maria compra cereales, productos que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, cereales y papa.
Maria Luz sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the Retoño community bank. Maria Luz, 30, is married and has 3 children. She lives in the Acocro district. Maria Luz has a store in her house where she sells general groceries and vegetables. Maria also buys cereals that she later sells in Ayacucho city. Maria Luz needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy rice, cereals, and potatoes. Maria Luz dreams of building her house in Ayacucho city and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cereals, and potatoes.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
MARITZA P. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES CORAJE” vive en el Jr amazonas # 998. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 42 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su pareja es policía.

Se inició en el negocio de peluquería y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró  tijeras y un espejo  para empezar el negocio.
 
Hoy en día ha aumentado su clientela es así que necesita implementar el su peluquería con más insumos para seguir con la atención y no perder clientela.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de tintes y artículos para su peluquería.

“Se que la belleza física es pasajera peo la belleza espiritual nunca muere y en ese sentido me siento realizada por que aprendí a valorarme y valorar a los demás, por ello mis clientes se van contentos con el trabajo que realizo.
texts.en:
Maritza P. C. belongs to the “Mujeres Coraje” community bank. She lives at Jr Amazonas # 998., in the Callería district , in Pucallpa city. She is 42, has 3 children, and her significant other is a policeman. She started her hairdressing business with her first loan of 300 PEN. She bought scissors and a mirror to start the business. Now she has more customers, and she needs to get more hairdressing supplies to continue giving good service and not lose her customers. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy dyes and hairdressing items. “I know that physical beauty is fleeting, but spiritual beauty never dies. In this sense, I feel fulfilled because I learned to value myself and others. For that reason, my customers are happy with the work I do.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair dyes and hairdressing items.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya  de l’association Sabali est constitué  de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  31ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour leur deuxième fois. Le  premier  prêt fut remboursé correctement. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la restauration, la vente de  savons traditionnels,  de médicaments et d’atiéké.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 sacs d’atiéké, de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et autres (pour la cuisine), 300 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni), et 10 emballages de médicaments. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant, en détail et quelques fois à crédit. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent avoir des montants conséquents pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle .
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Sabali association is made up of married women with an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Mancourani II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the second time. Their first loan was correctly reimbursed. They have various businesses, among others selling cooked food, traditional soap, medicines and atiéké (a semoulina flour).

With this new loan, they expect to buy 3 sacks of atiéké, 20 liters of cooking oil, and other things (for the kitchen); 300 pieces of traditional soap, and 10 packages of medicines. They buy their goods at the market of Médine in downtown Sikasso and in surrounding areas.

The merchandise is sold in various markets around Sikasso and in the residential neighborhoods to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash, retail, and sometimes on credit. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest invested back into their businesses.

The women of the Danaya group hope to be able to keep up a consistent stock of their goods so as to better satisfy their clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Eugenia vende hoja de coca de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los adquiere en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja semanalmente.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hoja de coca.
Eugenia sueña con comprar una casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal Retoño. She has a live-in partner, is 39 years old, and has three children. Eugenia sells coca leaves as an ambulatory vendor in the Nery Garcia market. She gets her products from the Ayacuchana forest which she travels to every week. Eugenia needs a loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be used to purchase more coca leaves. She dreams of buying her own house and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Coca leaves

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
MARTHA R. V. pertenece al Banco Comunal “MI GENESIS II” vive en asociación Pro vivienda Melita Ruiz Km. 7.800 Mz. Ll. Lt.19. Pucallpa.  Tiene 36 años de edad, 5 hijos y su pareja es mototaxista (transportista).

Su primer  préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero pudo iniciar su negocio de costura.  Paralelamente tiene un motokar el cual alquila para obtener otros ingresos.

Actualmente ella se desempeña como costurera, confecciona ropa en especial para mujeres.  Por otro lado, administra su motoKar, gracias a ambos negocios puede solventar los gastos del hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,00.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará un nuevo motor para su motokar.

“En un principio solo podía tener un pequeño negocio que muchas veces no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de la familia aun mas cuando somos muchos pero la oportunidad que nos da Manuela Ramos  permite trabajar en  otros negocios para incrementar los ingresos”.
texts.en:
Martha R. V. belongs to the comunal bank called “Mi Genesis II” and lives in the Melita Ruiz neighborhood of the city of Pucallpa. She is 36 years old, has five children, and her partner is a motorcycle taxi driver. Her first loan was 300 Nuevo Soles (Peruvian Currency) and with this money she was able to start a sewing business. She also has a motokar rental business on the side to earn more income. Currently she works as a seamstress, tailoring clothing especially for women. Also she runs her motokar business, and thanks to these two businesses she can pay for her household expenses. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian Currency) she will buy a new motor for her motokar. “At first I could only have a small business that, many times, didn’t provide enough to cover family expenses, especially since we are so many people, but Manuela Ramos [Kiva Field Partner] gives us the oportunity to work in other businesses to increase our income.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor for Motorkar

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Kotognogontala sont 4 femmes mariées et 2 femmes célibataires ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe est à son premier prêt solidaire  avec l’institution. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de beignets, de chaussures, de condiments alimentaires, de savons, de  friperie et du haricot préparé. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  2 sacs de farine de blé,  40 litres d’huile alimentaire (pour la préparation de la farine de blé et du haricot), une douzaine de paires de chaussures, 250 morceaux de savons traditionnels (kabakourouni), 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 colis de friperie et 2 sacs de graines de haricots.
 Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.250FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Kotognogontala ambitionnent avoir un fonds plus élevé afin  d’agrandir leur activités .
texts.en:
The six women of the group Kotognogontala include four who are married and two who are not. They average 24 years of age and two children each and live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The group members are on their first solidarity loan with the institution. They do a diversity of work, including selling beignets, shoes, condiments, soap, second-hand clothing, and cooked beans.

With this new loan, they intend to buy two sacks of flour, forty liters of cooking oil (used in cooking the flour and beans), a dozen pairs of shoes, 250 bars of traditional soap (kabakourouni), four packets of condiments, two packages of used clothing, and two sacks of beans. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted, in the different marketplaces of Sikasso and within families.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 15,250 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to obtain higher levels of funding for expanding their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture, elle confectionne des habits qu’elle vend, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est maçon, elle a 02 enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Ne disposant de machine pour pleinte, elle voudrait en acheter et demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  une machine pour pleinte.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew as a trade, and she makes clothing that she sells. She is married to a gentleman who is a mason. She has two children. Her work enables her to assist her husband with household expenses. Lacking a "plinthe" sewing machine, she would like to buy one and is asking WAGES for her first loan to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MATILDE F. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en AA:HH 4 de junio. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 54 años de edad, y su pareja es motocarrista (transportista).

Se inició en el negocio de costura de ropa y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró hilos, elástico y telas.
 
Actualmente confecciona ropas para mujeres y varones, además realiza arreglos y composturas de prendas de vestir.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará repuestos para su maquina de coser y así darle el mantenimiento que necesita.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya dando muchas facilidades y oportunidades donde simplemente hay que aprovecharlas.  Gracias por este apoyo que brindan a las mujeres”.
texts.en:
Matilde F. C. belongs to the “Las Estrellitas de Pucallpa” community bank. She lives at AA:HH Junio, in the Manantay district, in Pucallpa city. She is 54, and her significant other is a public transportation driver. She started her business of making clothes with her first loan for 300 PEN. She bought thread, elastic, and fabric. Now she makes clothes for women and men. She also does alterations and mending. With this loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy replacement parts for her sewing machine. This way she will be able to do the necessary maintenance on her machine. “Manuela Ramos is a non governmental organization that lends support, makes things easier, and provides opportunities. You simply need to take advantage of them. Thanks for all of the support given to women.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for sewiing machine.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria M. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y joyeria de fantasia enchapes de oro, ella tambien vende lociones, cremas, polvos, shampoos, desodorantes, etc. ella tiene un año de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella vive en el barrio San Jose. en estos momentos ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que es mas barato y se obtienen mas ganancias, pero ella tiene que viajar para comprar su produto, por eso es que le sale mejor comprarlo al por mayor para tenerlo para varios meses. 
por tal razon es que ella esta solicitando el credito. tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quiere llegar a tener una tienda grande para poder mantener a su hijo y darle lo mejor en esta vida. ella quiere que su hijo sea una persona de bien y que sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria M. is 26 years old and has a 4-year old son. She sells cosmetics and gold-plated costume jewellery. She also sells lotions, creams, powders, shampoos, deodorants, etc. She has been doing this for one year. She lives in the San Jose district. At the moment she needs money to buy more wholesale merchandise because it is cheaper and increases her earnings. However, she must travel to buy her products which is why it is better to buy in bulk so that she has enough to last several months. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan. She is eager to succeed and would like to have a large shop so that she is able to look after her son and give him the best start in life. She would like her son to be a good person and a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and costume jewellery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merly

texts.es:
MERLY L. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MU7JERES CORAJE” vive en el Jr Fortaleza, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 19 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es motocarrista.

Hace algún tiempo se inició en el negocio de motocar.  Con  el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró repuestos para su motocar.

Actualmente se dedica a administrar el motocar.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de un nuevo motocar y así obtener mayores ingresos.

“Doy gracias a Manuela Ramos por confiar en una mujer joven porque en ninguna institución me dan esa oportunidad.  Sé que puedo trabajar y además estoy planificando estudiar por las noches para así hacer crecer mucho más el negocio.... ahora y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Merly L. T. belongs to the “Mujeres Coraje” community bank. She lives on Fortaleza Street in the town of Pucallpa. She is 19 years old, has one son and her partner is a motocarrista (moto-taxi driver). She started the motocar business some time ago. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles she bought spare parts for her motocar. Now she manages the motocar. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she plans to buy a new motocar and thereby increase her income.

“I am grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting a young woman when no other institution would give me such an opportunity. I know that I can work and I am planning to study at night so that I can grow the business much more… now I shall be a great entrepreneur.”

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motocar

loans.name: Petrona Rosibel

texts.es:
La Sra. Petrona R. ella tiene 47 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos estan estudiando en la escuela y uno en el colegio.
ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones limpios en caja y por libra,  ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, esto le permite no descuidar a su familia. ella vive en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella tiene un convenio con una camaronera y los fines de semana sale de viaje para vernder el producto en diferentes municipios cercanos de esta ciudad y lo vende al por mayor.
ella necesita el credito para comprar bastante producto para poder vender mas en las comunidades ya que la cantidad que lleva no es suficiente con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Petrona R. is 47; is married by common law; and has three children, two of which are in elementary school, and one is in high school. She sells fish and shrimp that are cleaned in boxes and by the pound. She has done this for four years. Her business is located in her house, which allows her to still care for her family. She lives in the area of Morazan in the city of San Lorenzo. She has an agreement with a shrimper, and on the weekends, she travels to sell her product on a wholesale basis in different towns near the city. She needs this credit to buy enough product to be able to sell more in nearby communities since the quantity she has isn't enough to fill the orders she has from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish and shrimp

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Priscila

texts.es: la Sra. Ana C. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 estan estudiando y 2 estan pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser jeans y camisas, ella tiene mucha clientela ya que sus jeans son de buena calidad y a un precio justo para los clientes que le compran,, ella tiene 1 año de vender este tipo de productos, dice que le va bien, pero que necesita comprar mas para poder tener mejores ganancias, ella los fines de semana viaja para vender su producto en diferentes pueblos y caserios cercanos de donde ella vive y es asi como ella vende mas, pero necesita abastecerse de producto para ir a otras comunidades y tener mejores ganancias, ademas ella viaja a la frontera para comprar su producto y le sale muy caro estar viajando a cada rato para comprar la mercaderia.
texts.en:
Señora Ana C. is 30, lives in a common law marriage, and has five children. Three of her children are in school, and the other two are still too young. She sells new clothing such as jeans and shirts. She has a lot of customers since her jeans are of good quality, and she sells them at a fair price so her customers will buy them. She has sold these products for one year, and she says it's going well for her, but she needs to buy more merchandise to make more profit. On the weekends, she travels to sell her products in different towns nearby so she can sell more. But she needs to have a better stock of products so she can go to other communities and earn more money. She travels to the border to buy her products, and it is very expensive for her to do this so often to buy her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packages of new clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
NICIDA F. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MADRES CORAJE” vive en EL Jr Circunvalación Mz.220. Lt.27 Yarinacocha, tiene 48 años de edad, y 3 hijos.  Su pareja es pescador.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de pescado y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró una mesa y una balanza para poder vender, de forma ambulatoria, los pescados que le proporcionaba su pareja.

Ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de venta de pescado ha mejorado en los últimos meses.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará una red de pesca. 

“En un principio solo mi esposo era quien podía estar en el negocio pero ahora podemos compartirlo, él pesca y yo vendo en el mercado.  Nuestras ganancias nos ha permitido tener nuestro propio vote”.
texts.en:
Nicida F. L. belongs to the communal bank, "Madres Coraje." She is 48 and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She started her business selling fish, and with her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought a table and a scale to be able to sell fish as a street vendor. Her husband supplied her with the fish. She has made progress with the help of her family, and her sales have improved in the last few months. With this loan of 1,400 PEN, she will buy a fishing net. She says, "In the beginning, my husband was the one who could have a business, and now we can share it. He catches the fish, and I sell it in the market. Our profits have allowed us to have our own boat."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different types of fish

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: El comercio informal es la actividad principal a la que se dedica la  asociación “Cielo Azul”, venden ropa, material de escritorio, cosméticos, zapatos, comida, otras son costureras, también ofrecen servicio de café. Trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer, en el centro focal Villa Adela hace más de cuatro años con mucha responsabilidad. Ellas realizan sus ventas de manera ambulante y también algunas en puestos, desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan adquirir mayor cantidad de productos. Tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The association “Cielo Azul’ is primarily involved in informal commerce. They sell clothes, office supplies, shoes, and food. Others are seamstresses; some sell coffee. For more than four years they have responsibly worked with Pro-Mujer in the main center of Villa Adela. Some are street venders and others have stalls. They want to increase their sales. To do this, they need to get a larger quantity of products. They are sure they will be able to get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Need to buy products.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme a ouvert une boulangerie dans son quartier à agbalépédo, elle vend du pain en gros, elle vend plus les matins parce que les matins les gens prennent leurs petits déjeuners avec du pain. Son stock de farine de farine de blé, de beurre et de sucre qu’il utilise dans la fabrication du pain est épuisé, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de blé, 05 sacs de sucre, 03 boîtes  de beurre et assurer le transport. Elle  est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman opened a bakery in her area in Agbalépédo. She sells bread in bulk, and she sells the most in the mornings, because people eat bread as part of their breakfast in the mornings. Her stocks of wheat flour, butter, and sugar, which she uses to make bread, are depleted and she is therefore seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy 15 bags of wheat, 5 bags of sugar, 3 tins of butter, and to pay for transportation costs. She is married and has two children, and she contributes to meeting her family's expenses with what she earns from her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter, and other products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. works as a taxi driver in Domenase, near Elmina. Samuel has completed senior high school. He is married and has 5 dependent children. His wife is a trader.

Samuel has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. He is responsible for paying school fees and light bills. His loan will be used to buy spare parts for the car. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and maintain the car.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
el sr. Jose G. tiene 63 años de edad, el vive en union libre con su compañera de hogar la Sra. Maria Carbajal, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales. el vive en Coyolito y se dedica a la venta de Refrescos y Molino de Quebrar Maiz esta es su actividad principal, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para moler maiz, ya que mucha gente le gusta moler el maiz para hacer tortillas temprano para el desayuno.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar repuestos para el molino que es su unica fuente fuerte de ingresos que tiene, la venta de refrescos le genera ganancias pero no muchas.
su deseo es que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y que todos se graduen de la universidad y asi tengan una mejor condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose G., 63, lives with his common law wife, Mrs. Maria Carbajal. They have 5 children. He lives in Coyolito. He sells soft drinks, however grinding corn is his primary business. Every day he gets up at 4 in the morning to grind corn. Lots of people like ground corn to make tortillas for breakfast. He needs a loan to be able to buy replacement parts for his mill. The mill is his only strong source of income. Soft drink sales generate some income, but not much. His hope is that his children become good people, and that they all graduate from the university. That way they will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for mill and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Issa Boubou

texts.fr:
Madame Issa Boubou S. est une veuve Sénégalaise qui vend des chaussures sur commande.  Elle habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elle fait le commerce depuis l’âge très jeune.  Elle n’a jamais reçu un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC.  Avec ce premier crédit elle espère d’acheter les chaussures de son fils qui est cordonnier pour les revendre.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise elle peut se soutenir.

Madame S. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Mrs. Issa Boubou S. is a Senegalese widow who sells custom shoes. She lives in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometres from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has been in this business since she was very young. She has not received any previous loans from IMCEC. With this first loan, she hopes to buy shoes from her son, who is a cobbler, in order to re-sell them. With the income from her business, she is able to support herself. Mrs. S. is asking for a special loan from IMCEC. This is called the Kiva Program for the Development of the Child and Famliy (PDEF), and it is designed to help the parents of poor children who are part of the project of the Christian Children's Fund, a partner of IMCEC. The beneficiaries profit from a lowered interest rate.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian tiene 30 años de edad y esta casada con el sr. Francisco Rojas de profesion fletero.  Ellos tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.

La sra. Lilian es propietaria de una despensa. Inicio esta actividad con un pequeño ahorro y luego con la ayuda de su conyuge aumento su capital y fue surgiendo. Actualmente tiene una clientela formada con una antigüedad de 6 años aproximadamente.

Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: vinos, cervazas, cigarrillos y bebidas en general
texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and is married to Francisco Rojas, who transports goods for a living. They have two children who are both school age. Lilian is the owner of a small store. She started her business with the little savings she had, and with her husband’s help she increased her capital, which has risen. She has been in business for about 6 years now and has an established clientele. Lilian is requesting a loan so she can purchase beer, wine, other beverages, and cigarettes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as beer, wine, other beverages, and cigarettes

loans.name: Joseph M.k

texts.en:
Joseph M.K. M. is a commercial driver in Elmina, Ghana. Joseph M.K has completed senior high school. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a seamstress.

Joseph M.K has been a commercial driver since 2008. He is responsible for paying bills. His loan will be used to buy car parts for his business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and build more houses.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy purchase car parts for his business.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: Mr Ousseynou F. est un agent de sécurité qui était à la Direction de l’IMCEC Thiès et qui a été affecté à un autre poste de son service de gardiennage « Dalal Bi » ; avant de s’engager comme gardien il à travaillé sur le chemin de fer Dakar Bamako ou on l’a licencié pour motif économique. Il sollicite ce crédit pour réfectionner sa chambre. Il apporte comme garantie de son crédit son salaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousseynou F. is a security worker who was at IMCEC Management Thiès but who was assigned to another position with his security service "Dalal Bi". Before being hired as a guard, he worked on the Dakar-Bamako railroad and was laid off for economic reasons. He's requesting this loan to make repairs on his room. The loan collateral he brings is his salary.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a room

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro C. tiene 76 años de edad y esta casado con la Sra. Leonidas. Estan casados hace más de 40 años y tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores e independientes.

El Sr. Pedro se dedica hace más de 15 años a la compra venta de carbon, esta actividad lo inicio despues de perder un empleo y con algunos ahorros decidio iniciar dicha actividad, desde ese entonces con el apoyo de su esposa realizan sus ventas a las diferentes despensa, copetines, bares y casas particulares.

Posse gran cantidad de clientela y menciona que apesar de su edad las ganas de trabajar cada mañana es su fiel compañero.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbon.
texts.en:
Pedro C. is 76 years old and is married to Leonidas. They have been married for more than 40 years and have 3 adult children who no longer live with them. For more than 15 years Pedro has purchased and sold charcoal for a living. He started his business after losing his previous job; he had some savings and decided to go into the charcoal business. Since then—and with his wife’s help—he has sold charcoal to various grocery stores, snack bars, bars, and individual households. Pedro has a large number of customers, and says that despite his age he enjoys working every morning. He is requesting a loan so he can purchase more charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Abdou Lahat

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou Lahat D. est un commerçant marié.  Il a commencé le commerce depuis 2002, et son activité consiste à vendre de l’aliment de bétail.  Il a déjà reçu un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et il l’a bien remboursé.  Avec ce deuxième crédit, il va renforcer son activité par reconstituer son stock d’aliments.  Monsieur D. est marié et il habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise il peut soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Lahat D. is a merchant who is married. He has had a business since 2002, and his work involves the feeding of livestock. He received an IMCEC loan before, and he has repaid it. With this second loan, he's going to bolster his business by replenishing his stock of feed. Mr. D. is married, and he lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. With the revenues from his enterprise, he can support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for livestock

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw A. is married with 5 dependents and has received an education through senior high school. Yaw works as a mechanic, and also sells goods such as brake fluid and other spare car parts at Komenda Junction near Elmina, which he has done since 2008. His wife also works as a trader.

Yaw uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees and also the family’s bills. Yaw will use the loan to purchase more car accessories for selling and fixing. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Yaw will use the loan to purchase more car accessories for selling and fixing.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est un boulanger marié de 30 ans qui sollicite son premier crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour acheter une plaque solaire.  Il dit qu’il n’y a pas de l’électricité dans son village de naissance.  Il a trouvé une plaque solaire bon marche, et il veut l’acheter avant qu’elle est vendue à un autre.  Monsieur S. est boulangère depuis 2003 à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Avant de devenir boulangère, il était pâtissier à Diourbel, un village à l’intérieur du pays.  Il a 5 bœufs comme garantie et il va rembourser le crédit avec son salaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye S., age 30, is a married baker who is requesting his first loan from IMCEC and Kiva to buy a solar panel. He says there is no electricity in the village of his birth. He found an inexpensive solar panel, and he want to buy it before it is sold to someone else. Mr. S. has been a baker since 2003 in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Before becoming a baker, he was a pastry chef in Diourbel, an inland village. He has five steers as collateral, and he’s going to repay the loan with his salary.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
