loans.use: To buy a solar panel

loans.name: Medonne

texts.fr: Monsieur Medonne N. sollicite un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour acheter une armoire.  Il travaille comme chauffeur de taxi à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Il y a pleine de taxis à Thiès, et en général chaque client paye 500CFA ($1.00).  Il a déjà reçu un crédit de l’IMCEC qu’il a remboursé un peu en retard, mais le comité de l’IMCEC a décidé qu’il a une bonne moralité et la capacité de rembourser ce crédit.  Monseur N. et marié et âgé de 38 ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Medonne N. is requesting a loan from IMCEC and Kiva to buy an armoire. He works as a taxi driver in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. There are plenty of taxis in Thiès, and in general, each customer pays 500 francs CFA. He has had an IMCEC loan before and has repaid it a bit late. But the IMCEC committee decided he is a man of good character who has the capacity to repay this loan. Mr. N. is married and is 38 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an armoire

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi I. is married with 5 dependents and has received an education through senior high school. Kofi works as a taxi driver at Domenase near Elmina, which he has done since 2000. While Kofi works as a driver, his wife is employed as a trader. Kofi uses his income to pay for the light bill and his children’s school fees.

Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his car. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kofi plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Ndèye Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ndèye Ngoné D. est une Sénégalaise âgée de 61 ans qui vend de l’huile de palme, des poissons secs, des poissons fumés, et des céréales locales.  Elle a fait cette activité depuis 20 ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée, mais elle n’a jamais sollicité un crédit pour renforcer son travail.  Avec ce crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock pour mieux servir ses clients et gagner un bon bénéfice afin d’aider son mari avec les dépenses quotidiennes.  Madame D. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndèye Ngoné D. is a Senegalese woman, 61 years old, who sells palm oil, dried fish, smoked fish, and local grains. She has been in this business for 20 years, so she is very experienced. But she had never before requesting a loan for boosting her work. With the current loan, she’s going replenish her inventory in order to serve her customers better and to earn a good profit, so as to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

Ms. D. is requesting a special IMCEC product, which is called PDEF (the Kiva program for child and family development). It’s for helping the parents of poor children who are in the plan for the Christian Children’s Fund, a partner of IMCEC. Clients benefit from reduced interest rates.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, fish, and local grains

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.es:
El señor Crescencio Ruíz Balbuena tiene 41 años y está acompañado con la señora Vrginia Rotela desde hace 20 años. Tienen un hijo en edad escolar de 6 años de edad.

Empezaron con el negocio desde de que la señora le tuvo al hijo, ya que la misma no podía salir a trabajar fuera de la casa. Empezaron a vender frutas y ensalada de frutas. La señora se desempeñaba como ama de casa y cuidaba de su hijo, como tuvo éxito en la prueba  se animaron a crecer y fueron  adquiriendo más clientes quienes le pedian otras cosas como empanadas, luego verduras, y así poco a poco fueron creciendo con el negocio. Hoy ya cuenta con 6 años de esta actividad y según comenta Don Crescencio le gusta  ya que pueden seguir consrtruyendo y modificando su casa, que con mucho sacrificio empezaron hace un tiempo.
texts.en:
Mr. Crescencio Ruíz Balbuena is 41 years old and is accompanied by Señora Virginia Rotela, his wife of 20 years. They have a school age son six years old. They began the business when Señora Virginia had her son, since at that time she could not leave to work outside of the house. They began to sell fruits and fruit salads. She carried on as home maker and cared for their son. Since Don Crescencio had success in the trial, they were encouraged to grow and continued acquiring more clients who asked them for other things such as empanadas and then vegetables, and so they grew the business little by little. Today they have worked for six years in this business and according to Don Crescencio he likes it since they can continue building and improving their house which, with much sacrifice, they began some time ago.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his store: Consumer products like sugar, breads, meat, milk products, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta D. est une femme divorcée restauratrice depuis 2004, ayant deux enfants en charge. Avec son restaurant elle assure le minimum vital (payer son loyer, sa nourriture et les frais de scolarité des enfants) ; elle loue le restaurant où elle mène ses activités. Le propriétaire des locaux voyant son affaire se développer lui demande de lui rendre son local car il veut mener des activités. Madame Anta est venue voir l’IMCEC pour l’aider à investir sur une surface d’à côté que lui a cédé une de ses relations. Avec son crédit elle va acheter le ciment et la penture, les tables et les chaises, le reste elle va augmenter son fonds de roulement. Le fonds de roulement c’est l’argent avec lequel elle achète le riz, le poisson, la farine, la viande… pour préparer les repas. Ses enfants mangent au restaurant. A chaque jour elle réalise un surplus de 2000 FCFA ($4) qu’elle garde à la banque. Elle aura donc à la fin du mois 60000 FCA ($120), ce qui lui permettra d’honorer ses échéances de remboursements 40 250 FCFA ($80) et de garder en épargne 18 750 FCFA ($20).
texts.en:
Ms. Anta D. has been a divorced woman restauranteur since 2004. She has two children to support. With her restaurant, she ensure a minimal living standard (she pays for her rent, food, and schooling costs for the children). She was renting the restaurant where she operated. The owner of the premises saw her business being developed and asked her to give up the place because he wants to do business.

Ms. Anta came to see IMCEC for help with investing in an adjacent place her relatives let her have. With this loan, she's going to buy cement, paint, tables, and chairs, and the rest will be for augmenting her working capital. This working capital is the money she will use to buy rice, fish, flour, meat... to make meals. Her children eat at the restaurant. Each day, she earns over 2,000 francs CFA that she deposits into a bank. She will then have 60,000 francs at the end of the month, which will enable her to honor her 40,250 francs loan payments and to keep 18,750 francs in savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixed assets for a restaurant

Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las actividades ya mencionados mas arriba.  Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

These women are hardworking and actively engaged in the the activities mentioned below. They are looking for just a little assistance in the form of loans in order to boost their household incomes and improve their quality of life. They need this creditary process in order to invest in their respective lines of work and thus be able to achieve sustainable growth both as a group and on an individual basis. loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza Av. Tacna y cuenta con estudios de 4to grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para la venta de golosinas y gaseosas.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 800.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en mayor cantidad para surtir su negocio.  Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casita ya que actualmente vive en una vivienda alquilada.

Está muy agardecida con Manuela Ramos y manifiesta que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 36, in a common law marriage, and has 5 children. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood on Av. Tacna. She has a 4th grade education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase her capital for her sweets and soft drinks sales. Now she needs a new loan for 800 PEN. She will buy larger quantities of sweets and soft drinks to stock her store. Her biggest desire is to buy herself a little house. She currently lives in a rented home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza  es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Vive en el barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con estudios primarios. 
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor (para venta de carne). 
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará ganado menor.
Su mayor deseo es darle una profesión a sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones  y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 53, lives in a common law marriage, and has 6 children. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood. She has a primary school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy small livestock (to sell the meat). Now she needs a new loan of 2,000 PEN to buy small livestock. Her biggest desire is that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité OÑONDIVEPA de la ciudad de Limpio barrio Piquete Cue actualmente se encuentran en el 4to ciclo del programa de Fundacion Paraguaya. Cabe destacar que el comité en cada seguimiento demuestra muchas ganas de emprender nuevas metodología de actividades. (cumpleaños, rifas, exposiciones entre otras).

La señora Esmilda comenta que a pesar de la crisis financiera el grupo se muestra muy fortalecido, teniendo como valores; la respònsabilidad, puntualidad y confianza. Unas de las actividades mas fuerte desarrolladas es la venta de articulos de primera necesidad, y la fabricacion y venta de comestibles (tarta, tortas, alfajores, sopa.. etc).

El comité OÑONDIVEPA agradece infinitamente a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda, y seguimiento brindada.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia  es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado conviviente con 3 hijos, vive en el barrio Jose Antonio Chávez y cuenta con estudios de 2to de primaria. 
La señora viene trabajando con el MMR hace 1 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de fibra. En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá incrementara su negocio, Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para construir su casa lo que mas le gusta es todo.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 36, has 3 children, and lives with her common law husband in the Jose Antonio Chávez neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. She used her first loan of 500 PEN to increase her working capital for her business of buying and selling wool. She currently needs a new loan for 1,000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her business. Her biggest desire is to keep working to build her house. What she likes the best (about Manuela Ramos) is everything.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Villa Amistad Group

texts.es:
Comité Villa La Amistad se conformó en fecha 18  de diciembre de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora de General la Sra. Candida María P..  Ella se acercó a la asesora en una Renovación de Crédito que la misma tenía en la zona, para averiguar de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya. Una vez enterada logró juntar a 23 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy contentas, ya en el 2º ciclo  del Programa.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de ropas, venta de mercerías, venta de menudencias, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de frutas, venta de calzados, etc.

Todas ellas estan trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria, ayudandose mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.  Realizan actividades para recaudar fondos y asisten semanalmente a las reuniones.

Las integrantes son: 

Candida Pérez	- Venta de ropas.
Limpia Giménez - 	Venta de ropas.
Sonia B.	- Venta de lencerias.
Nimia O.	- Venta de comidas.
Maura M.	- Venta de carne.
Lilian R.	- Venta de frutas
Gumercinda G.	- Venta de menudencias
Jacinta González	- Venta de lencerias
Alicia A.	- Venta de mercerias.
Mirta S.	- Venta de ropas.
Rozana Gómez	- Venta de ropas.
Reinalda C.	- Venta de calzados
Zulma C.	- Venta de mercerias
María G.	- Venta de frutas
Aida C.	- Venta de lencerias
Severiana V.	- Venta de frutas
Arminda González	- Venta de ropas artesanales
Dorila Benítez	- Venta de ropas artesanales
Aureliana N.	- Venta de ropas
Gladyz Cáceres  - 	Venta de productos de limpieza
María Dávalos  - 	Venta de cosméticos
Fidencia G. - 	Venta de menudencias
Nélida D.	- Venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
The Villa La Amistad group formed on December 18, 2008, thanks to the General Director, Candida María P.. She approached the Loan Renewal Advisor in her zone to find out how the Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya works. Once she became informed, she was able to gather together 23 women who are contentedly working, now in the second loan cycle of the program. The average loan per member is 500 PEN, which will be used for different activities such as clothing sales, sale of sewing supplies, sale of edible organ meat, cosmetic and perfume sales, sale of cleaning products, sale of fruit, footwear sales, etc. T hey all work together in a supportive way, mutually helping each other reach the common objectives of their group and the Fundación Paraguaya. They have fund raising activities and attend weekly meetings. The members are: Candida Pérez – Sells Clothes Limpia Giménez - Sells Clothes Sonia B. – Sells Lingerie Nimia O. – Sells Food Maura M. – Sells Meat Lilian R. - Sells Fruit Gumercinda G. - Sells Edible Organ Meat Jacinta González - Sells Lingerie Alicia A. – Sells Sewing Supplies Mirta S. - Sells Clothes Rozana Gómez - Sells Clothes Reinalda C. – Sells Footwear Zulma C. - Sells Sewing Supplies María G. - Sells Fruit Aida C. - Sells Lingerie Severiana V. – Sells Fruit Arminda González – Sells Traditional Clothes Dorila Benítez - Sells Traditional Clothes Aureliana N. - Sells Clothes Gladyz Cáceres – Sells Cleaning Products María Dávalos – Sells Cosmetics Fidencia G. – Sells Edible Organ Meat Nélida D. – Sells Cosmetics

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de ropas, compra de articulos de mercerias, compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, compras de lencerias, compra de frutas y verduras, compra de menudencias, compra de cosméticos y  perfumes, compra de insumos para la elaboración de productos de limpieza, compra de calzados, etc

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es:
La señora Leandra  es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, de estado conviviente con 5 hijos, vive en el barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con estudios de 5to de primaria. 
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de fibra (carne). En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comrpar más carne que pondrá en venta para obtener mejores ingresos.
Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para conseguir mejores mercados y comprarse una casa en Ilave, lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leandra is a member of the God Is Love Communal Bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, province of Collao, department of Puno. She is a common-law wife, is 43 years old, has five children, lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood and has a fifth grade education. She has worked with the Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 10 years and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling fiber (meat). Currently she needs a loan of 1,500 new soles, which will allow her to buy more meat that she can sell to make more income. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get better markets and to buy a house in Ilave. She very much enjoys the Communal Bank meetings and the sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Tesape´ara Group

texts.es:
El Comité Tesape´ara se conformó en fecha 12 de diciembre 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora de General la Sra. Clara Benítez se acercó a la asesora en una Renovación de Crédito que la misma tenía en la zona, para averiguar de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres.  Una vez enterada luego de 3 días apróximadamente, se comunica con la asesora, informándole que logró juntar a 17 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy contentas dentro del Programa.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comestibles, venta de mercerías, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de carbón, venta de ropas de propia fabricación, ect.

Todas ellas estan trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria, ayudandose mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.

Las integrantes son: 

Clara B.	Venta de articulos de mercerias.
Lorenza V.	Costura.
Deisy M.	Copetín.
Marcelina C.	Copetín.
Lourdes D.	Venta de carbón.
María Verón	Venta de comidas y golosinas
Antonia F.	Venta de ropas
Manuela I.	Venta de helados
Claudia Benítez 	Venta de ropas usadas.
Lidia González	Venta de gallinas caceras.
Lorena C.	Venta de comidas.
Rosalia Martínez	Venta de perfumes
Dionicia Martínez	Venta de carbón y copetín
Verónica D.	Venta de lencerias
Nilda E.	Venta de comidas
Celva L.	Venta de ropas
María R.	Venta de ropas
texts.en:
The Tesape´ara group formed on December 12th, 2008, thanks to the General Director, Mrs. Clara Benítez. She approached the Loan Renewal Advisor in her zone to find out how the Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya works. About 3 days after getting the information, she told the advisor that she was able to gather together 17 women who are now contentedly working in the program. The average loan per member is 500 PEN, which will be used for different activities such as food sales, cosmetic and perfume sales, coal sales, homemade clothing sales, etc. They all work together in a supportive way, mutually helping each other reach the common objectives of their group and the Fundación Paraguaya. The members are: Clara B. Sells Sewing Items Lorenza V. Seamstress Deisy M. Local Fast Food Marcelina C. Local Fast Food Lourdes D. Sells Coal María Verón Sells Food and Sweets Antonia F. Sells Clothes Manuela I. Sells Ice Cream Claudia Benítez Sells Used Clothes Lidia González Sells Turkeys Lorena C. Sells Food Rosalia Martínez Sells Perfume Dionicia Martínez Sells Coal and Local Fast Food Verónica D. Sells Lingerie Nilda E. Sells Food Celva L. Sells Clothes María R. Sells Clothes

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing items, ingredients for food preparation, lingerie, clothes, fruit and vegetables, sweets, fabrics and thread to make clothes, coal, perfume, turkeys, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo. Es iletrada (analfabeta).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 año, es socia fundadora e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de carne de chancho y verduras.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles para comprar mayor cantidad de carne y mas verduras y así  ampliar su negocio.
Ella piensa seguir trabajando para su vejez.  Manifiesta que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina is a member of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, province of Collao, department of Puno. She is 68 years old, married, has four children, lives in the May 3rd neighborhood and is illiterate. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years and was a founding member who began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business selling pork and vegetables. Currently she needs a new loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 1,000 new soles to buy a greater quantity of meat and more vegetables, so she can expand her business. She plans on working into old age. She says that she enjoys the communal bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork and vegetables

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La señora Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado conviviente con 2 hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de 3ro de secundaria. 
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace varios años, inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de carne. En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará más carne al por mayor y así obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para conseguir mejores mercados a nivel nacional, lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, encuentros deportivos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asunta is a member of the God Is Love Communal Bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, province of Collao, department of Puno. She is a common-law wife with two children, is 30 years old, lives in the José Antonio neighborhood and had education up to the third year of secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for a few years, and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling meat. Currently she needs a new loan of 2,000 new soles, which she will use to buy more meat at wholesale price and in this way make more income for her family. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get more markets on a national level. The thing she likes best are the Communal Bank meetings, sporting events, and saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada con 2 hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.  La señora viene trabajando con el MMR hace ya 7 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra de fibras de ovino y de alpaca. En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá incrementara su negocio, y así ampliar su negocio ya que ella comprara por mayor las fibras, de primera por lo cual ella obtendrá mayores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Ilave y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y lo que mas le gusta de su grupo son los préstamos, todo en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Concepción is a member of the "Dios es Amor" Community Bank in the Mazo-Cruz District, Collao Province, Pruno Region. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood. She finished primary school. Mrs. Concepción has been working with the MMR (Movimiento Manuela Ramos) organization for 7 years. She began with a loan for 300.00 PEN to increase capital for her business of purchasing wool and alpaca fiber. She currently needs a new loan and will apply for the amount of 3,000.00 PEN. This will allow her to increase business and grow since she will buy the fiber at wholesale. She will receive a greater income for her family. Her biggest wish is to buy a house with a key and educate her children for a profession. What she likes most about her group are the loans and generally everything.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE AND SALE OF ALPACA AND WOOL FIBER

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 52 años de edad, de estado casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive en el barrio Jose A C..  Cuenta con estudios de 5to de primaria. 
La señora Lucia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de fibra (lana de alpaca). 
Con este préstamo de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará fibra (lana de alpaca) para abastecer su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda o un restaurante, ya que el trabajo como acopiador es muy fuerte, lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y los ahorros que ha podido acumular.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 52, married, and has 3 children. She lives in the Jose A. C. neighborhood. She has a 5th grade education. Lucia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital for her business of buying and selling alpaca wool. With this loan of 2,000 PEN she will buy alpaca wool to stock her business. Her biggest desire is to have a store or a restaurant because working as a gatherer is very hard. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings and the savings she has been able to accumulate. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, del distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Posee estudios primarios, ella vive en la comunidad de Casana.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de carne.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de carne y la venderá al por mayor para poder incrementar sus utilidades y generar mas ingresos en su hogar.
Ella  nos comenta que se siente un poco delicada de salud, pero esta muy feliz de pertenecer a su Banco Comunal ya que le gusta la forma de su manejo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Dios es Amor" community bank, which is located in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the suburb of Puno. María is 53 years old and lives with her partner and three children in Casana. She completed her formal education through elementary school. María has worked with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she used to purchase meat. With the current loan of 1000 soles, María plans to purchase more meat, which she will sell wholesale thereby earning a living for her family. María has some minor health problems, but is very glad to be a part of the community bank and thinks it is well-run.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Meat

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos.  Vive en el Barrio 3 D. Mayo y cuenta con estudios D. 1ro D. primaria.

Martha viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 11 años, es socia fundadora e inició sus préstamos con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar víveres para si negocio D. venta D. comidas (alimentos).
En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. 1200.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad D. productos como gaseosas y golosinas, además D. insumos para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.  Su mayor deseo es poner su restaurante o poner una tienda D. venta D. golosinas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank in Mazocruz, Coallo, Puno. She is 54 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in the 3 D. Mayo neighborhood. Martha completed her formal education through elementary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years, and is one of the founding members. With her first loan of 300 soles, Martha was able to purchase foodstuffs to sell. Now she would like another loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to purchase more food, such as soft drinks and sweets to sell. Additionally, Martha plans to purchase ingredients to use in the preparation of food. Her goal is to open a restaurant or a candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, sweets and other foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora  Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, ella es madre soltera , tiene 01 hija y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde que se formó su Banco Comunal eso ya  hace 10 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de golosinas.
Con este préstamo de S/500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en cuotas mensuales, comprará insumos para la elaboración de empanadas y pasteles, negocio al que se dedica actualmente.  Su mayor deseo es poner una pastelería. Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la forma de préstamo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the "Dios es Amor" community bank in Mazo-Cruz, Collao, Puno. She is 31 years old and the single mother of her daughter. Elizabeth completed her formal education through high school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 10 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase soft drinks, which she sold. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Elizabeth will purchase ingredients to make empanadas and baked goods, which is the focus of her current business. Her goal is to open a bakery one day. Elizabeth's favorite thing about the community bank is the access to loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, baking powder, and other ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Delie

texts.en:
Delie S. is managing a small sari-sari store. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband, Bonifacio S., is very supportive of her in her business. In addition to her store, Delie also owns a small rice field. She and her husband till the land and plant rice and vegetables to supplement their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise in her store. She thinks that having a larger display of goods will attract more customers. The loan will really help her family increase their income.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. It helps provide easy credit, training and insurance services to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy  additional stocks of merchandise

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.en:
Felizardo R. is a farmer. He grows rice that he sells by kilogram to his neighbors and rice traders. He is married and has 7 children. When he is not so busy on his farm, he works as a carpenter. The whole village knows that he builds houses, and  makes good furniture. Felizardo works very hard to supplement his income to support his family's needs.

He is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers to use on his crop. Fertilizers are essential to improve the soil condition of his farm. The loan will really help his whole family to have a bountiful harvest. 

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Taim's Group

texts.en:
There are four people requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Battambang. The members have selected Mrs. Taim N., 42, to be the group leader. Mrs. N. raises animals in a stall next to her house for sale. She raises livestock like ducks, chickens, and goats. She will sell all her animals to buyers after they are matured. She is married to Yu, 44, who is a local carpenter. The family have eight children; three of them are employed working in different jobs, whilst the others are students. Mrs. N. is applying for a loan as capital to add to her husband's carpentry business. The other three borrowers are:
N. sells grocery items from her home and she requests a loan to buy a boat for her child to begin fishing.
S. raises poultry from her house and seeks a loan to buy tools for her husband's fishing.
F. is a fish seller who is looking for a loan to purchase a fish boat for her husband's business.

loans.use: To add to her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia L. is a rice grower. She tills a 1 and 1/4 hectare of land that she inherited from her parents. Her farm is a treasure to her family. She wants to make it productive in honor of her parents. Maria Cecilia is 33 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband, Rey L. work very hard to help raise their kids and send them to school. Aside from rice farming, the couple also raise chickens and pigs. Presently, they have 50 native chickens and 4 pigs in their farm. They run multiple businesses in order to supplement their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy  fertilizers and chemicals to use on their rice farm. The loan will really help them increase their yield. It will also help increase their income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mr. Yin H. uses a horse and cart to transport passengers and merchandise around his community. From this service, he makes $5 a day to meet his family's daily living expenses. He is married with two teenage children who are students in the local school. In addition, his wife raises a few pigs at home for sale.

Mr. H. would like a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to establish a rice mill machine to provide a service hulling rice for farmers. The family hopes to earn extra income as the mature rice season is approaching.

Mr. H.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To establish a rice mill machine

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia R. is a seaweed grower. She is 28 years old and has three children. Seaweed is a common type of livelihood on her island. Because of seaweed, more families in Bien Unido Bohol are able to send all their children to school and become successful. She was a student but she married so early she was not able to finish her education. She wants to provide a good future for her children. Her children will be the ones to realize what she failed to achieve. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings. The loan will help increase the size of her seaweed farm. The loan will also help her increase her income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn H. owns a mini store. Her friends, neighbors and passersby are her regular customers. She is 18-years old, a resident of Oroquieta City and married with one child. She is a housewife and her husband works as a private employee.

Genalyn plans to expand her store with the loan she was able to obtain from Paglaum. She started her store with very little money, and now she needs additional capital. She dreams of a better home for her family and wants her business to be more profitable and successful.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for a store

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som L. is 57 years old and the widowed mother of four children. Three of her children are working at different jobs, while the other one attends school. She currently earns her daily income by making Khmer cakes for sale. The cake is made from rice, pork, banana etc.... Most of her buyers are neighbors who live near her house. As another source of the family's income, she cultivates crops on her farmland located in the village. In the past, L. always hired the villager's cow to plow the field. She will use the loan to buy a cow so that the loan will help her reduce the cost of plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Arolyn

texts.en: Arolyn M. sells pigs at the public market as well as in neighboring towns and to her neighbors. She is a 44-year old housewife, married with four children, and resides in Mobod, Oroquieta City. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker (OFW). She plans to expand her piggery and wishes to buy more piglets and pig supplements. She wants to see her business expand so that her family can live comfortably in the future.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig supplements

loans.name: Jubilee

texts.en: Mrs. Jubilee A. is 22-years old, a resident of Misom, Misamis Occidental, and married to Jade A.. She is a new member of PMPC and is currently requesting her first loan. Her proposed project is to start-up a cellphone load retail business near the highway where there is easy access for customers. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver.

loans.use: Start up capital for load retailer

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 47-year-old and a resident of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a private employee of MOELCI-I and they are blessed with three children. Her eldest daughter is a graduate of education and the other two are still in elementary school. Recently, she applied for her fifth loan cycle in the amount of Php 4,500 for her rice-production business and to purchase fertilizer. Her ambition is to help her two children who are still in elementary school finish college. And for her proposed project, she's hoping that it will be a success and grows bountifully so that it could help support their daily needs.

loans.use: Capital for rice production and fertilizer

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthy P., 34, and her husband, Mr. Samorn Seng, 35, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of the children attend school.
 
Kunthy has been selling fish since 1996. Her husband assists his wife in the fish-selling business. He is also a silk weaver. They hope to support their children's further education. Kunthy is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to carry fish that she has for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mr. Suong P., 28, owns a garage to repair vehicles. He started his investment in 2005. His wife's name is Nang. She is 18. They have just married and have one lovely young child who is still not enrolled in school. The family has been facing difficulty with transportation for a long time. They need to pay a lot for taxis. Therefore, Mr. P. has decided to seek an $1100 loan in order to purchase a car for his family's needs as well as use it to support his business activities. (P.'s wife is pictured because he was not available that day.)

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Koeuth

texts.en: Mrs. Koeuth K. is 48 years old and married with five children. Most of her children are still minors and under her care. One of her teenage sons works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh City. K. uses a pigpen next to her house to raise pigs for sale. In addition, her husband works as a domestic carpenter. Beside this, the family also cultivates rice for extra income. To make transportation easier for farming work, K. is applying for a loan to buy an ox-cart.

loans.use: To buy an ox-cart

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy K. is 48 years old and a resident of the province of Kompong Tom. Here she helps with her family's expenses by selling fritters. She earns a profit of $1.50 per day. She is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children; four of them are employed at different jobs, and the other one attends school. The family members purposed to build a house because their house is too old but due to the family's financial problems they can't make that possible. Therefore, Mrs. K. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoy H. (on the right) was selected by members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

1-Mrs. Hoy H., 51, and her husband, Mr. Mon Sok, 53, were married in 1973 and have six children; two sons and four daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; three children are garment factory workers, one son is a construction worker and another one attends school. Hoy stays at home to take care of her house. The main income is from her husband’s business; he drives a motor remoque taxi. (Remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back). Hoy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase one secondhand motorbike for her son to drive to work.

2-Mrs. Chantha N., 40, and her husband, Mr. Samomm Pol, 44, were married in 1986 and have two daughters, both are in school. Chantha has been selling grocery items for five years. Her husband is a policeman. She is also requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Mr. Piseth H., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sochan Keo, 34, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have one daughter, who is in grade 7.

Piseth has been a policeman for six years. His wife is a Trai producer (Trai is a kind of Buddhism material that Cambodian people use for a traditional ceremony in Buddhism.) She buys elements from the market in Phnom Penh to make Trai and also sells at the market in Phnom Penh.

Piseth wants to runs another motor taxi (tuk tuk) business to earn extra income to support his family. That is why he is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to connect with his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motor taxi (tuk tuk)

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Mr. Chourn T., 40, lives with three other family members in a medium-sized wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia. T. and his wife are local rice farmers. In addition, they sell firewood, as well as raising pigs near their house. The modest couple works hard at their businesses every day because they have a goal of making income to meet their two teenage children's needs.

In order to alleviate the family's physical labor, T. would like a loan to purchase a water buffalo to help with the farm work and to rent out to the other farmers for additional income. (Mr. T.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mr. Srun D., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Vouch Sin, 53, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1977 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home; two daughters are garment factory workers; one son is a musician and another one attends school.

Srun has been a flat-tire fixer at his house for two years while his wife has been selling groceries for four years. She buys grocery items from the market for re-sale at her house. Their house is very old and broken in some parts so that's why they decided to build a new house to live in, but it isn’t finished yet. Srun is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to build his new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn N. (shown in the picture with her son), 57, is a widow with seven children: five sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one son is a security guard, and another son is a policeman. The family live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yorn has been growing rice for twenty-six years. She grows rice in her farmland near her village. She is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay fees for plowing.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Soun S. and her husband. Mrs. S. owns a machine to provide a service charging batteries, from which she generates an income of US$ 5 per day. Almost all of her customers are neighbors. To help meet the family's daily needs a little better, her husband drives a motor taxi. Besides their daily works, the family also are domestic rice cultivators.

Because the business of battery-charging is a profitable one and gaining more customers, S. needs to take out a loan to use as additional capital in order to purchase one more charging machine.

loans.use: To purchase one more charging machine

loans.name: Bilsam

texts.en:
Bilsam B. is a rice grower. He is 38 years old and the father of three children. He wants to provide for all the needs of his family especially now that all the children are going to school. He was a tourist driver before. For 13 years, Bilsam worked very hard as a driver until he met his wife, Deborah, and got married. 

In his desire to be a good husband and father, Bilsam invested much in rice farming. His harvest is what he uses to buy all their needs. He also saves some rice for their own consumption. Now, he needs a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides and other farm inputs.

CEVI aims to help small businesses like his grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, fungicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men M., 53, and her husband, Mr. Touk Ros, 48, were married in 1984 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Men has been selling fish and eggs for twenty years. Her husband has been raising ducks for four years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 for her husband to raise ducks.

loans.use: To use for raising ducks.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel R. has a farm. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children. She loves to grow plants. That is why her parents gave her a piece of land where she could plant any crops that she wants. She is a rice grower. She reserves most of the harvest for their own consumption. The remainder is what she sells to her neighbors and rice traders. 

The reason why she wants a loan is to sustain her farm. She needs financial assistance of Php 8,000 to purchase 8 sacks of complete fertilizer. The amount is quite big and CEVI is her only chance.

CEVI aims to help small businesses like hers grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of complete fertilizer

loans.name: Sovanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovanny Y., 36, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Phom, 38, who live along National Road Number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. 

Sovanny stays at home to take care of her children and her house. Her husband has been driving for one company in Phnom Penh for four years. The couple is in the process of building their new house but still have some of it left to finish. So Sovanny is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish her house.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Тураходжаева рафоат незакончив свой первый кредит  хочет опять в кредит установить пластиковые окна и двери. Она  первый свой займ удачно погашает и рада что успешно отремонтировала свою квартиру. Она работает в центре здоровья старшей медсестрой. Её сын работает водителем ректора университета. Он помогает ей во время погашения, т.к. заработная Рафоат очень низкая ей необходима помощь со стороны родных. Рафоат благодарна за поддержку и доверие всем инвесторам KIVA.
texts.en:
Although Rafoat T. has not completely paid back her first loan, she would like to take out another loan to install plastic windows and doors. She has successfully paid down her first loan and is happy with the repairs made to her apartment. She holds the post of senior nurse at a health center. Her son work as a driver for the rector of the university. He has helped her to pay down the loan on time, since Rafoat's wages are low and she has had to accept assistance from her relatives. Rafoat is grateful for the support and the trust of Kiva investors.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of plastic windows and door

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena O. is a rice farmer. She is 52 years old, married and has no children. Her business is doing well. She and her husband manage a small hectare of land which they use to earn a bigger income for their needs. Magdalena is also helping her siblings who have their own family. She also has a sari-sari store. She is doing multiple businesses to supplement their income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The loan will really help the couple achieve maximum yield from their farm. The loan will help increase their income.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. CEVI gives not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheun T., 67, and her husband, Mr. Phat Tol, 70, were married in 1959 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home, one son is a construction worker and one daughter is a silk weaver. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pheun and her husband have been farming for ten years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to use for farming and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To use for farming and to buy silk for her daughter’s weaving business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. owns a small parcel of land in Agusan Del Sur (somewhere in Mindanao). She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She has been farming since she was single. Because her husband is a farmer, both of them manage their small farm. Aside from her rice farm, she also manages a small sari-sari store in their village. She sells a variety of goods to supplement their income.

Marilyn is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seed. The loan will help increase her yield. The loan will also help them to increase their income.


CEVI aims to help small business to grow. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз Шарипов мужчина 43 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Азиз закончив среднюю школы , поступил в высшее учебное заведение и окончил по специальности инженера.Сейчас по специальности работает на заводе главным инженером по сборке оборудований.Кроме своей работы он занимается производством цементных кирпичей.У него своя мини фабрика на которой работают два ученика.Азиз хочет получив кредит закупить оптом цемент и битый песок.И использовать для производства продукции в сезон.Азиза жена работает учительницей в средней школе, её заработная плата очень низкая и не хватает для обеспечения хотя бы одеждой своих детей.Поэтому у Азиза много расходов на семью.
texts.en:
Aziz S. is a 43-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Aziz graduated from high school, and went on to complete his higher education and graduate in engineering. Now he works as the chief engineer at an equipment assembly plant. In addition to this job, he manufactures cement blocks. He has his own mini-factory and employs two apprentices. Aziz would like to take out a loan to purchase cement and aggregate wholesale, and use it for the manufacture of seasonal products. Aziz's wife works as a secondary school teacher, but her salary is low, insufficient even for buying clothes for their children, therefore Aziz has many family expenses.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brick manufacturing

loans.name: Fedilita

texts.en:
Fedilita S. is a rice farmer. She is 32 years old and has two children. Her husband, Astrolovio S., is also a farmer. Together, they never mind the hard labor, feeling the heat of the sun and touching the wet soil to ensure food for the family. Farming is their only source of living. Their harvest enables them to easily feed and clothe their children.

Fedilita is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seed and insecticides. The loan will help a lot to increase her yield. It will really help her to increase her income.

Fedilita has been a CEVI client for a long time already. She is provided not just with loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seed and insecticides

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. spends most of her time on her farm. She is 64 years old, married, and has four children. She wants to grow her business to have enough funds to support her children who are starting to build their own families. Her husband is still strong and is helping her on the farm. They also grow vegetables to supplement their income.

Rosita is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seed. She needs financial assistance to continue her business. Farming is her only livelihood. The loan will really help her sustain her business.


CEVI is helping a lot of people to start and have their own business. It provides not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en:
Leonito B. grows rice for a living. He is 38 years old and has six children. "I am the head of the family. I should provide all my family needs," he said. Leonito has been a farmer since he was single when his parents taught him everything about how to farm. Now, he wants to grow his farm so as to easily send his children to school.

Leonito is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seed, herbicides and pesticides for his farm. The loan will help him increase his yield. It will also help him increase his income.


CEVI aims to help small business grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance overage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seed, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Sadriniso

texts.ru:
Садринисо Азизова добрая трудолюбивая женщина, проживает в городе Истаравшане с мужем Юсуфджоном и 4 детьми. 
 Садринисо занимается животноводством уже 5 лет. Хочет увеличить домашний скот, и с этой целью обратилась в "Микроинвест".
 Кроме этого, она выращивает деревья грецкого ореха у себя дома, перебирает его, после чего муж Юсуфджон продает орехи на рынке. Но ассортимент их товара не состоит только из грецкого ореха, муж Садринисо привозит другие виды сухофруктов из городов Канибадама и Исфары и продаёт их на рынке своего города. 
 Еще один доход в их семью приносит исскуство вышивания. Садринисо вместе со своей дочкой Мехрангиз вышивает национальные тюбитейки,спрос на которых возрастает в сезон свадеб.
texts.en:
Sadriniso A. is a kind and hardworking woman, living in the city of Istaravshan with her husband Usufdjon and four children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years. She wants to increase her livestock headcount and reached out to MicroInvest for this purpose. Besides this business, Sadriniso also grows walnut trees at home, sorts the walnuts, and then her husband Usufdjon sells them at a market. However, their goods assortment does not only include walnuts, but also dried fruits that Usufdjon brings from the cities of Kanibadam and Isfara and sells at their city market. Embroidery also brings in an additional income for the family. Together with her daughter Mehrangiz, Sadriniso embroiders tubeteikas (traditional hats) that are in high demand especially during a wedding season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Сангинова Мавлуда кредитор в Микроинвест с 2002 года. Она  занимается продажей детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама, в город Истарашан. Свои кредиты погашает хорошо без проблем. Хотя замечает что торговля стала чуть медленнее. Поэтому Мавлуда получив очередной кредит хочет пополнить свой ассортимент новыми товарами. У Мавлуды остаток весенне- летнего товара осталось маловато. Она надеется , что при увеличении выбора товара у неё реализация пойдёт на рост , т.е. поток клиентов увеличится.
texts.en:
S. Mavluda is a client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is selling children's clothing. She travels for the merchandise herself to Istarashan. She pays off her loans without any problems. Although she has noticed that sales are lower now. This is why Mavluda wants to use this loan to add some new assortment to her inventory. She has a little bit of the spring-summer clothing left. She hopes that by increasing the variety and choice of her inventory she will sell it faster and the flow of customers will increase.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina G. is rice farmer. She is 28 years old and has 1 child. She is married to a farmer, Archie G.. They want to provide, for their child, a bright future so they are working very hard to supplement their income. Divina is aiming to send her child to college, a dream that she failed to achieve herself.

She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 (USD 225) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She needs financial assistance in her farm especially since the costs have increased. The loan will really help to increase her income even more.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help small business to grow. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilzers and seeds for farming rice.

loans.name: Manuel Jr.

texts.en:
Manuel A., Jr. is a farmer. He got his name from his father, who is also a farmer. He is 25 years old and has 1 child. He believes that the real treasure is in the soil. Manuel is working very hard to support his family.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 (USD 225) from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. He will also buy rice seeds for his farm. The loan will really help him increase his yield. It will help him increase his income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly A. is a rice farmer. She is 43 years old and has 2 children. She has loved growing plants ever since she was just a small child. She plants flowers, vegetables and now rice. She is married to a farmer, Daniel A.. She wants to expand her farm to support her family’s needs well.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 (USD 125) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. Specifically, she will buy sacks of fertilizers and fungicides and seeds. The loan will really help her family increase their harvest.

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, fungicides and seeds for rice farming.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is a rice farmer. She is 60 years old and has 7 children. She is already a widow as her husband died from an illness. Though she is old, she is still strong and able to do business. Presently, her children are helping her on their farm. She hires laborers to work in her rice field.

She is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 (USD 125) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and fungicides. The loan will help improve the soil condition of the farm. Moreover, it will help to protect her rice from insects. 

CEVI aims to help small business like hers to grow. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and fungicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is a rice grower. She is 51 years old and has 8 children. Her husband, David G., manages their farm. Everyday, they go out to the field and check their crop. They enjoy tilling the soil and they work under the heat of the sun to provide food for their children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 (USD 225) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 5 sacks of complete fertilizers and seeds. This loan will help her increase her yield. She believes that her loan will also bring her more income.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of complete fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Mrs. Dim H. is 27 years old and a resident of the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns an income by making furniture for sale including those made from rattan. She usually sells her wares in bulk to her regular buyers who come to buy at her house, and they order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband is skilled as a carpenter and helps her in making furniture as well.

The couple has two young children who are still living in the family home. Because the family's house is too old and is collapsing frequently, Mrs. H. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 to add to her personal savings in order to build a new house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
Шавкат Шеров мужчина 29 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Женат имеет 4 детей. Шавкату нужны деньги для посева и выращивания кукурузы, он считает что сумма 1500 сомони вполне хватит для того, чтобы  вырастить кукурузу.
 Дополнительный доход в его семью приносит скот, откормом и  купле-продажей, которого он занимается, и выращивает несколько сортов винограда. Помогает ему в этом его отец.
texts.en:
Shavkat S. is a 29 year old man, he works in agriculture. He is married and has 4 children. Shavkat needs money in order to plant and grow corn. He believes that a sum of 1500 somoni is quite enough in order to grow corn. Livestock brings supplemental income to his family, he fattens and purchases and resells it. He also grows several varieties of grapes. His father helps him with this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting corn

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., 37, is a divorced mother of five children who are single and living in the family home. Presently, she uses the raw materials that she obtains from the forest to braid mats for sale. That generates an income of $2.50 per day to feed her five children.

Mrs. L. has been widely known for a long time as skilled in raising pigs. Because of financial problems, she could not afford to raise pigs since her income is just enough for the basic needs of her family. Hence, Mrs. L. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva as capital to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem C. is a farmer in Sophy village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she earns a little income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her cost of plowing.

Her husband, Mr. Yin Ry, is a construction worker. Mrs. Yoem C. is 45 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer. Another two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her cost of plowing

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Mrs. Neng N. is a villager in Trapaing Cham Bork village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Seak Vibol, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard they still don't earn enough income to support their family.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Neng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou Y. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller. She is 56 years old and a widow who has five children, four of whom are married and employed at different jobs, whilst the other one is a student. She currently sells her items, such as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids, to the villagers and passers-by.

Y. requested a loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell. She is a person living in a rural area of Kompong Tom province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза-молодая девушка 22-х лет,замужем,детей пока не имеет.Занимается продажей конфет,печенья,cахара и других сладостей на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Один раз в неделю она вместе с мужем Шукурулло привозит товар с города Худжанда.В данный момент они имеют прилавок на продовольственном рынке.Шахноза мечтает расширить свой товарооборот и в будущем открыть собственный продуктовый магазин.Она рада,что кредитуется в нашей организации и рекомендует нас свом соседям по бизнесу.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young 22 year old woman; she is married and does not have children yet. She sells candy, cookies, sugar and other sweets at the food market in the Spitamen region. Once a week she, with her husband, Shukurullo, bring products from the city of Khujand. Right now they have a sales location at the food market. Shahnoza dreams about growing her turnover and opening her own food store in the future. She is happy to get credit from our organization and recommends us to her business neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of sweets

loans.name: Mr. Sophal Uy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of twenty-four members is located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Sophal U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. B. Sary, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables.

In their growing, they face an obstacle because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mr. Sophal U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. hoses, and he would use the rest of money to cultivate rice. He is 45 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is a construction worker while two others are farmers; two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy hoses and  cultivate rice

loans.name: Olarinwaju

texts.en: Olarinwaju is a mother of six and she is 53 years old and married to O.. She sells kitchen utensils and gift items. Olarinwaju hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 58 years old and married with 4 children. She sells mattresses, pillows and pillowcases and she started this business twenty-seven years ago. Lola hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more mattresses to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Gnoem

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 27, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling a few grocery items from her house for her neighbors. She has a long experience in this business. S. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and also attend school. Her husband has owned a machine to charge the villagers' batteries to earn income for the family.

The family's living conditions are not so comfortable because the roof of their house is leaky during rains. Because of this problem, S. has requested a loan to replace their old roof.

loans.use: To replace their old roof

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi sells crates of drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is 42 years old and married to O. who is a printer and they have three children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin purchases crates of eggs from poultry farms and sells to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business six years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Toyin is 47 years old and married with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary purchases crates of eggs from poultry farms and sells them to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business seven years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Mary is 52 years old and married with five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Mr. Nan Chhoem's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-seven people living in Preak Svay village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Nan C. is the 28-year-old village bank president. He is employed in a garment factory. His wife, Mrs. Hor Nary, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice.

In this plantation, she needs the money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, Mr. Nan C. decided to ask for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Biola

texts.en: Biola sells crates of drinks in retail and wholesale. Biola hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Biola is 40 years old and married to A. who is a cobbler and they have two children. She says Thank You to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah I. sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Deborah is 38 years old and married with a child. She promises to repay her loan promptly. She says Thank You to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Marry's Group

texts.en:
Marry Muya, age 40, is single with two children, age 17 and 14.  She sells ladies' pants and perfumes from door to door. She started her business eight years ago and she works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $147.

This will be Marry’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to increase her capital so she can buy more items for her business.
	
Marry will share this loan with her loan group, Blue, which has 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Marry is second from right in the 1st row.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' pants and perfumes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 32 years old and married with three children. Juliana sells crates of drinks. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell. Stella is 32 years old and married to P. who owns a restaurant. They have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Lizzy sells gallons of palm oil. Lizzy hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. Lizzy is 50 years old and married to U. who is a retired teacher. They have four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Onyinyechi

texts.en: Onyinyechi is 27 years old and married with two children. She sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken, etc. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily sells sarongs. She travels once every month to Cotonou to purchase sarongs to sell in Lagos state, Nigeria. Emily is 40 years old and married with three children.

Emily hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch S. lives in a medium-sized wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia. Here he uses a plot of land to grow a rice crop. Beside this, he raises pigs in a stall next to his house as well as holding a job as a local carpenter. His wife is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals, cares for the children and helps him in the business as well. The family have four children: two are married and the other two are single and are employed at different jobs.

The rice farming season is coming and the family is lacking capital to grow rice this season. Therefore, Mr. S. would like a loan to pay for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the farmland

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and is a widow with four children. She sells secondhand underwear. She has been in this business for a long time.

She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more secondhand underwear to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand underwear to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester P. is a 50 year old woman from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter with one child who just graduated in a computer course. Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in snack vending to be of assistance in finances, specifically in their basic daily needs and school allowances.

Mrs. P. is in her 7th loan cycle, requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00. Her loan is intended for additional capital for snack vending. Her regular customers are her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs, and having money for their old age.
