loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack vending business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 44 years old and has six children. She is married to O. who is a dock worker at the sea port. Rosemary sells drinks and pepper soup. Rosemary hopes for a loan of  N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 37 years old and married with no children. She sells shoes and clothes. She has been in this business for  the past four years. Ngozi hopes for a loan of  N50,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lita J. is a 61-year-old from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married to a farmer and blessed with nine children: seven married; two single and studying.

She started her business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she is able to acquire additional capital for her sari-sari store (general store). She is coping well with the challenges of her business because it requires hard work and patience. Determination in life is what she has. Heart’s desire is to expand the business so that the children will be able to finished college and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en: Rashidatu is 32 years old and married with two children. Rashidatu sells crates of drinks. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma L., 61, is the mother of two children, both of whom have completed college. They live in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn income, she and her husband make and sell pancakes, a business that allowed them to send their children to school.

Recently, Norma decided to establish a little "sari-sari" (variety) store, the income from which she feels will meet their daily needs and reduce their workload now that they are approaching old age.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy supplies for the sari-sari store.

loans.name: Adefusi

texts.en: Adefusi sells drinks and pure water. She hawks (sells door-to-door) her drinks and pure water. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. She is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San Y., 52, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Saing, 54, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons do construction work with their father, and the other two children assist their mother in her farming business.

San has been a farmer for twenty years. Her husband has been a wooden-house builder for three years. The couple is in the process of building a new house but they lack some money to finish it. So San is asking for a loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase construction materials to finish her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is 35 years old and married to S.. They have two children. She sells body creams and soap. She travels to Cotonou to purchase body cream and soap to sell in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Saidat hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more body cream and soap to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream and soap to sell

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Yen Pich, 39, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school. Her husband has been driving a horse and cart in his village for one year.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver for nineteen years; she sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase silk to continue her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun T., 55, and her husband, Mr. Khom Moun, 56, live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1972 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other two weave silk at home. Mr. Khom has been growing rice since 1980.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting her second loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S., 57, and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, 59, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1962 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. All of their children are married, one of whom lives with the family. Her husband has been a primary school teacher since 1983.

Kheng has been selling silk products for fifteen years. She buys the goods from the local villagers and then resells them in other provinces. Now Kheng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells frozen foods and ice cubes. She has been in this business for the past three years. Florence hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. Florence is 38 years old and married with five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mrs. S. was born in 1980 and is a resident of the city of Phnom Penh. Since 2004, she has worked as a security guard for a garment factory. She gets a salary of $90 a month. Her husband's name is Mr. Vibol, age 28, who works as an internal staff member for a company. The couple have been married for years but have no children.

The couple saw that their neighbor's investment in selling groceries is a profitable one and an easy way to gain additional income. Therefore, S. would like a $1100 loan from Kiva's partner HKL. With the money, she will be able to afford to purchase grocery items to sell at her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Onyebuchi

texts.en:
Buchi has a chemist shop where he sells medicines. He has the only chemist shop in his community. The demands for his medicines are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

Buchi hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Buchi is 27 years old and single. He is an active LAPO client. He says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Senghai Kheng, 45, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have two children: one son is in primary school and one daughter who is in grade 11 and who also assists her mother in her weaving business when she has free time.

Touch has been a silk weaver for twenty-three years. It’s a skill she learned from her aunt. Her husband is a bicycle repairer. She hopes to set up one more loom for her daughter to use to get more extra income so she is applying for a loan of $400 to use for this purpose and to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and to set up one more loom for her daughter to weave.

loans.name: Mrs. Samorn Ean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Roteang village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Samorn E. is a 23 year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Y. Ratha, is a fisherman who catches fish to sell for an income.

Although Mrs. Samorn E. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family. Additionally, they have difficulty to live at night because they do not have enough money to use electricity and to buy a battery to light the house.

In order to light the house, Mrs. Samorn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a battery for her family to use in the house. Mrs. Samorn E. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mr. Sokhoeun N. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a battery for her family to use in the house.

loans.name: Saima M. Nasir Group

texts.en:
My name is Saima, a 24-year-old married lady. For the past five years I have resided in a two-room brick house in Lahore, a Pakistani city famous for its historical sites and its Punjabi foods. I completed my education till 10th standard but couldn’t study further because my parents married me off to a resident of Lahore. His name is M. N. who, for the past two years, has operated a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), an arrangement requiring him to pay half his income to the owner.

I am a mother of two daughters, neither of whom attends school because my husband’s income is inadequate. But I now have started a beauty parlor because I want to give my daughters an education so that they can have secure futures and independent lives. I have repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and am now applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for my husband so that he will get the whole income from his struggle.

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Bushra baji and Hamidan baji and Shamshad baji each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering businesses. Nasreen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Suliat

texts.en:
Suliat is a fashion designer and she also sells school sandals. She is 38 years old and married to K. who is also a fashion designer. They have two children.

Suliat is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more school sandals to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more school sandals to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells crates of drinks. She has been in this business since 2004. Taiwo is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Taiwo is 36 years old, married to A., with whom she has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sokvun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvun V., 22, and her husband, Mr. Nak Nheb, 24, were married in 2003 and have two sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokvun has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years. He is a silk weaver as well. Sokvun is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Naseem Jaffran Allah Baksh Group

texts.en:
Naseem Jaffran is fifty years old and has resided in Lahore, Pakistan, for the last eight years. She is an uneducated lady, but she knows the value of education. She is married to A. B., whose business is selling motor oil. He buys the oil from different cities and sells to motor repair shops. Naseem baji is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others work in a factory for monthly wages. She is a seamstress by profession. She sews clothes by taking in orders from her neighbors and relatives. She saves her income and plans to marry off her elder son with that money. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a field partner of Kiva). Now she is applying again for a loan to build up her husband’s motor oil business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy decoration pieces to sell. Razia bji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shafqat baji wants a loan to buy men's and women's readymade garments that she will sell. Ishtiaq begum baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shuttering business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy motor oil to resell.

loans.name: Tola

texts.en: Tola sells drinks. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more drinks to sell. Tola, 38 years old, is married to A. and they have two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy C. (pictured with her niece), 31, and her husband, Mr. Ream Ros, 32, were married in 2002. They live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have no children yet. 

Channy has been a silk weaver for ten years. She sells her finished products to the middle-man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Ream Ros has been a wooden house builder for three years; he does his work in Kampong Cham province, which is far away from his house. He hopes to expand his business but he doesn’t have enough materials for his work. This is why Channy is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to help her husband to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s building business.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a hair stylist and she also sells drinks and hair extensions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. Kehinde is 47 years old, married and she has four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Koné est âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle  vit  avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales elle n’est pas allée à l’école. Très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus   apprises  auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour  la vente du bois de chauffe il y a 5 ans. Il est à noter que Fatoumata a 20 ans d’expérience dans le commerce d’articles divers.  Le bois est l’un des éléments essentiels pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation (cuisine). 
Dans le souci de constituer un stock important de bois de chauffe en vu de prévenir  l’hivernage où   la rupture du  bois de chauffe est très cruciale, elle décide de  rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Madame Fatoumata  envisage utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  2 chargements de  camion remorque en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des villages  environnants  de Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte au quartier Kôkô. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des d’intérêts du prêt, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Koné, age 40, is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in the Kôkô district, in Koutiala prefecture (Region of Sikasso). For societal reasons, she did not go to school. She soon got interested in revenue-generating work, something she learned from her mother. After having tried several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she ended up five years ago opting to sell firewood. It should be noted that Fatoumata has 20 years of experience in the commerce of various goods. Firewood is one of the essential elements for women in Mali when preparing food.

Concerned about building a sizable stock of firewood in anticipation of the off-season, when firewood shortages are crucial, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan.

Ms. Fatoumata envisions using this loan to buy two truckloads of firewood from rural producers around Koutiala. She makes her sales in front of her doorway, in the Kôkô district.

She plans to realize a profit of 150,000 franc CFA per month that will be used to make loan interest payments, to help cover day-to-day family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.ru: Абдумавлон – мужчина 49 лет. Вдовец. У него 1 сын. У него среднее образование.  Абдумавлон занимается откормом и продажей скота. У Абдумавлон есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Абдумавлон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдумавлона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдумавлон за этот займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдумавлон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что Абдумавлон думает что кредит ему поможет.
texts.en:
Abdumavlon is a 49 year old man. He is a widower. He has 1 son. He has a high school education. Abdumavlon fattens and sells livestock. Abdumavlon has a flock of small livestock composed of approximately 35 sheep and 15 goats. Abdumavlon takes the flock out to the mountains every morning, tends it and in the evening brings it back. For now, Abdumavlon has few heads of large livestock, but he would like to use this loan to purchase two medium bulls. After fattening them for 3-4 months he will be able to sell them for a very good price. Abdumavlon is very happy to work with us, because he thinks that the credit will help him.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell cattle

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 54 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and juice. Theresa is an active LAPO client. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en: C. is 29 years old and resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She lives with four members of her family: her husband and her three children. Her children attend school. She makes a daily income by distilling wine to sell. She uses the leftover wine to fatten the family's pigs that she also raises. Her husband assists her in the business. Mrs. C. will use the first cycle loan with Kiva to buy rice for distilling wine and to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy rice and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nasreen Khanum Mansor Lal Khan Group

texts.en:
Nasreen khanum baji is fifty-two years old and has resided in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last twenty-five years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She is a widow with three sons. Her elder son operates a shuttering business and the others work as policemen. Nasreen baji operates a business sewing clothes, and she also embroiders dresses. She takes orders from her neighbors and charges them $2 per item. She is applying for a loan for her elder son because he wants to buy wood to increase his shuttering business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy material (tent, table covers and chairs) for her catering business. Farzana khatoon baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Anayatan baji wants a loan to buy bicycles' spare parts to sell. Faiz ilahi baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for shuttering business.

loans.name: Kort

texts.en:
Mrs. V. Kort, 40, and her husband, Mr. Pisey Sem, 43, were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children attend school and another one is still young. The family lives in a small village on National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

V. has been a farmer for almost 20 years and she has been cutting grass to sell for cows’ feed for six years. For the past 18 years, Mr. Pisey Sem has been a mason. He doesn’t have enough materials to work so they are requesting a loan of US$400 in order to purchase construction tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi is 42 years old, married, and has two daughters. She sells eggs to people in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more eggs to sell. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира Очилова  замужем, имеет сына и дочь, ей 32 года. 10 лет как Мунира выходит на рынок только по пятницам в городе и воскресенье на  большой базар в Кайраккуме. Она торговала мелочами: заколки и прочие бижутерии, и небольшой товар с детскими одеждами. Теперь получив кредит от кива в микроинвесте она приобрела постоянную точку в большом рынке не далеко от  города, где многие оптовики оптом закупают товар. Её товар  мужская  одежда, в настоящее время  летняя одежда. Зимой она продаёт зимнюю мужскую одежду(джемпер, брюки). Она своевременно погашает кредит и получала новые займы.
texts.en:
Munira O. is married and has a son and a daughter. She is 32 years old. For ten years, Munira went to the city market only on Fridays, and on Sundays to the big bazaar in Kayrakkum. She sold small items: hair accessories and other jewelry, small goods and children's clothing. Having taken out a loan with Kiva at MicroInvest, she has now acquired a permanent sales outlet at the large market not far from her town, where many wholesalers purchase goods in bulk. She now sells men's clothing, and at the present time, summer clothing. Over the winter she sold men's winter clothing (sweaters and slacks). She makes her loan payments in a timely fashion and has received new loans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke sells drinks and provisions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (US$ 975) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. She says thanks to all.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Imtiaz Manzoor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz baji has lived in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last thirty-five years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he has a shuttering business. He has four years of experience in this business. Imtiaz baji is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. Her elder son helps his father in his shuttering business, the second has a lathe business and the third son runs a paint business. The others are students at a school located near her house. Imtiaz baji operates an embroidery business. She embroiders dresses to order for her neighbors. She uses her income to pay off her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy wood to enlarge her husband’s shuttering business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Rubina shaheen baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shuttering business. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron chains, which she will sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for shuttering business.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors S., age thirty-five, and her husband, Leang Lao, age thirty-eight, were married in 2006 and have one young daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophors has been selling flowers at the market in Phnom Penh for five years. Leang Lao has been driving a motor taxi for fifteen years. However, his old motorbike broke and he wants to replace it with a new motorbike in order to continue his business. Sophors is requesting a loan of $300 to buy the motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband’s motor taxi business.

loans.name: Memunat

texts.en: Memunat sells tubers (yams). The demands for her yams is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (US$ 975) to purchase more yams to sell. Memunat is 47 years old, a widow and she has five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Zahida Parveen M.riaz Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen baji has lived with her husband in a city called Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last twenty-five years. Lahore city is famous for its historical sites and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband, M., has a business selling wood. He has three years of experience in this business. Zahida baji is the mother of one son who is seven years old and doesn’t go to school. They both want to give their son a good education. Her husband saves money from his wood-selling business and she saves money from her sewing business. She is applying for a loan to buy wood to help maximize her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Zahra baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Shahnaz Q. baji wants a loan to buy inventory (creams, makeup and hair dryer) for her beauty salon. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband's business.

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia  D. est âgée  de  44 ans  mère de 5 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Madame Kadidia D., pour subvenir à ses propres  besoins, s’intéresse très vite  aux activités génératrices de revenus telles le petit commerce il y’a de cela 15 ans. Forte de son expérience, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Koutiala. De nos jours Kadidia va beaucoup plus vers la distribution et la vente en gros de l’atiéké (une denrée alimentaire à base de manioc  ou d’igname). 
Dans un souci de satisfaire ses clients et clientes Kadidia a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Après avoir bouclé un premier prêt avec succès, elle envisage un second prêt individuel pour une durée de 12 mois et d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA.
Avec  ce prêt, elle compte acheter de la  Côte d’Ivoire, un important stock pour le ravitaillement de la plupart des détaillants d’atiéké de la ville de Koutiala. En plus du ravitaillement elle fait la vente en détail à l’intention des consommateurs au grand marché de la ville de Koutiala.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 150.000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des échéances et l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia D., age 44, is the mother of five children and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wife, and their children in the Sogomougou district of Koutiala City (region of Sikasso). Not having attended school for societal reasons, she soon became interested fifteen years ago in earning an income to support herself through such work as small-scale commerce. Highly experienced, she is appreciated and in much demand in Koutiala. These days, Kadidia is leaning a lot more towards the wholesale distributing and selling of atiéké (a cassava or yam foodstuff).

Concerned about satisfying her customers, Kadidia turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After having settled an initial loan successfully, she envisions a second individual loan for a 12-month period in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she intends to resupply herself with a sizable stock of goods from Cote d’Ivoire mostly for the retailers of atiéké of Koutiala City. In addition to restocking, she sells retail, aimed at consumers at the grand marketplace of Koutiala.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan payments and to care for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of "atiéké"

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells stationery and drinks in her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more stationery and drinks to sell. Grace is 44-years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery and drinks

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 38, and her husband, Mr. Yoeung Nut, 40, who live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have three children: two daughters who attend school and one young son.

Sokha and her husband have been producing rice wine and raising pigs for ten years. They produce rice wine at their house and carry it by their own motorbike to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Their old motorcycle broke and they have spent a lot of money to repair it so Sokha is requesting her first loan of $500 to replace the motorbike with a new one.

loans.use: To replace a motorbike with a new one to carry rice wine to sell at market.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 39 years old and married to O., who is a technician. They do not have a child yet. Betty has two machines for making ice-blocks. She sells ice blocks both wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN140,000 (US$975) to purchase one additional ice-block making machine. She says this will enable her to produce more ice blocks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one ice block making machine.

loans.name: Dolapo

texts.en: Dolapo is 37 years old and has three children. She is married to O., who is a building contractor. Dolapo sells juice and drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (US$975) to purchase more juice and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet makes a living selling palm oil, traveling to Enugu state to buy her inventory, which she sells in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has applied for a loan to buy more palm oil to sell to her customers. Janet is 40 years old and has three children. She promises to pay her loan back promptly, and wants to express her gratitude to all Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin M., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Sun Lach, 51, have been married for 20 years and have four daughters. Three of their daughters are married and live away from the family home, and the fourth daughter works in Phnom Penh as a cook. The family lives along national road No. 1 about 15 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.

Sarin has made a living as a chef for the last 20 years, cooking special meals for weddings and other ceremonies. His wife has been a florist for the last 10 years. She buys flowers from nearby villagers for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. She earns a profit from $12.50 to $25.00 per week. Sarin has applied for his first loan of $600 to build a fence around of his house and to purchase more flowers for his wife to resell.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house and to more flowers to resell.

loans.name: Sanovar

texts.ru: Сановар Каримова 1950 года рождения, замужем  имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее специальное образование. Торгует на рынке  детской одеждой. На рынке она почти 10 лет. За товаром ездит  2 раза  в месяц. В Истаравшане есть оптовик у которого она закупает товар, в настоящий момент закупила товар на весенний летний период. Кредит получила на  расширение ассортимента.
texts.en:
Sanovar K. was born in 1950; she is married and has 4 children. She has a specialized high school education. Sanovar sells children’s clothing at the market. She has been at the market for almost 10 years. She travels for her products twice a month. In Istaravshan there is a wholesale supplier from whom she purchases products, right now she purchased products for the spring-summer period. She received a loan in order to grow her assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi earns a living selling foodstuffs such as yam, cassava, corn and various traditional dishes. She started this business five years ago, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell. Bisi is 41 years old, married and has one child. She wishes to express her gratitude to all Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita C., 51 years old, and married with four children, is a resident in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte. Siare is a coastal area where most of the people's source of income is fishing. Mrs. C., Melita is one of them. Her business is fishing and it answers the basic needs of the community.

Melita started her business with only one fishing boat. Fortunately, she now has four fishing boats and sells the catch wholesale to neighboring towns. She extends support to other fishermen in their community. She's applying for a loan from Paglaum for she believes in providing help to people who are also in the fishing business. Her heart's desire is to continue inspiring people to be hardworking so that everybody will live abundantly.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mr. Tom T., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Vanna Nheak, 41, live on National Road No. 1 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have eight children, seven sons and one daughter. One of their sons is married and lives away from the family home. Four of their children help them farm, and their three youngest sons are still in school.

Tom and his wife have been famers for 25 years, growing mostly rice and cucumbers. In addition to farming, Tom is also a fisherman. He has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel oil for his farm, and also to pay various fees for plowing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and other items, and to pay fees for plowing.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She has applied for a loan to buy a generator and more drinks to sell. The generator will allow her to sell cold drinks even during power outages. Gladys is 49 years old, married and has three children. She wishes to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy a generator and additional drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina M. is a 44-year-old member from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and has five children studying in elementary and secondary schools. Abject poverty is inevitable to them. Therefore, she commenced to buy and sell root crops and vegetables to their neighbors, relatives and friends.

Rufina was hooked on the idea of putting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thought that their daily needs could be supplied by the income from the store. Not having enough capital to start a sari-sari store she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2006 to access loan credit for additional capital. All these loans were repaid in a timely manner. She is a member in good standing.

The loans from Paglaum MPC helped the couple send their children to school. She said it's no longer a losing battle facing everyday hardships, having her husband by her side to lend a hand. And she is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs.

In the future, the couple wishes to operate a bigger sari-sari store with a bakeshop in it. Heart’s desire is to send their children to college and witness them successful in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more grocery product for her store

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Mrs. Yai C., 47, and her husband, Mr. Vin Chan, 52, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home.

Yai has been selling fish for 12 years. She buys fish from fishermen for resale in her village and a nearby village. Mr Vin Chan is a mechanic, he also runs a new motorbike and bicycle repairing business. He does his work in the village.

Yai is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase an air compressor for her child’s motorbike cleaning business and to buy motorbike spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions in Sabo garage market in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business seven years ago.

She hopes for the loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa B., 39, lives in Labakid, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte with her husband Rolando and their six children. The big family was once a happy family but unfortunately they suffered financial problems due to the costs of educating their children at the college level. To cope, Narcisa became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative so that she could borrow additional capital for her vegetable-growing business. Now applying for her fourth loan of Php 7,000.00, she wants to buy farm inputs for her vegetable garden so that it will grow healthy. The small amounts previously borrowed from Paglaum MPC have helped to augment the production of her garden and send their children to school.

Narcisa plans to add more seedlings to increase production to earn more income. She and her husband also plan to improve their lifestyle. As Narcisa says, "Paglaum is the bridge to our better future".

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Asuru Azainabu Boyo Group

texts.en: Mrs. Zainabu B., 41 years of age, is married and has eight children, four girls and four boys, all in school, and four dependents, also attending school. She operates a business selling sweet bananas, bananas (matooke and goja) and Irish potatoes. She is requesting the loan to purchase more such produce, her dream being to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase sweet bananas, bananas (matooke and goja) and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Auk, 42, were married in 1988 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are construction workers, their daughter is a garment factory worker and another son attends school. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mao’s wife stays at home to take care of their children. Mao has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 1989. Unfortunately, a thief has stolen his motorbike and that has caused Mao to be unable to continue his business. So he is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase a motorbike to continue his motorcycle taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to run as a motorcycle taxi business.

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en:
Abimbola sells drinks both wholesale and retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

Abimbola is 44 years old and married to A. who is a taxi driver and they have four children. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
N. Flavia, a very methodical, hard-working lady, operates a business buying fresh animal blood, shells and bones from which she makes chicken feed. She employs people to go to slaughter houses “lufula” to collect the fresh blood in cans; she then boils all of her ingredients from Ugachick in Gayaza as an independent. Once done, she sells to Ugachick itself although the payments take two weeks to come through; this is one reason she also sells to other firms that pay instant cash for her to remain in business.

Flavia is grateful for her loans because she has been able to pay school fees for her four children singlehandedly after the death of her husband, and now they are out of school and operating their own businesses. She currently cares for three orphans attending school, all the children of her late sister but abandoned by their father upon his remarriage.

Thanks to previous loans received, Flavia was able to build her own house, but she is now requesting another loan to buy windows and doors for her house to replace the polythene paper coverings; the balance of the loan will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buying windows and doors for her house.

loans.name: Zahida Parveen M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen baji is the wife of M. N. A. khan and has resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She completed her education up to 5th standard. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a vehicle named “Shahzore”. He uses this vehicle to deliver different items (construction supplies & fruits & vegetables) from one place to another.

Zahida baji is the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a welder and the younger son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter reads in 10th standard. Zahida baji operates a clothes selling business. She buys clothes from the city of Multan and sells in her native city Lahore. She does this work to pay off the school fees of her daughter so that she will able to complete her 10th standard without any difficulty. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat selling business. Safia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Qamar khanum baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mutiatu

texts.en: Mutiatu sells provisions wholesale and retail. She started this business seven years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 65 years old and a widow with five children and many grandchildren. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Ms. Sinoun U., 33, is single and lives with her parents and her brother, who is an electrician. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sinoun has been a silk weaver for fifteen years; it’s a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her mother is a farmer; besides farming she also assists her daughter to spin thread.

Sinoun is requesting her first loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sakina M.azam Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a wife of M.Azam and has resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the last 30 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband is in the animal selling business. He sells animals to the butcher shops and earns income. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Sakina baji is the mother of five: three daughters and two sons. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school and getting an education. Sakina baji operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats & sheep) for her husband’s animal selling business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth selling business. Saima baji and Shamim akhtar baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Ajibola

texts.en: Ajibola sells planks. She is 42 years old and married to S. who is a teacher and they have three children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem C., 50, and her husband, Mr. Thy Ouch, 53, married in 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rem has been selling fish that her husband catches for twenty-one years and she raises cows as well. Mr. Thy Ouch has been a fisherman for twenty-one years; he fishes from the lake faraway from his house. Unfortunately, his fishing materials are old and broken down, so Rem is applying for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase new ones.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and boat for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Amelita B., a resident of Siari, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, is married and has a mini-grocery store located in their barangay. She started her business with only a small amount of capital and follows a system called "angkat-angkat of goods". It is like operating on a consignment basis.

As time goes by and with the help of Paglaum MPC, her business is doing well. It is becoming bigger and bigger. She is happy with what is happening in her life because she serves the needs of the people in a growing way. Mrs. B., with her husband's help, wants to expand and cater not only to their barangay but also to other barangays.

loans.use: Capital for her mini-grocery store

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат Зоидова 1970 года рождения, имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  На рынке торгует детской одеждой. 9 лет она ездит за товаром и привозит  детскую одежду и мелочи: носовые платки, носки для взрослых. Кредит потратила на расширение бизнеса. Благодарна Микроинвест за поддержку.
texts.en:
Inobat Z. was born in 1970, and has three children. She graduated from high school, and has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2005. She trades in children's clothing at the market. For nine years she has gone on buying trips and brought in children's clothing and small accessories, handkerchiefs and socks for adults. The loan will be put towards business expansion. Inobat is grateful to MicroInvest for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase selection of goods

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is 38 years old and has two children. She is married to A. who is a taxi driver. Lawal sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says that the profits from this business will be added to the family savings to enhance the children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Younos

texts.en:
Mr. Younos S., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Aisas Tres, 44, live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1985 and have four children: one son who raises cows at home and three daughters. Their eldest daughter assists her mother in sewing hammocks to sell.

For ten years Younos has been selling cloth hammocks sewn by his wife and daughter. Besides selling hammocks he also runs a new business selling cows. Younos is requesting his second loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase cows for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is a party planner and she also trains young boys and girls on how to decorate halls and make snacks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more decorating materials.  Folashade is 52 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating materials

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mrs. Roth N. is a villager in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Um Ol, is a palm juice collector. Aside from this plantation, he is a cow middleman in the local village.

Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it but he does not have enough money. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Roth N. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy three cows for her husband’s business to earn more income. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown in the picture.

loans.use: to add her saving to buy three cows

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C., 48, is a widow with two children: one son and one daughter. Both are married. Her son lives outside the family home, and he has been selling vegetables for three years. The daughter assists her mother in farming. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ly has been a farmer for over thirty years; she grows many kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, corn, eggplants, wax gourds, and bananas. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 to help fund her son so he can purchase vegetables on contract for re-sale.

loans.use: To help fund her son to purchase vegetables on contract for re-sale

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde braids and styles hair. She also sells hair extensions and kerosene. She hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. Kehinde is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilyn C., 37 years of age and a resident of West Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, has a fish selling business from which she and her husband earn a living. Despite experiencing frequent and varied challenges, they are committed to meeting those challenges rather than getting discouraged.

To feed and support their two children, Marilyn and her husband work hard selling their catch at the market, and sometimes wholesale buyers from other towns and cities come to buy their fish. They are now requesting a loan that, coupled with their savings, will allow them to expand the business.

Marilyn smiles at the thought of one day seeing her children receive their diplomas.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Mrs. Vun M., 59, and her husband, Mr. Ny Choem, 61, were married in 1978 and have three children: two sons and one daughter, who weaves at home. One of their sons is security guard; another son attends university in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vun has been a silk weaver since she was eighteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a carpenter since 1990, he works in his village. Vun is requesting a loan of US $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells palm oil, vegetable oil and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount N70,000 to purchase more palm oil and vegetable oil. Kehinde is 32 years old and married with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
N. Wilson is a very hard-working man with a livestock business that he has owned for 5 years. He is 40 years of age and married with 6 children, the oldest being 12 years old while the youngest is 3 years old. He also helps to care for two dependents (one orphan and one of his remaining parents).

His business is located in Kigando II in Ibanda and right now, he is able to make a weekly profit of 40,000 shillings (about US $18). The secret to his success is his loyalty to his customers. He would like to expand his farm into a much bigger one with more animals and chickens. Wilson works hard to educate his children to a higher level so that they can provide for themselves in the future. He wants a loan to buy and fatten more cows for sale, as he keeps them for a while. His previous loan helped to increase the stock of cows in his farm and their quality by buying drugs for them.

loans.use: Cows to be raised and sold

loans.name: Mumina

texts.ru:
Мумина Хамдамова  1966 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Она работает  в Ковровом Комбинате Кайраккума  ткачихой.  Но в прошлом году  все ее сотрудники попали под сокращение и ее попросили выйти в отпуск без содержания. Она решила продолжить свой бизнес так как с работы нет  заработной платы. Ее сын привозит товар -обувь  она продает на рынке. Кроме этого она также торгует и мужской одеждой.
Кредит она потратила на расширение   ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Mumina H. was born in 1966; she is married and has 3 children. She has a high school education. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. She works at the Rug Factory Kayrakuma as a weaver. But last year all of her coworkers were laid off and she was asked to take a vacation without pay. She decided to continue her business because she does not have a salary from her job. Her son brings the products, shoes, and she sells them at the market. In addition, she also sells men’s clothing. She used her loan to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells kerosene in drums, gallons and bottles. She started this business over ten years ago. She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia T. is 65 years old and married to a farmer. She resides at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of the Paglaum Cooperative in 2001.

Now, she has asked for a loan amounting to 20,000 Philippine Pesos intended for additional capital for her variety store. She will purchase grocery items such as: assorted canned goods, laundry and bath soap, shampoos, noodles, seasonings, beverages, and many others. Her husband is a miner. The couple started their business with their own capital from what they were able to save from her husband's meager income from farming.

She hopes she can save enough for her old age and have a healthy life ahead.

loans.use: Inventory for sari-sari store

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en:
Fumilola styles hair and she also sells hair extensions, drinks and water. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell.

Fumilola is 38 years old and married with three children. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in TrapE. Trayueng village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use this loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phalla T. is the 37 year old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a one hectare field of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Phally, is a Tok Tok taxi driver (motorized bicycle taxi). Although they try to work hard they still don’t earn enough income to support their family. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Phalla T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets to breed. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. She has four children, one of whom is employed while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets to breed.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells frozen foods: turkey, chicken, fish, etc. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 70, 000 Naira (US $500) to purchase more frozen foods to sell. Bola has four children and she is married. She is 45 years old. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Oloyode

texts.en: Oloyode is 48 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira ($500 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She started this business ten years ago and it has grown steadily. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Glesie

texts.en:
Glesie V., 42 years old, a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, lives in Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Glesie works hard for her family and for her business of buying and selling fruits.

The capital that she had for starting a little business was from her savings. Being the breadwinner of the family, she must strive even harder to sustain the needs of her family and also to raise her child. Glesie wants 27,000 Philippine Pesos, and she will be using the funds to buy goods to sell in her store. She wishes that the Almighty Father will bless her business and that she can pay her obligation on a timely fashion.

loans.use: Inventory for fruit store

loans.name: Asuru A Rehema Adirisi Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Rehema is 27 years old and married with 4 children: 3 girls and 1 boy, all in school. She has been selling charcoal for over 2 years and now. She will use the loan to purchase more charcoal (30 bags) for resale. She is supplying charcoal to schools, community members and other people who come to buy from her. Her dream is to own a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat sells smoked and ice fish. She started this business eight years ago in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 naira ($500 US) so that she can purchase more fish to sell. Kudirat is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de cartes de crédit pour téléphones,  de pagnes wax, de  tissus et font des prestations de teinture.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 25 complets  tissus pour hommes et femmes, 13 pièces de pagnes wax, une centaine de cartes de crédit pour  téléphones,  5 colis de colorants et une barrique de soude caustique.
Elles s’approvisionnent au Burkina Faso et au grand marché de Sikasso ville. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant et en détail. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille(en épargne) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ambitionnent d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle et  de devenir grossistes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Benkadi are all married women who average 41 years of age and 3 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their fourth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans were settled. The group members do a diversity of work, including selling mobile phone cards, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and fabrics, and they offer cloth dyeing services.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 suits for men and women, 13 bolts of Wax pagnes, 100 mobile phone cards, 5 packages of dyes, and a barrel of caustic soda. Supplies are gotten in Burkina Faso and at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City. The merchandise is sold in mostly retail cash transaction to customers composed of men and women at different marketplaces in the city, in their homes, and in the area going door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 15,500 franc CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs (savings account), and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better, and to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Ibirogba

texts.en: Ibirogba is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of 70, 000 naira ($500 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi styles hair, sells hair extensions and creams.  She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more extensions and creams to sell.  Oluwakemi is 42 years old and married with two children.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more hair extensions and creams to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
"A hardworking woman" best describes Elma B., 42 years old, married, and living at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children. Her husband is a mere fisherman. She tries her best to provide for the needs of her family; that’s why she engaged herself in a sari-sari store business. In order to have enough capital, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2008 and was able to start her business.

Elma has already taken out other loans several times. Now, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos to buy additional inventory for her store. In the future, she wants to renovate her house and have her store expanded into a bigger space. Elma will be fulfilled as a parent if all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: Store inventory

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: T. Florence is a very determined lady with a business-oriented mind. She is married and has 3 children between 6 and 13 years of age. Her eldest child is in secondary school while the other two are in primary and nursery school. Florence has had a retail shop in Nkondo for 8 years where she also sells green bananas used for making matooke (cooked green banana dish). She further stresses that the location of her business helps her to succeed by making a lot of profit, once she stocks her shop with more goods. Florence has a dream of developing her shop into a wholesale shop and to see all her children educated through to the University. She will use her loan to restock her retail shop. Her previous loans have been helping her to avoid a shortage of goods in her shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Исмоилов Рустам житель  города Куляб . Возраст 39 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. По специальности радиотехник. Работает на рынке "Саховат" . Имеет точку , где стоит аппарат по производству дубликатов ключей.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ему в течение долгого времени обслуживать клиентов по доступным ценам.
texts.en:
Rustam I. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 39 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary-technical education and is a radio technician by trade. He works at the Sahovat market. Rustam has a retail outlet with a key duplication machine. He has been in this business for 10 years. Rustam plans to obtain the loan in order to purchase raw materials. This will help him over a long time to serve his clients at affordable prices.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Saima Majid Khan Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is a housemaid and she is divorced. She works for a family who pays her money on monthly basis. She just cook their meals and manages their kitchen work. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Both of the children are getting education. Saima baji pays their school fees and other utility bills. Her brother is also lives with her. He has a fruit-selling business. He has 3-years of experience in this business. Saima baji has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy fruits for her brother’s fruit-selling business.  

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Mussarat rani baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ishrat baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Asma khatoon baji wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell, clothes to sell, bangles to sell, and an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
"Hard-working woman" describes Mrs. Saturnina D., 48 years old, married and living at Rizal, Lopez Jaena. She has 4 children. She has to strive to earn a living for her family.

One must be wise enough in order to survive in this kind of business. With this, she was able to support the daily needs of her family. There is enough income in sari-sari store business. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Cooperative in January 2004. She has already received loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP 15,000 (USD 325) to buy more inventory for her store. She wants her business to sustain. She also wants to provide her family with a decent and comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: Additional inventory such as (canned goods, bath soap, shampoo etc.,).

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann A. is 28 years old, married to Ronnie A. and blessed with one child. Presently she resides at Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. Pig-raising is her project, for which she has borrowed PHP 10,000 to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. Mary Ann wants to have a pen for her pigs. She also wants to own a concrete house and to have her child be able finish school in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pig-raising

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Confiance sont toutes des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de cartes de crédit pour téléphones,  de gingembre (pour la fabrication  de boissons locales non alcoolisées), de  condiments alimentaires et des brochettes de viande grillées.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  25 cartes de crédit pour téléphones, 1 sac de sucre, 2 sacs de 100kg de gingembre, 3 colis de condiments alimentaires, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 5kg de viande , 5 sacs de charbon de bois.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Confiance ambitionnent d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Confiance are all married women who average 37 years of age and 4 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their 8th solidarity loan. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. The group members do a diversity of work, including selling mobile phone cards, ginger (for making local soft drinks), condiments, and grilled meat kebobs.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 mobile phone cards, one sack of sugar, two 100-kg sacks of ginger, three packages of condiments, ten liters of cooking oil, five kilos of meat, and five sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold, in mostly cash transaction, to customers composed of men and women at different marketplaces in the city and in the area.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 12,500 franc CFA. A portion of the profits will put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Parveen Yousaf Khan Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of Y. K. and she resides in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady as her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses. Her husband is a government employee. He works as a clerk in a government office. Parveen baji operates a bangle-selling business. Most of her customers are her neighbors. Parveen baji has 3 years of experience in this business. She sells variety of bangles (steel and plastic). She is applying for a loan to buy bangles to expand her bangle-selling business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Mussarat begum baji and Naseem akhtar baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazira baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each woman will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Rahmatboy

texts.ru:
Рахматбой Тураев мужчина 48 лет, живет в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей. Он женат, имеет 4 детей.
   Основной его деятельностью, которая приносит доход в его семью, является животноводство.Дома у Рахматбоя 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. Вот уже 11 лет, он содержит свою семью, за счет откорма и продажи скот,а так же переработки молока. Во всем этом ему помощник жена Сабохат и дети.
   Он просит займ в размере 1200 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmatboy T. is a 48 year old man. He lives in the Ganchinsky region together with his family. He is married and has four children. His main business is animal husbandry which is the source of income for the family. At home Rahmatboy has seven heads of large cattle. He has been supporting his family for eleven years by feeding and selling cattle and also by milk processing. His wife Sabohat and children help him with this. He is asking for a loan for 1200 somoni (US$325) for a term of six months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle and milk processing

loans.name: Asuru A Angucia Gloria Group

texts.en: Gloria A. , 42, is married with two children, a boy and a girl.  They live with 12 dependent who go to school. She has been selling produce for over 11 years.  Gloria is using the loan to purchase beans, millet, sorghum, maize, simsim and ground nuts.  Her dream is to educate her dependents, build a good home and uplift her community.

loans.use: Purchase produce

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru:
Насим Розиков 1971 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. В Микроинвест обратился за увеличением поголовья скота. Сам он водитель маршрутного такси. Более 10 лет он разводит скот у себя во дворе. Жена не работает , она сидит с маленькими детьми дома. 
Насим благодарен КИВА за поддержку, на эти деньги он смог расширить свой коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Nasim R. is married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education. He reached out to MicroInvest to increase his livestock headcount. Nasim works as a taxi driver. He has been breeding livestock in his yard for over 10 years. His wife is not employed, but she takes care of their young children at home. Nasim is grateful to Kiva for the support. He will now be able to expand his cowshed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Muhammad Aliam Group

texts.en:
Muhammad Aliam is the group leader of the Muhammad Aliam group.  They have two members and request a loan of 28000 Afghani for the term of eight months. 

Muhammad wants a loan for his metal working shop.  Aziz Muhammad needs a loan for his taxi business. They like this loan process.

loans.use: Expanding business.

loans.name: M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Atiya is a 37 year-old lady and a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Atiya is an uneducated lady because she didn’t show interest in education. She is married to A. who runs a grocery shop in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Atiya is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Asia wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a dryer machine for her beauty salon. Bilquis wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Shamim wants a loan to buy beams for her shutter business.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee all loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy groceries.

loans.name: Shabana Samulean Masih Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a wife of S. M. who lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past eight years. Her husband is a driver with three years experience. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shabana operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband.
