She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because its engine needs to be repaired.

Shabana is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shaheen wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Ulfat wants a loan to buy chickens for her butcher shop. Zareena wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Yasmeen wants a loan to buy fruit to sell.

This is a group loan that will be distributed among members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the entire loan. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Sobia M.anjum Group

texts.en:
Deeba baji is the wife of M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past six years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Deeba baji operates a sewing business. She sews clothes from orders from her neighbors. She charges $2 per stitching. Now she has decided to prepare embroidered dresses due to demand from her neighbors. She is applying for a loan to buy material, like clothes, colored thread, and sketches, in order to start this new part of her business.

She is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Kosar baji also wants a loan to buy clothes, colored thread, and sketches for her embroidery business. Rehana kosar baji wants a loan to buy toys for her toy shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nawab baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her business selling clothes.

As a group loan, funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Wessam

texts.en:
Wessam is a 37 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, of Lebanon, with his wife and child. Wessam has owned a clothing shop since 1997. He requests a loan of $2000 from A. Majmoua to purchase clothes for his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop by diversifying his merchandise. Wessam is speciA. because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients; friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided to do his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en: A. Razaq is the group leader of the A. Razaq group.  They have three members. They want to take a loan of 44100 Afghani for 10 months.  A. Razaq wants to take a loan for his computer making shop.  Palwasha wants a loan for tailoring.  Ma J. wants a loan for the business of leather work.  They admire this process so much.

loans.use: Buy business supplies.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells building materials.  She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  Toyin is 35 years old and married to O. who is a commercial driver.  They have four children.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, Lebanon. Ali owns a barber shop and requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his shop; like scissors, hairdryer, etc.. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan.

Ali knows how to treat his clients and is always aware of the new collection. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 38, sells frozen foods. Ruth is married with three children.  She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, Lebanon. Ali has owned a clothing shop for a year and requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua, in order to purchase clothes for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop as well as his financial situation. Ali is special because he knows how to treat his clients; friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ali decided to do this work because of his experience in trading. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Samina Anayat Masih Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is a wife of A. M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past years. Her husband runs a boutique in the cloth market. He displays his wife’s collection of handmade clothes, which gathers good customers. Samina baji learned the art of embroidery from her mother. Her husband is very happy with her. She plays a very important role in her husband’s success. She is applying for a loan to buy colored thread, sketches, and clothes to expand their boutique business.

She is the leader of a group of three other women from her locality. Shahjahan baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie-making business. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy snooker table for her game shop. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy calling cards to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy colored thread, sketches, and clothes to expand her boutique.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 35 years old and married with two children. She is a fashion designer and makes lovely designs for her customers.  Bosede is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase one industrial weaving machine.  She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase industrial weaving machine.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 30 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Mona has owned a grocery store since 1992. She requested a loan of $2000 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her store and to pay for her children's school tuition.

This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Mona knows how to treat her clients; friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. Mona decided to do this business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans to improving her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store and pay for her children's school tuition.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and married with six children. She sells provisions both wholesale and retail to her customers. Esther hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.

Esther is the leader of a lending group under LAPO microfinance. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice sells garri (roasted cassava) in bags and bowls. She sells at Koshofe market in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

Alice is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen Rasheed Masih Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the wife of R. M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past eight years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She is the mother of two kids, one son and one daughter. Both of her kids go to school. Yasmeen baji operates a business sewing clothes. She does this work to pay off her kids' school fees. Her husband sells fruit from a cart by making a loud voice in different communities. Yasmeen baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s business.

She is the leader of this group of three other women from her locality. Sonia baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Humaira baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ailas baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana sells provisions to her customers. She started this business five years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.

Juliana is 42 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru:
Бекназар Джумъабоев проживает в Шахристанском районе. Женат, имеет 4 детей.
Животноводством занимается около 10 лет, это его основной источник дохода.
 Бекназар запрашивает 2600 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев. Ему нужны средства для того чтобы откормить и продать крупнорогатый скот, а так же Бекназар хочет увеличить количество скота. Всем этим он занимается у себя дома.
 Кроме этого, он перевозит товар с Шахристана в г.Истаравшан, занимается сельским хозяйством, и переработкой молока.
 Он подал заявку на Кива, для решения своих проблем, а значит благосостояния его семьи.
texts.en:
Beknazar J. lives in the Shahristan region. He is married and has four children. He has raised livestock for nearly ten years and it is his main source of income. Beknazar is requesting a loan of 2600 somoni to be repaid in 10 months' time. He needs funds in order to feed and sell large-horned cattle, as well as increase the size of his herd. He works out of his home. In addition, he delivers goods from Shahristan to the city of Istaravshan, engages in agriculture, and milk production. He has applied to Kiva in order to resolve his dilemma and hence the well-being of his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding cattle and increasing the size of his herd

loans.name: Shamim Javed Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of J. M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its Punjabi foods and for its historical places. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy snooker for her game shop.

Her husband runs a game shop in the community. Children come to play the games and spend their free time. He has been in this business for the past five years. Shamim baji operates a business sewing clothes. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount.

She is the leader of a group of five other women from her locality. Fozia baji and Rubina baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit selling business. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to sell. Sarfraz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy snooker for her game shop.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад Кодиров  1984 года рождения ,  женат детей пока нет. Имеет среднее образование. Имеет магазин , торгует запасными частями автомашин.  В продаже имеются колеса, масла, и другие необходимые запасные части для машин.  Кредит получил для расширения ассортимента в магазине. В Микроинвест обратился  в 2008 году. Сейчас расширил свой магазин и планирует, увеличивать свой товар.
texts.en:
Abdusamad K. was born in 1984. He is married, but does not have any children yet. He graduated from high school, and has an automobile parts store. He has tires, oil and other necessary automobile parts for sale. The loan he received will go towards increasing the selection of goods in the store. He turned to MicroInvest in 2008, and now has expanded his store, and increased his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover of inventory

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA. is a 31 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. JamA. has been working as a mason. He requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and a generator for his work. This is the first time that JamA. has requested a loan.

JamA. is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anyone from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. JamA. decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and a generator for his work

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 44 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Radwan has been working as a car repairer. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. Radwan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Radwan is special in his work because he does it well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Radwan decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Oluremi

texts.en: Oluremi has a shop where she sells drinks and bags of cement. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. Oluremi is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs. She is an active LAPO client. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 32 years old and married with two children. She sells drinks at retail to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Abasse

texts.en:
Abasse is a 46-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Abasse has been working as a florist for twenty-five years. He has also been selling clothes. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase flowers and clothes for his businesses. Abasse has been a micro credit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his flower business and start his clothing business. Abasse is special in his work because he does nice bunches of flowers and sells nice clothes. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started work, he didn’t face any difficulty. Abasse decided on doing this work because of his experience, and his desire to improve his family’s situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and clothes for his businesses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells tubers of yams and loaves of bread. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. Grace is married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Nachaat

texts.en:
Nachaat is a 34-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Nachaat has been working as a car repairer for ten years. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and car spare parts for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Nachaat is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started to work, he didn’t face any difficulty. Nachaat decided on doing this work because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and car spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 52-years old and married to O., who is a plumber, and they have four children. Iyabo sells bags of charcoal. Iyabo is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji is a wife of M. K.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past twenty years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Shamim baji is an uneducated lady because her father was the only breadwinner of her family and couldn’t afford his children's education expenses. Her husband has had a gents undergarments selling business for the past ten years.

Shamim baji is the mother of four sons. Her elder son is a motor mechanic. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Shamim baji operates a thread-roll selling business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay the school fees of her kids. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy undergarments to expand her husband’s business.

She is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (like wires, switches, and switch boards) for her electric shop. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy plastic baskets to sell. Rehana begum baji wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell. Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her business sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad has been working as a mason for 25 years. He also owns a school van. Mouhamad does his work well. His clients can be anybody from his region. He has not had any difficulties since he first started his work. Mouhamad decided on this work because he wanted to improve his family’s income. He is a 43-year old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children.

Mouhamad has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans on expanding both his businesses.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Sakaba Group

texts.en: Sakaba is the group leader of the Sakaba group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress her business. Sakaba wants to take a loan for her brother who has a car parts shop. Marvred wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Karsheed wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store and wants to buy things needed for his shop. The are all very happy with this loan process.

loans.use: To buy car parts for her brother's shop

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah sells medicines and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Deborah is 54 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Abed Allah

texts.en:
Abed Allah is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abed Allah has been working as a taxi driver for five years. Abed Allah requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Abed Allah has requested a loan. 
Abed Allah is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition since there are a lot of taxis in Lebanon. Abed Allah decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a van in order to have more passengers.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Afolashade

texts.en: Afolashade sells vegetable and palm oil. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell. Afolashade is 36 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is a 54-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Rafik has owned a shoe shop for 30 years. He has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase the new summer shoe collection. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work and to diversify his merchandise. Rafik considers himself unique in his work because his store has a large variety of shoes.

In the future, he plans on expanding both his businesses.

loans.use: Rafik will use the loan to purchase the shoes summer new collection.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi,35 years old and married with three children, sells crates of eggs, a business she started eight years ago. Titi hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 in order to purchase more eggs to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Yasmeen Asad Ullah Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 36 year old lady and a citizen of the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She successfuly repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s business.

Her husband’s name is A. U.. He deals in vegetables. He has 5 years of experience in this business. They are parents to six kids: five daughters and one son. All of their kids are getting an education.  Yasmeen baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and charges $2 per stitching. She does this work to pay off the school fees of her kids. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Razia begum baji wants a loan to buy paintbrushes to sell. Jamila baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy gentlemen’s undergarments to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Temilade

texts.en: Temilade, 51 years old and married with four children, sells frozen food and also operates a fish farm. Temilade is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more frozen foods and fingerlings. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and fingerlings.

loans.name: Khouder

texts.en:
Khouder has been working as an electrician. Khouder knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Khouder is a 48-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife.

Khouder has requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Khouder has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells cooked food and drinks. Joy is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to prepare and sell. Joy is 40 years old. Her husband's name is A. and they have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has had a tractor for 13 years. He is a 31-year old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. With his tractor, he transports cars, furniture, and lots more. Ali is willing to help clients from his region with his big tractor. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his work. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to improve his family’s income.

Ali has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. He is requesting a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his tractor. His previous loan helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on a tractor

loans.name: Khalida Parveen M. Ameen Shahzad Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji is 51 year old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 27 years. Her husband’s name is M. A. S. and he has a scrap business. He 5 years experience in this business. 
Khalida baji has two sons and her sons work with their father. Khalida baji is an older lady, so she spends most of her time in the house and does household work and takes care of her family. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for the fourth time to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

 She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy vehicles oil to sell. Jamila kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Azra baji wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each of the women will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. Bolanle hopes for a loan of N150, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. Bolanle is 44 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 47 years old and married with five children. She sells lubricants, and she is requesting the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more lubricant to sell. Joy is an active LAPO client. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricant to sell

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 56 years old and divorced with three children. She has sold bunches of plantain (a fruit like a large banana) in retail and wholesale to her customers since she started this business eight years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. Shola promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells plastic containers like drums, bowls, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more plastic items to sell. Gladys is 57 years old and she is a widow with three children. She says thank you to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sarongs and underwear. She is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake's husband's name is O. and they have five children. She is 46 years old. Folake sells cooked foods, sarongs and plastics. She is requesting the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more plastics to sell. Folake is a LAPO client. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Mojisola

texts.en: Mojisola sells sarongs and jewelry. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Mojisola is 43 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin sells foodstuffs.  She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Oluwatoyin is 30 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Swalia C Farida Azeru Group

texts.en: Farida A. is a married woman, aged 28 years, with 4 kids and 4 dependants, all in schooling. She has been selling foodstuffs for over 9 years. She will use the loan to purchase hotel items for cooking such as bananas, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, millet flour, meat, chicken, and vegetables to run her hotel business. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to construct a rental house to be able fund education for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase food to cook for her hotel business.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is thirty-two years old and lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Rana owns a costume jewelry and accessory shop. She sells costume jewelry, belts, make up, beauty products, hats and a lot more. She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Rana has requested a loan. 
Rana is recognized for her work because she offers a big variety of items and knows how to treat her clients, who are people from her region. Since she first started her business, she has been successful. Rana decided to open her business because she wanted to have independent work. In the future, she plans to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is forty-five years old and lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hassan has owned a bakery for ten years. He does “saj” and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where he makes saj bread, and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh.  A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Hassan requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase ingredients like oil, flour, thyme and cheese, and also to change the décor of his bakery. Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his bakery. Hassan is well-known for his baked goods because of the good taste of his mankoucheh. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He did not find it difficult to get his business established. Hussein decided to open his bakery because he wanted to improve his family’s situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his baked goods.

loans.name: Fatou Tacko

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Tacko M. est une Sénégalaise agee de 35 ans qui sollicite un crédit pour financer son activité commercial.  Depuis dix ans elle a vendu des tissus, des produits cosmétiques, des draps, et du thé.  Avec ce prêt elle va reconstituer son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients.  Elle n’a jamais reçu un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC.  Elle habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Elle est mariée et avec les revenus de son entreprise, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

Madame M. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Tacko M., age 35, is a Senegalese woman who is requesting a loan to finance her business. For ten years, she has been selling fabrics, cosmetics, bed sheets, and tea. With this loan, she's going to replenish her inventory in order to serve her customers better. She has never had a loan from IMCEC before. She lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is married, and with the revenues from her enterprise, she helps her husband with family expenses. Ms. M. is requesting a special IMCEC product. The product is called PDEF (the Kiva program for child and family development). It's for helping parents of poor children who are part of the project, the Christian Children's Fund, a partner of IMCEC. Clients benefit from a reduced interest rate.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, cosmetics, sheets, and tea

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 52 year old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nadia has been working as a hairdresser from her house for twenty years. She also does makeup for her customers. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase makeup for her salon. This is the first time that Nadia has requested a loan. 
Nadia is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties. Nadia decided on this type of work because of her experience, and she also like the contact she has with her clients. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To purchase makeup for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is twenty-eight years old and lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Saleh has been working in furniture repair and upholstery since 2002. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva field partner, in order to purchase thread for his work and to repair one of his sewing machines. This is the first time that Saleh has requested a loan. 
Saleh is exceptional in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, things went well. Saleh decided to open this business because he had prior experience. In the future, he plans to improve his business by purchasing a new and bigger sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy thread and to repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Laura has been selling agrifood products for five years. She requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her sales. Laura is an active woman who is always willing to participate in forums in order to sell her products. She is also very active within Al Majmoua, participating in several training sessions like vocational training, business-management training and lots more. Laura is special in her work because she is good with her agrifood products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her work, she didn’t have the start-up capital and didn’t have all the needed equipment. Laura decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income and because she likes working. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Laura will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Ebtissam

texts.en:
Ebtissam is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Ebtissam has been selling used clothes for a year. She requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her work. This is the first time that Ebtissam has requested a loan.

Ebtissam is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her work, she didn’t face any difficulties. Nadia decided on doing her work because of her experience and she also likes the contact she has with her clients. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Ebtissam will use the loan to purchase clothes for her work

loans.name: Swalia C Leila Ayikoru Group

texts.en: Mrs. Leila A. is a married woman, aged 32 years, with 3 kids: 1 boy and 2 girls. All her children go to school. She also has 7 dependents. She has been selling cassava flour for over 9 years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for selling. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Ahmadchon

texts.ru:
Ахмадчон Ортиков  мужчина 1950 года рождения.Проживает с женой Ортиковой Дилбар и 3 детьми в зафарабадском районе поселке Мехнатобод.С 25 лет он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и перепродает крупонорогатый скот.
 Хочет получить займ в размере 2000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев. 
 Дополнительно Ахмадчон  занимается  переработкой молока, а так же  является  директором  дехканского хозяйства «М.Чумаев».
texts.en:
Ahmadchon O. was born in 1950. He lives with his wife Dilbar and their 3 children in the village of Mehnatobod in the Zafarabad district. He has been involved in animal husbandry since the age of 25. He feeds and sells cattle. He wants to obtain an 8-month loan in the sum of 2000 somoni. In addition to this business, Ahmadchon is involved in milk processing and is also a director of the M. Chumaev dekhan farm.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
In the little town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Carmelita T., 57 years old, operates a snack-vending business. She supports the education of her only child with the profits from her business. Carmelita has been interested in business and she wants to continue her passion while supporting her husband. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Paglaum MPC came as a financing partner for their capital needs. They have applied for a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase additional ingredients for the snacks she will sell.
Carmelita and her husband have a big wish for their child to finish studies and, above all, for their business to flourish with a permanent additional store to display their snacks.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for snack vending business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells sarongs. She sells her sarongs within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Felicia is 42 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Mr. P. is a resident of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, 39 years old, a businessman and blessed with 2 children. He is married to Fritzie P., who is also a businesswoman.

Mr. P. decided to become a member just for insurance purposes in our individual program on April 14, 2007. Later on, in May 2008, he requested a loan for his business as additional capital and paid without reaching its term. They have a grocery store and cell phone selling in some nearby municipalities.

Lately, he decided to request a loan again, his 2nd, amounting to 20,000 pesos. Their children are in grade school and High School level. As for his previous loan, he repaid on time, having no default; contribution and obligations were responded accordingly. Business status is so good, they also are working with rice vending.

Mr. P. wants in the future to own his own stocks. He said he wants his children to finish their studies just like other parents aim for their children to become professionals someday.

loans.use: purchase of grocery items such as noodles, rice, soft drinks, and household materials

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola is 28 years old. She is married to A., who is a carpenter, and they have three children. She sells drinks and foodstuffs. Fumilola is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Joi

texts.en:
Joi is a resident of Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is presently engaged in selling Ready-to-Wear items and is busy also attending to her mini grocery store. She is presently requesting a loan amounting to Php 7,000 for the purchase of additional grocery items such as food, soft drinks, toiletries and many others.

The family is praying that they can save, especially for the future education of their two children and to be able to expand their present business.

loans.use: purchase of additional grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, and other household items

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. has enjoyed her more than 6 years' association with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, a partner through thick and thin for her business. It's a daily challenge for her to meet her loan payments on time but this has now become a habit. Arlene, 38 years old and married, has 2 children. She tells us with pride that she is able to nurture both her children well. Finishing a degree was far out of sight for her and she only reached college level. But, with the skill of dressmaking, she has been able to feed her children and provide them with good education.

She has applied with Paglaum MPC for a loan of Php 10,000. With this loan she will purchase additional sewing materials. She wants to expand her business and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: additional capital for dressmaking business

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started this business eight years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 33 years old and married to F. who sells motor spare parts, and they have a child. She says thank you, and promises to pay back her loan promptly

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started this business eight years ago she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Fumilayo is 35 years old and married to O. who is a fashion designer, and they have four children. She says thank you, and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходат-женщина 47-ми лет,замужем,имеет двоих детей.Она начала свой бизнес с одного маленкого стола,который ставила возле входа в вещевой рынок.Её мужу Икрому пришлось уехать на заработки в Россию,где заработав небольшую сумму он решил вложить в бизнес своей жены.Сейчас они имеют хорошее место в самом центре вещевого рынка.На полученный кредит Шаходат решила привезти из Истаравшана сезонный товар и этим расширить свой ассортимент.До осени она решила накопить намного денег на учёбу своего сына.
texts.en:
Shahodat is a 47-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. She started her business with one small table that she placed near the clothing market entrance. Her husband had to go to Russia for work, where he earned a small sum of money and decided to invest it in his wife’s business. They now have a store right in the center of the clothing market. Shahodat wants to use this loan to bring in seasonal goods from Istaravshan and expand her assortment. Before autumn, she decided to save some money to use for her son’s education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These is Mariama K., Marie S., Sallay K., Aminata F., and Fatmata Kanu. They call their group Tasuthekeh. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to strengthen their businesses. This will helped them a lot as sales will improve, profit increase and consequently their standard of living will also improve.

Mariama is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Waterloo, twenty miles form Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is thirty-four years of age, married with three children – two in secondary and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days. She sells cottons. With this loan, she will add onto her present business capital to buy a bale of cotton. A bale of cotton costs Le 1,400,000.

loans.use: Buy a bale of cotton

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi is 40 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.en:
These people are Mariama B., Isatu F., Hawa K., and Fatu K.. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are each requesting a loan of Le 500,000. These loans will be of great help to these entrepreneurs. It will enable them to expand their businesses, make better sales and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their living standards.

Mariama (right) is the leader of this group. Mariama is now forty years of age. She was born in Koso Town, Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is married with five children. Three of her children are already grown-ups; one is in junior secondary school and the other is not yet of school-going age. She pays for their education with proceeds from the cooked rice she sells.

Mariama has been in the cooked rice business for three years now. With this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients in large quantity. She will buy bags of rice, gallons of palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and a lot of dried fish.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients in larger quantity

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells groceries. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Comfort is 44 years old and married with five children. She says thank you, and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Amanecer se conformó en el mes de agosto del 2008, por la iniciativa de la señora Basilisa A., cuya función en el grupo es la presidencia. La misma viendo las necesidades de sus vecinas y amigas se interesó por el programa y convocó a una reunión con la respectiva asesora de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Después de dicha reunión todas muy motivadas decidieron conformar un comité, el cual hasta hoy día ha cumplido en forma excelente sus pagos.

La mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a actividades comerciales como: venta de mercerías, comidas, ropas, frutas y verduras, etc.

Todas las integrantes del grupo manifiestan su contento ya que gracias a esta oportunidad sus ingresos han aumentado y de esta manera han proporcionado una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Valoran la oportunidad de obtener un crédito con accesibilidad rápida ya que para ellas es muy fundamental contar con capital de trabajo, por dicho motivo se sienten muy comprometidas y activan dentro del comité fomentando la solidaridad, la unión y comprensión.

Basilisa A.	- Venta de comidas - 
María Angela B.	- Venta de mercería - 
María Evergista B. - 	Venta de mercería - 
Fermina C. - 	Venta de comidas - 
Benigna A. - 	Venta de comidas - 
Felicita Pavón - 	Venta de ropas - 
Clara B. - 	Venta de ropas - 
Elva A. - 	Venta de verduras - 
Norma D. - 	Despensa - 
Carmen D. - 	Venta de ropas - 
María Benita Benítez - 	Venta de mercerias - 
Pabla A.	- Venta de comidas - 
Andrea M. -	Venta de mercería - 
Sofia E. - 	Venta de frutas - 
Perla López - 	Venta de ropas -
texts.en:
The Amanecer Group was formed in august of 2008 and was founded by Señora Basilisa A., who acts as the group's president. Basilisa saw that her friends and neighbours needed some financial help and became interested in the credit offered by Fundación Paraguaya after meeting with one of their administrators. After that meeting, the members of Amanecer founded their group and have always been extremely responsible with their payments. Amanacer's members have small businesses. Basilisa A., Pabla A., Fermina C., and Benigna A. sell meals; Andrea M., María Angela B., María Evergista B., and María Benita Benítez sell household goods and hardware supplies; Felicita Pavón, Clara B., Carmen D., and Perla López sell clothing; Elva A. sells vegetables; Sofia E. sells fruit; and Norma D. runs a corner store. All of the group's members are very happy that, thanks to this opportunity, their incomes have risen and they have been able to better their children's quality of life. Having easy access to credit and working capital has made a huge difference for the group, and because they value this, they are very committed to communal banking. They work in solidarity with one another as a team and work to understand and support one another.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes, vegetables, household goods, hardware supplies etc.

loans.name: Ta Ram Group

texts.en:
These people are Alie T., Foday K., and Abdul K. T.. They named their group Ta Ram, a Temne phrase for “Let us pay back”. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each in order to give a boost to their businesses. With the profit generated from their businesses, these entrepreneurs will be able to pay their children’s school fees. They will also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated.

Alie T. (left) is the leader of the group. He is forty-two years of age. He was born in Yoni, in Tokolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have six children, some in primary and others in secondary schools.

Alie sells bicycle and motorbike spare parts and house-building materials. He has been a businessman since childhood days. With this loan, Alie will buy two cartons of nails. A carton of nails costs Le 250,000.

loans.use: Buy two cartons of nails

loans.name: Oshinowo

texts.en: Oshinowo sells tailoring supplies and she also weaves material. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring supplies to sell. She is 37 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and a weaving machine

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola sells kerosene in bottles and gallons. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. Olushola is 27 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is Bai T., a local entrepreneur in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Bai sells house-building materials, chairs, and mats. He wants a loan in order to strengthen his business. With a loan, he will be able to buy bags of cement which are currently lacking in his shop.

Bai is thirty-two years of age, married to a businesswoman, and the two of them have four children together, all of whom are still in primary school. Bai was born in Makeni City and has been a businessman for four years now.

This will be the first loan Bai is accessing from Kiva through SMT. He chose to access a loan from Kiva in order to strengthen his business. From this business, Bai feeds his family, sends his children to school, and pays medical bills for members of his family.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
These people are Ramatu J., Mohamed S. T., and Mariama J.. They calle their group Believe in God. This is the first loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Ramatu (left) is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. She is forty-nine years of age, married with seven children, three of whom are still in Junior and Senior Secondary Schools. Her husband is a businessman, too. Ramatu sells cottons, second-hand clothes and cartons of eggs. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now. She will invest this loan in her business.

loans.use: Invest in her cotton and used-clothing business

loans.name: Be Honest Ii Group

texts.en:
These people are Fatmata J., Zainab M., Nenneh J., Nenneh K., and Kady K.. They call their group Be Honest II. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva. They’re requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to enable them to expand their businesses. This will help them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems.

Fatmata (second from left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is thirty-eight years of age, married with three children. Two of her children are in junior secondary school and one is in primary school. Fatmata sells rice, oil, sugar, salt, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and many more items. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Fast Moving Group

texts.en:
These are Adama K., Isatu T., and Suad B.. They named their group Fast Moving. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each. This loan will create meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees. They will also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.

Adama K. (middle) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-eight years of age and was born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they have three children. Their first child is no longer attending school and the other two are in Junior Secondary Schools. Adama owns a grocery store. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru: Ашурова Угулжон -женщина 47-ми лет,замужем имеет 3-х детей.Вот уже более 5-ти лет она занимается продажей одежды. Также у неё дома имеется большой земельный участок, на котором она посадила огурцы и помидоры. В период закруток Угулжон будет консервировать свои овощи с огорода. У Угулжон сестра наш давнишний клиент , которая кредитуется для продажи продуктов питания. Она посоветовала своей сестре расширить свой ассортимент.Сейчас для Угулой начался сезон,поэтому она обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Uguljon A. is a 47-year-old woman, who is married and has three children. This is the fifth year she has sold clothing. Additionally, at home she has a large plot of ground on which she plants cucumbers and tomatoes. At canning time, Uguljon will can the vegetables from her garden. Uguljon's sister has been a longtime client of MicroInvest, and has taken out loans for the sale of food products. She advised her sister to expand the line of goods she carries. It is now the beginning of a new season for Uguljon, and therefore she has come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
Comité Jazmín, así se denomina el comité integrado por 16 mujeres del Bº Anahí de la ciudad de Capiatá. Este grupo se conformó gracias a que la actual presidenta Valentina A.. Ella se acercó a la asesora en una reunión que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  La misma quedó muy entusiamada y logró conformar su grupo en fecha 12 de setiembre del 2008 con 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con este programa.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropas artesanales, venta de frutas y verduras, venta comidas, venta de remedios refrescantes, venta de golosinas, venta de ropas de propia confección, etc.

Todas las integrantes del grupo demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Valentina A. - 	Confección y venta de ropas artesanales - 
Silvina M.	 - Venta de comidas. - 
Rosa A.	 - Venta de ropas y lencerias - 
Marina Pérez	 - Venta de comidas -  
Celia González	 - Venta de comidas - 
Milda R.	 - Venta de  golosinas - 
Gladys González	 - Costurera - 
Nilva P.	 - Venta de remedios refrescantes - 
Ida E.	 - Venta de lencerias - 
Evangelista A.	 - Venta de comidas y bebidas - 
Limpia P. 	 - Venta de comidas - 
Andresa Benítez	 - Venta de comidas - 
Gladys López	 - Venta de bebidas - 
Gloria P.	 - Venta de bebidas - 
Adriana I.	- Venta de verduras -
texts.en:
The Jazmín group is comprised of 16 women from Bº Anahí, in Capiatá city. The group was formed thanks to its current president, Valentina A.. She approached one of Fundacion Paraguaya's administrators at a neighbourhood meeting held to promote female entrepreneurs and communal banking, and was so enthusiastic about the program that she founded the Jazmín group, along with 15 other women, on September 12th, 2008. They are all very happy to be working with the program. The group's members will use this loan for their businesses: Silvina M., Marina Pérez, Celia González, Limpia P. , Andresa Benítez, and Evangelista A. sell meals; Milda R. sells sweets; Rosa A. and Ida E. sell clothing and lingerie; Valentina A. makes and sells traditional clothing; Gladys González is a tailor; Adriana I. sells vegetables; and Nilva P., Gladys López, and Gloria P. sell drinks. All the group's members work in solidarity with one another. They attend weekly meetings and always work with the well being of the entire group in mind.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals, material for clothing production, ect.

loans.name: Help Me Group

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Iris A. T., Yeabu K., Rugiatu K. and Adamsay K.. They named their group Help Me.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, which is twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This will be their first loan form SMT/Kiva. This loan will, however, create a meaningful impact in the lives of these borrowers. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They will also be able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loan. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL, each, to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mrs. Iris A. T. (left) is the leader of the group. She is sixty-one years of age. She was born in Waterloo. Her husband is now retired and the two of them have five children, all grown-up. Mrs. Iris A. T. has built a primary school in Waterloo where she is serving as Head Teacher. She is also a businesswoman; she sells stationery. She has been in this business for twelve years now.

loans.use: Invest into her business

loans.name: Vanice's Group

texts.en: K. Vanice is the leader of Bihanga II group in Ibanda. She works very hard at her used clothing business. She is thirty-two years old and married with five children, ages ten, eight, six, four and two. She also cares for two orphans. She started her business in 2005 and sells daily at the market, where she has regular customers. As a result of having quality clothes in stock, Vanice is able to make a good weekly profit. Her dream is to increase her stock so as to make more profit, and in that way be able to educate all her children, with the help of her husband. She needs a loan to be able to meet her customers' needs by adding more clothes to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ilie

texts.en: Ilie, who has worked in retail since 2001, operates a business marketing food products and cosmetics. He is married and lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in an apartment in Balti town. Sales are made in several shops in Balti. He leases booths that are open around the clock and also has a boutique inside the METRO. Ilie needs a loan to diversify his existing inventory in order to attract customers from the market. He is also working to maintain his existing clients. Ilie is a responsible person.

loans.use: To promote his business by diversifying inventory.

loans.name: Sister United Group

texts.en:
This is Bondu M., Monica KaM., Amie L., Konba S. and Jeninatu KaM.. They named their group Sisters United.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan they are requesting from SMT/Kiva. They would like a loan to enable each of them to further develop their businesses, make better sales and higher profits, and consequently improve on their living standards.

Bondu M. (left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-two years old. She was born in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone. Her husband is a police officer and they have four children in primary schools and a baby. Bondu has been a businesswoman for over nine years now.
 
Bondu sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, bread, mayonnaise, sardines etc. in a kiosk outside of her house. At the corner, she also sells market foods like rice, salt, onions, margarine and so on. She will invest this loan into her business by adding a more extensive variety of items to those she now sells.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: We Go Able Group

texts.en:
This group is called We Go Able, a Krio phrase for “We Can”. They are all businesspeople in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are seeking from SMT. With this loan, they will be able to build up their businesses, make better profits, and consequently improve their living standards.   

Their leader is Mohamed S. (second from right). Mohamed was born in Lunsar, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is forty years old. He has two wives and twelve children between the ages of one and twenty. His wives are also businesswomen who assist him in the running of the home. Mohamed sells cigarettes, gari (a food made from cassava), ground-nuts and any other local produce brought into the market. He has been in business since his childhood days.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses.

loans.name: Nicolae

texts.en: Nicolae's main type of activity is the wholesale trade of non-food products that are intended for children and newborns, such as any articles and accessories needed for childcare. One of the reasons for wishing to contract a loan with Microinvest/Kiva is that he needs to replace his reserves, and he would also like to be able to take orders for items that are not currently in stock. The loan will also allow him to bring in products from Odessa, where they can be purchased for less.

loans.use: To increase his stock of goods.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: T. Margaret is a polite and hard-working lady, and these qualities help her relate well with her customers. She is the leader of Ndekye Tukwatanise group in Bushenyi. She is sixty-four years old and has four children, the youngest being twenty-eight years old. She helps to care for eight orphans who are in school by helping pay for their school fees, as well as contributing to their general welfare. Margaret has a shop with a variety of merchandise including firewood. She is faced with the scarcity of firewood because there is a government policy to stop people from encroaching on the forests. Since her business has been strategically positioned in the town center for seventeen years, she makes a good profit that helps her to care for her family. She would like to achieve her dream of working from her own premises so as to avoid rent. She also wants to educate all her grandchildren so that they can take care of her when she is too old to work. Margaret needs a loan to buy sacks of beans and ground nuts to increase her shop stock.

loans.use: To buy beans and ground nuts to increase her shop stock.

loans.name: Short Street Strikers Group

texts.en:
Those pictured are Zainab T., Mohamed P. K., Alhaji B., Ibrahim J. and Aminata S.. They named their group Short Street Strikers, named after the street where the group leader sells. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. 

They are requesting a loan to enable them to buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and improve on their livelihood. 

Zainab T. (front row left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-three years old and a widow with three children.  All of her children are still in primary school. Zainab pays their school fees and also feeds and clothes them with the little profit she makes out of her business. With this loan her profit margin will increase and her living situation will improve.  Zainab sells soft drinks and “rubber drinks” (novelty coasters), cold water, and gari (food made out of cassava). She has been in this business for three years. She will invest this new loan on the same business because she is familiar with these types of items and can do well with them.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and invest in the gari business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks in her shop. Faith is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Faith is a LAPO client. Faith hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says  thank you to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Isioma

texts.en: Isioma sells medicines, cosmetics and provisions. Her shop is open from Mondays to Sundays. Isioma is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Isioma is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: N. Joyce is the leader of Akutwala ekiro group in Kyebando. She is a hard-working lady and a widow with three children, ages twenty-five, twenty-three and twenty-one. She has run her business selling fresh fruits and vegetables for seven years, and she is grateful that previous loans have helped to expand her business and to attract more customers. Joyce has a dream of starting up a wholesale shop, and she believes she will achieve it. She also hopes to have all her children turn into very responsible citizens. She needs a loan to be able to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Those pictured are Zainab K., Abie S., Mabinty K. and Mummy T.. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan, which will help them to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses. As a result they will make better profits and improve their standards of living. 

Zainab (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight years old and was born in Yoni, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with five children, two of whom are in primary school and three who are in secondary school. Zainab sells dried fish, rice and gari (food made out of cassava), and she has been in this business for more than ten years. She will invest her loan into her fish and gari business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: M.c.a Secondary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A. Secondary School, Magburaka. The school was founded in 2004 by the Missionary Church of Africa. It has a total of twelve staff and four hundred and fifty-one pupils. Ahmed Y. S. (second from left) is the principal at this school and the leader of this group.

Teachers at this school have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan. With this loan, some will invest in a business or give to their wives to invest in a business. Some will use their loan to buy furniture, while others will use it either to pay school fees for themselves to pursue further studies, or to pay their children’s school fees. Left with their monthly salaries alone, they are not able to do much. However, with this loan they will be able to invest in bigger projects, and out of their monthly salaries they will gradually repay the loan.

Mr. Mara was born in Yiffin village in the Koinadugu district in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-two years old and married with four children. All of his children are attending schools – two in primary school and one in Junior Secondary School. For two years, Mr. Mara has been working in agriculture. With his loan he will buy seed rice and pay laborers. Through farming, Mr. Mara supplements his meager monthly salary.

loans.use: Buy seed rice and pay labor.

loans.name: Angella's Group

texts.en:
N. Angella is the leader of Twekozese group in Kyebando. She is a devoted young lady and married with 3 children, aged 1 to 6 years. She has a business selling foodstuffs from Kyebando and in most cases supplying them to her customers in their residences. She has enough business experience and she would like to expand her business more. Her food stuffs include matooke (plantains), cassava, sweet potatoes, and greens.

Angella has a dream of buying a house and having a rich and God-fearing family. She needs a loan to be able to pay school fees for her children come next term as well as buying more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Tochi

texts.en: Tochi is 25 years old and married with 2 children. Tochi sells electronics in her shop at Alaba International Market in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50, 000 naira ($ 350US) to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell  .

loans.name: Okechi

texts.en: Okechi sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop. She is an active LAPO client. Okechi is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. Okechi lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50, 000 naira ($350US) to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelita S. is residing at Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, a widow with 5 children and she is living with her daughter. In spite of her husband's death, she was able to raise her children with her little business, a "sari-sari" (small grocery) store, and she also engages in farming, planting bananas and corn.

She started her "sari-sari" store with a little capital and her neighbors and friends are her customers. She joined PMPC 2 years ago, and she is a very participative and active member, even in spite of her age. As of this time, she is applying for a loan of Php 3,000 as additional capital to purchase grocery stocks.

Her plan is to extend the area of her "sari-sari" store and be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Chidebere

texts.en: Chidebere sells electrical accessories at Alaba Market in Lagos state, Nigeria. Chidebere is 24 years old and happily married, with 2 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 ($700 US) to purchase more electrical materials like fuse, plugs, etc to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo. New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School was established in 2006 by Harold E. T., an American who got donations from missionaries. The school has a staff of seven teachers and 173 pupils.

This will be the first loan teachers of the New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo are requesting from SMT/Kiva. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, especially so for people in the teaching profession, they could not use such salaries to buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use their loan to begin or continue building a house; others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use the loan to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still, others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

John B. (third from right) is a head teacher at the School. He was born in Bo district, southern Sierra Leone. He is age twenty-eight, married with one child who is in class one. He has been a teacher for five years now. However, John supplements teaching with some petty-trading. He will therefore invest this loan in his palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) business. He will be able to get at least ten barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil which he will store until there is a price hike.

loans.use: Buy at least ten barters of palm oil

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Mrs. Bienvinida G. is a resident of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, 40 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer and carpenter. She joined PMPC 4 years ago and the Co-op became her help in accomplishing her plans and project. She is one of the active members of Kaymito Center. Right now she is applying for a loan of Php 14,900 for the purpose of purchasing housing materials to renovate her house.

Her future plan is to be able to send her children to college and to be able to renovate her house. Above all, she hopes that her husband will have good produce in the farm so that they can pay their loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for her house

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian sells second hand clothes and shoes in her shop. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her goods to sell in Lagos state. Lillian is 45 years old and married, with 2 children. Lillian hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50, 000 ($350 US)to purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ludy L. is 41 years old, residing at Gango, Ozamiz City with 2 children, and her husband is a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver in the City of Ozamiz. She is a new member of PMPC and joined the Co-op because of programs and services that she admires a lot.

Her little "sari-sari" (variety) store started up 2 years ago and it became a great help in bringing income to her family. As of this time, she is applying for a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 as additional capital to purchase grocery items for her "sari-sari" store.

Her future plan is to be able to expand her grocery store and to send her children to college.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Sari-sari" store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet sells clothes and tailoring materials. She is also a fashion designer.  Juliet has 3 sewing machines and 2 girls assisting her in sewing. Juliet is 30 years old and married, with 2 children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 ($350 US) to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las Reynas” organizadas bajo la presidencia D. la señora Polina van cursando su primer ciclo con entusiasmo y ganas D. salir adelante con sus diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, venta D. cosméticos y a actividades como la artesanía, construcción D. viviendas, carpintería y al servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia en el mercado no es impedimento para las socias puedan salir adelante ya que ellas aseguran que sus productos son D. buena calidad y a un precio razonable. El destino del financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus negocios con la adquisición D. materiales y herramientas que coadyuven al mejoramiento D. sus negocios y por enD. a sus ingresos familiares para brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad D. vida para ellos. En general el grupo tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que obtenían crédito D. instituciones similares a la Fundación agrocapital por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos para que estos sean un beneficio para cada uno D. sus miembros.
texts.en:
The “Las Reynas” Communal Bank, with Señora Polina as their president, are embarking on their first loan cycle with enthusiasm and a desire to succeed. They run a variety of businesses, some selling meals, cosmetics, and traditional crafts and clothing; and others doing construction, carpentry, and running public transport services. The group's members have a lot of experience in their respective fields: they know that the quality of the goods and services they offer is high while their prices remain reasonable. This loan will be used to buy the materials and tools needed for the group's members to expand and improve their businesses, thus increasing each of their household's income and allowing them to offer a better education and overall quality of life to their children. Most of the group's members have previous experience with communal banking and know how to responsibly manage loans so that every member of the group benefits equally.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer
