loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chineye

texts.en: Chineye is 30 years old and married with a child. She is a tailor by profession and also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Chineye is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia S., a widow, 45 years old, is a member of PDP-LP micro-finance program. She is a farmer and micro-entrepreneur, a resident of Guba, Clarin, Mis. Occ., who earns income from gathering firewood and cutting it into pieces. She also buys firewood at wholesale prices from her neighborhood to be retailed to her loyal customers and store owners, specifically in Ozamiz City. Presently, she is cultivating their corn land.

Another source of income is her clothes-washing service. She was unable to send her 7 children to school because of the financial crisis she experienced as a widow and the sole breadwinner for her family. Her sons and daughters help her with their daily work, especially in cultivating and maintaining their corn land for consumption. She plans to buy motorcycle for the delivery of her firewood. She also plans to renovate her old house.

Now, she is applying for the amount of PHP 6,000 in her 8th loan cycle for additional capital for her firewood business and for purchasing fertilizer for their corn land.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and additional capital for firewood business

loans.name: Virgen De Urkupiña Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Virgen D. Urkupiña"  se organizaron bajo la dirección D. su presidenta la señora Jahana Vanessa para acceder al financiamiento que les otorga agrocapital cursando juntos su segundo siclo demostrando ser gente honesta y capaz para el cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones y con la premisa D. seguir creciendo junto a la institución. La finalidad del financiamiento es  respaldar el crecimiento D. las diferentes actividades que desarrollan dentro D. la comercialización D. productos metalúrgicas, comida, cosméticos y alguno D. los socios desea independizarse y empezar un nuevo negocio siendo su actividad actual cuidador D. viñedos y empleadas domesticas todo con el afán D. buscar nuevas oportunidades D. mejor su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias. La competencia en el mercado no es un impedimento para salir adelante por lo que no temen a ningún obstáculo para poder llegar a su objetivo, una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank "Virgen D. Urkupina" organized themselves under the direction of their president, Jahana Vanessa, to access financial support through Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner). They are currently on their second loan cycle and they have shown themselves to be honest and capable individuals with respect to their obligations and wth the premise of continued growth. The goal of loan is to support the expansion of the different business activities including the comercialisation of metallurgical products, foods, cosmetics, and some members have expressed their plan to make themselves independent and start out a new business, especially those that have their own vineyards and those who work in the cleaning industry. They hope to discover new and opportunities and find a better way of life for themselves and their family. The market competition is not a roadblock for their success because they are not intimidated by any obstablce to achieve their goal, that is, a better life for their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Shade

texts.en: Shade is 32 years old and married with four children. Shade sells clothes. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Luisa es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Luisa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende calzados, actividad que realiza todos los días, además los días lunes vende en la feria de las nazarenas.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sandalias y zapatos.
Los sueños de Luisa con tener capital propio y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Maria Celeste community bank. Luisa, 33, is married and has 4 children. Luisa has a stall at the 12 de Abril market where sells footwear every day. On Mondays she also sells at the Nazarenas Fair. Luisa needs a loan for 1,250 PEN to buy sandals and shoes. Luisa’s dreams are to have her own capital and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and shoes

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Felipa es soltera, tiene 56 años y 1 hijo, Felipa tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, confecciona edredones, sabanas que vende en los mercados también vende ropa a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito.
Felipa necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Felipa son ampliar su taller con mas maquinas.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Maria Celeste community bank. Felipa, 56, is married and has a son. Felipa has a sewing shop in her house. She makes quilts and sheets that she sells in the markets. She also makes clothes to order. Her sales are on credit. Felipa needs a loan for 2,500 PEN to buy fabric. Felipa’s dream is to expand her shop with more machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Olurunti

texts.en: Olurunti is 30 years old and married with one child. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks in her shop. Olurunti is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Vicenta es viuda, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Vicenta vende golosinas, bebidas, de manera ambulatoria cerca de un colegio particular, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, actividad que raliza de lunes a sábado.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Vicenta sueña con tener un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales,
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Maria Celeste community bank. Vincenta, 42, is a widow, and she has 2 children. Vicenta is a street vendor who sells sweets and drinks near a private school. She uses a tricycle and sells from Monday through Saturday. Vicenta needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy sweets and soft drinks. Vicenta dreams of having a stable location and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde sells clothes. She has been in this business since 2006.

Kehinde is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She remains grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Maruja es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Maruja junto a su esposo venden mercería como jabones, cremas dentales, candados, en el mercado 12 de abril, actividad que realizan todos los días.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jabones, detergente, crema dental.
Los sueños de Maruja son construir su casa, tener una bodega en casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Maria Celeste Village Bank. She is 40-years-old, married, and has 2 children. Every day she and her husband sell small articles, including soaps, toothpaste, and padlocks, at the "12 de Abril" market. Maruja is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles which she plans to use to buy soaps, detergents, and toothpaste. Her dreams include building a house, opening a grocery store in her home, and having her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, detergents, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Cinthya Jakylin

texts.es:
Cynthia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Cynthia es casada, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Cynthia vende gelatinas que prepara con la ayuda de su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta del hospital de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Cynthia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, gelatina.
Los sueños de Cynthia son tener una tienda de calzados y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a member of the Banco Comunal Maria Celeste. She is married, 22 years old, and has 2 sons. Cynthia sells jellies that she prepares with the help of her husband. She conducts her sales near the doorway of the Ayacucho city hospital, coming there every day to sell. Cynthia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar and gelatin. Cynthia's dreams are to have a footwear store and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, gelatina.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is married with five children. She is 50 years old. She sells provisions, local gin, and bags of salt.

Iyabo is requesting a loan for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more local gin, provisions, and bags of salt to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and bags of salt to sell.

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
Adewumi sells kerosene and provisions. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Adewumi is requesting a loan for the amount of 50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Maria es soltera, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende mochilas variadas, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, surtir su negocio y comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Maria Celeste Village Bank. She is 44, single, and has 2 children. She rents space for a store where she spends every day selling different kinds of backpacks, which she gets in Lima. Maria is seeking a loan of 3,000 soles to buy backpacks. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals, of having a fully stocked store, and buying a piece of land where she can build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy backpacks.

loans.name: Balvidio Marcelino

texts.es: Don Balvidio Marcelino C.  P. cuenta con 35   años de edad, es casado y se dedica a la artesanía, elaborando manteles  típicos habita junto a su esposa conjuntamente, a la actividad a la que se dedica, lleva 8  años de elaborar este producto  se encuentra en el Paraje Cholajcruz del Cantón Paqui  del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente, las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades  por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de poder cubrir la demanda de su trabajo en la elaboración de manteles típicos  por tal razón necesita cubrir la demanda de su trabajo como también mejorar sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Balvidio Marcelino C. P. is 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife in the Paraje Cholajcruz del Canton Paqui district in Totonicapan, Guatemala. He is a textiles artisan and has spent the past 8 years designing and creating typical tablecloths from his region in Guatemala. Currently, his economic conditions are unstable and he finds himself lacking resources to make ends meet. It is for this reason that he reached out the ASDIR Association and applied for a loan so that he could purchase materials for the orders of tablecloths he has outstanding, and in turn help him provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (compra de materia Prima) - to purchase high quality materials in order to make his tablecloths

loans.name: Ivonne Monica

texts.es:
Ivonne es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Ivonne es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Ivonne junto a su esposo brindan servicios de cerrajería, reparación, elaboracion de llaves, chapas, actividad que realizan a domicilio y tambien en un puesto ambulante en el mercado Magdalena.
Ivonne necesita un prestamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de chapas y llaves.
Los sueños de Ivonne es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a member of the Maria Celeste Village Bank. She is 29, and has a common-law husband and 2 children. She and her husband work every day, providing locksmith services, and making and repairing keys and locks, from home and from a cart in the Magdalena market. Ivonne is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy locks and keys. She dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locks and keys.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es socio del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Jorge es casado, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Jorge junto a su esposa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende comida y también reparte a los comerciantes del mercado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jorge necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar por sacos.
Los sueños de Jorge son que su hijo ingrese a la universidad y tener un local propio y estable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the Maria Celeste Community Bank. He is 45 years old, is married and has two children. Jorge and his wife have a sales post in the 12 de Abril Market, where he sells food daily, and also serves the commercial businesses of the marketplace. Jorge is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD), with which he plans to purchase large sacks of rice and sugar for use in his business. Jorge hopes that his son can attend university and he also hopes to have his own stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para en la compra de arroz, azúcar por sacos. (For the purchase of sacks of rice and sugar)

loans.name: Lorenzo Romulio

texts.es: Don Lorenzo Romilio B. López  cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casado y se dedica a la artesanía, elaborando cortes típicos habita junto a su esposa y con sus 5 hijos, conjuntamente con sus esposa, a la actividad a la que se dedica, lleva 11 años de elaborar este producto se encuentra ubicado en el paraje Chupachec, cantón Juchanep Departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente, las  condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y la anta demande de su producto por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar  materia prima y de contratar mas personas en su pequeño taller de Artesania  así también surtir aun más su producto, como también mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr.Lorenzo Romilio B. López is 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife and 5 children. He is a textile artisan and has been designing and creating different textile accessories (tipical to the the Chupachec region, cantón Juchanep District of Totonicapán, Guatemala) for the past 11 years. Currently, due to the slow economic conditions, he finds himself without sufficient resources to cover the demand of his clients. It is for this reason that he has reached out to the ASDIR Association and has requested a loan. He will use the loan to purchase good quality materials for his craft and to hire more people to work in his shop. This will hopefully help him meet his clients' demands as well as bring in more income.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (Ampliacion de capital) - to expand his capital

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing produces and sells ice blocks in her shop. She is 30 years old and happily married with three children.

Blessing is requesting a loan for the of amount of N50,000 to purchase one deep freezer. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for her ice business.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Clotilde es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Clotilde tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende frutas por mayor, sus productos los compra en la selva ayacuchana.
Clotilde necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de naranja y mandarina.
Los sueños de Clotilde son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the Maria Celeste Community Bank. She is married, has 5 children and is 38 years old. Clotilde has a sales post in a market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells fruit at wholesale prices. She needs this loan to purchase oranges and tangerines to sell through her business. Clotilde dreams of building her own home and that her children grow to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de naranja y mandarina. (To purchase oranges and tangerines)

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness sells drinks and cooked foods. She is 36 years old and married with a child.

Happiness is requesting a loan for the amount of N150,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell in her restaurant. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Eva Felipa

texts.es: Doña Eva B. cuenta con 32 años de edad, es casada de oficios Talabartera, “Elaboración de Calzado para dama” cuenta con un taller de 2 maquinas, habita junto a con  su  esposo e hija,  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 6 años de elaborar calzado en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hija, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Eva B., 32, is married and makes women’s shoes. She has a shop with 2 machines. She lives with her husband and daughter. They all do the same work, and they have 3 employees. She has been making shoes for 6 years in her home; which is in Caserío Xetinimit, in the town of Nimasac, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Customer demand is currently growing, but her economic conditions are not sufficient for her to increase her capital. That is why she has come to the Asociación ADIR to ask for a loan. She will buy raw materials to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to be able to help her daughter get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrats (Increase capital)

loans.name: Rukayat

texts.en: Rukayat is 27 years old and married with a child. She sells foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maria Benigna

texts.es: La señora María Y. tiene 34 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto con sus hijos , ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Zaculeu, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Y. is 34 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver, "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with three looms and lives together with her suns. She and her husband both work in the same trade and also have two employees in the same activity. Maria has spent eight years making skirts in her home, which is located in the hamlet of Zaculeu in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Now, the demand from her customers has increased, but because of the current economic conditions they aren't able at present to increase their capital. It's for this reason that she approached ASDIR association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and so be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerical (Increase capital)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa V. tiene 56 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa V. is 56 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her children. She and her husband both work in the same trade and have two employees working in the same activity. She has 12 years experience making skirts in her home, which is located in Chotacaj hamlet, in the V. neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán , Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers is growing, but because of the current economic climate she is not able to increase her capital. It's for this reason that Teresa approached the ASDIR Association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of purchasing primary materials and in this way be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesan: Increase capital

loans.name: Tobi

texts.en: Tobi is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She sells weavons and hair extensions. She is also a hair stylist. Tobi requests a loan of N60,000 to purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana B. tiene 52 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 35 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Primero Palemop, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana B. is 52 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her children. She and her husband both work in the same trade and have two employees working in the same activity. She has 35 years experience making skirts in her home, which is located in Primero Palemop hamlet, in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán , Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers is growing, but because of the current economic climate she is not able to increase her capital. It's for this reason that Teresa approached the ASDIR Association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of purchasing primary materials and in this way be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesan: Increase capital

loans.name: Ford Group

texts.en:
Pili A. is the group leader of the Ford group. Two months ago, she opened a shop where she sells household necessities like sugar, flour, oil, salt, water, juice, and soap. These items are sold both retail and wholesale - wholesale moves her inventory faster, but the retail items help to add to her profit. 


Before opening her duka (shop), Pili sold "madila" (long dresses and head coverings for Muslim women) door to door. She changed businesses when she grew tired of moving around and desired something more permanent. 


This is her first loan with Tujijenge. Pili plans to purchase more inventory for the shop, so that she can expand sales. She currently is making about 350,000 Tanzanian Schillings (approx 270 USD) a month and hopes that this loan will help to increase her profits. 


Pili is divorced and cares for three children - two boys, ages 19 and 14, and one girl, age 8. She is passionate about educating her children and also plans to someday build a house.


The Ford group consists of 26 members - 24 women and 2 men. They each have separate businesses - selling cosmetics, cereals, charcoal, fruit, shoes, clothes, fish, or food. Two members also have hair salons. The group members hold each other accountable for the repayments of their loans.

loans.use: The group leader will purchase sugar, soap, flour and other items for her store

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Florida, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. Medicamentos, abarrotes en general, condimentos, comidas, ropa, animales menores y frutas.
	
Como es el caso D. Cristina es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Cristina tiene una pequeña botica en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. su esposo, el préstamo que obtendrá Cristina será invertido en L. compra D. medicina.
	
Por otro lado Edilberta es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Edilberta junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual su esposo realiza taxi. Su préstamo era invertido en el pago D. las letras del carro.
	
Mientras que Diana es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Diana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. su esposo. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. verduras, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, frutas variados.

Los sueños D. las socias son terminar sus estudios, equipar su negocio, comprar un terreno, abrir un negocio mas rentable y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Florida Community Bank: the bank has initiated its third cycle with 18 members. The members have different businesses such as the sale of medication, general groceries, condiments, food, clothes, young animals and fruits. To take the case of Cristina, she is married, aged 30 and has 3 sons. Cristina has a small boutique in her house, which she opens every day with the help of her husband. The loan Cristina will obtain will be invested in buying medicine. On the other hand, Edilberta is a co-habitee, she is 29 years old and has one son. Edilberta together with her partner have a car which her partner uses to work as a taxi driver. Their loan will be invested in paying for the car's paperwork. Meanwhile Diana is also a co-habitee, she is aged 24 and has 3 children. Diana has a house with groceries in his house, an activity she undertakes everyday with her husband's help. The members need different-sized loans such as 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, making a grand total of 12 950 soles from the Community Bank. These loans will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothes, various fruit. The dreams of the members are to finish their studies, equip their businesses, buy land, to open a more profitable business and to build a house respectively.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothes and various fruit.

loans.name: Mandela A Group

texts.en:
Mariam J., 45, is married with six children, who are 22, 21, 20, 18, 16 and 12 years old. She fries and sells chicken and fish in Kiburugwa, a place just outside the city center. She started the business in 2000 and works from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $124.

This will be Mariam’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She used the previous loans to increase her chicken and fish business and has paid back her loans successfully. She wants to get her fourth loan to increase the capital of her business.

Mariam will share this loan with subgroup A of the Mandela group. The subgroup has six members, who sell clothes, bites, food and milling. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is first from the right.

loans.use: To increase business capital and buy more chicken and fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa Vásquez tiene 62 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y Venta de Cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño negocio, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo, lleva 20 años de vender cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Zaculeu, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa Vásquez is 62 years old and is married. She is a retail trader "Buying and Selling typical skirts for women". She has a small business and lives together with her children. She and her husband both work in the same trade. She has 20 years' experience selling skirts in her home, which is located in Zaculeu hamlet, in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers is growing, but because of the current economic climate she is not able to increase her capital. It's for this reason that Teresa approached the ASDIR Association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of purchasing primary materials and in this way be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commercial: Increase capital

loans.name: Jessy

texts.es:
Yessy es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Yessy es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Yessy vende lubricantes de carros en un grifo cerca de su comunidad, su esposo trabaja en el grifo se encarga de la administración del grifo.
Yessy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lubricantes.
Los sueños de Yessy son aumentar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yessy is a member of the Chacco Community Bank. Yessy is a go-getter; she's 34 years old and has a son. Yessy sells automotive lubricants in a shop near her home. Her husband works with her also, as the adminstrator of the shop. Yessy is requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD), which she'll invest in the purchase of auto lubricants she can sell. Yessy dreams of growing her business and being able to afford a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de lubricantes. (To purchase automotive lubricants)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en  general, además Alejandrina se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo y azúcar.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener más capital para surtir su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Chacco Communal Bank. Alejandrina is married, 50 years old and has 4 children. Alejandrina has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, in addition Alejandrina is dedicated to growing vegetables that she then sells in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Alejandrina needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, pasta and sugar. The dreams of Alejandrina are to have more capital to fully stock her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, pasta and sugar

loans.name: Antonia Paulina

texts.es: La señora tiene 24 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hermanos, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia is 24 years old and is single. She is by trade a weaver, "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her siblings. She and her family are dedicated to the same trade and also have two employees in the same activity. For four years she has made skirts in her home, which is located in the hamlet of Chotacaj in the Vásquez neighborhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, the demand from her customers has increased, but because of the current economic conditions they aren't able at present to increase their capital. It's for this reason that she approached the ASDIR association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and so be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Increasing Capital)

loans.name: Neema's Group

texts.en:
Neema Abudallah, age 26, is single with three children ages, 18, 16 and 12 years.  She has a  clothes and a pharmacy business which she started a year ago. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $100. 

This will be Neema’s second’s   loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open a small pharmacy and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants to get her second loan  to increase on the pharmacy  business.

Neema  will share this loan with subgroup c of the Mandela group. The subgroup has 6 members, who sell second hand clothes, sell food, video cassettes and new clothes. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Neema is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase on her pharmacy

loans.name: Juana Nazaria

texts.es: La señora Juana Vásquez 51 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de  Cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo, lleva 22 años de realizar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chocanac, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Vásquez is 51 years old and is married. By trade she is a weaver, "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her children. She, her children and her husband are dedicated to the same trade and for 22 years she has made skirts at her home, which is located in the hamlet of Chotacaj in the Vásquez neighborhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Now, the demand from her customers has increased, but because of the current economic conditions they aren't able at present to increase their capital. It's for this reason that she approached the ASDIR association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and so be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Increasing Capital)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort P. is 50 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are fully independent, while one child attends the senior high school. At present, her priorities are to improve her business and support her child’s education. Comfort lives at Akim Wenchi, a suburb of Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Comfort is a petty trader who sells fresh and dried fish, pepper, groundnut paste, etc. She has been in the business for the past three years. She sells these items on a table in the community market where she lives. She also sells in the surrounding communities during their market days. She takes stock of fish from the river Volta in Ghana and other foodstuffs form the surrounding villages. Due to the financial crunch she is facing currently, she is unable to buy more stuff like gari, groundnut paste, fresh and dried fish, etc. She requests a loan to restock her business and would be grateful for your support. Comfort belongs to the village bank called ‘Nkwagyedom’, which literally means the savior of the multitude or many.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of gari, groundnut paste, fresh and dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia M. is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to a son who just graduated from senior high school. She lives with her family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She has traded for three years in silver and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, and cooking utensils. She sells the cooking utensils through 'hawking', that is  door-to-door selling. She has good demand for her products. She sells on market days in the Oda Market too, which is usually Wednesday. She requests a loan facility to augment her working capital so she can buy more stock of silver and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking utensils and plastics bowls.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Juanita es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Juanita junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras en su comunidad de Chacco y también papa en la comunidad de Iguain, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juanita necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, peones.
Juanita sueña con tener más capital y brindar buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juanita is a member of the Chacco communal bank. Juanita is married, 42 years old and has 7 children. Together with her husband, Juanita is dedicated to growing vegetables in her community of Chacco and also potatoes in the Iguain community. She sells her products in the market in the city of Ayachucho. Juanita needs a loan of 900 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, and to pay for workers. Juanita dreams of having more capital and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizer, payment of workers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married with two children that are currently in school. Her husband is a crop farmer in the village where they live together with the children. Margaret lives in the family house at Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a food vendor, and she serves food like rice and stew. She sells in a community school to the school children. Margeret says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. Margaret also sells grocery products like milk, sugar, and drinks. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help her expand her business so she can earn more income to support her husband, provide support for her family, and finance her children’s education. Margaret belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom which literary means “savior of the multitude or many.” She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza A. is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with four children who are currently in school. Her husband is a diamond dealer in the village where they live together with the children. Adiza lives in the family house at Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and serves food like rice and stew. She sells in the community where they live. Adiza says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. Adiza has been in food production for twenty years now as a means of taking care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help her expand her business and earn more income to support her husband, provide support for her family, and finance her children’s education. Adiza belongs to the village bank called Nkwa Nsuo which literary means “living waters.” She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Cusi Urpi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Pajarito Feliz, el Banco inicia el ciclo 30 con 27 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, frutas, abarrotes en general, calzados, ropa, miel D. abeja, cereales, leña, mercería, cosméticos y servicios D. cosmetología.

Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth venD. calzados a pedido, además D. panes que reparte a los trabajadores D. las instituciones, sus ventas son al crédito.
Por otro lado Edith es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Edith hace manualidades D. acuerdo al pedido D. sus clientes, además venD. ropa a pedido.
	

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas, ropa, leña, zapatos y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar su negocio, superarse como persona y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Cusi Urpi Communal Bank (which means Happy Little Parrot) began its 30th cycle with 27 members. The members perform different businesses such as selling food, fruits, general groceries, footwear, clothing, honey, cereals, wood, crafts, cosmetics and cosmetic services. Elizabeth is unmarried, is 33 years old and has one child. Elizabeth sells shoes to order, plus breads that are distributed to office employees, selling on credit. Furthermore Edith is married, has 2 children and is 34 years old, Edith makes handicrafts according to the request of clients and also sells clothes to order. The members need different loan amounts such as 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles for a total of 9600 soles loan from the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil, fruit, clothing, wood, shoes and cosmetics. The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, succeed personally and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, fruit, clothing, wood, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine T., a local entrepreneur in Makeni City. Josephine sells rice, flour, sugar, drinks, cold water, etc. She wants a loan in order to strengthen her business. With a loan, she will be able to travel to as far as neighboring Guinea to buy goods at a cheaper rate and make a better profit. 

Josphine is twenty-six years of age, married to a lecturer, and the two of them have one child together. Josephine was born in Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. 

This is the third loan Josephine is accessing from Kiva through SMT. The previous loans helped her a lot in feeding the family and paying school fees for her junior sisters and brothers. With this loan, Josephine will feel comfortable and happy as it will promote both her business and her self esteem, she told me.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Esperanza es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Esperanza junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos, además Esperanza cría cuy.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Los sueños de Esperanza son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the San Miguel de Ayacucho Communal Bank. Esperanza is married, is 36 years old and has 5 children. Together with her husband Esperanza is dedicated to growing vegetables that she sells in the supply market; Esperanza also breeds guinea pigs. Esperanza needs a loan of 1250 soles to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and seed. The dreams of Esperanza are hat her children finish their studies and to improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Isaac Kiloe has been in business repairing fridges since 1992. He works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $111. He is 41 and married with two children, ages 13 and 7 years.

This will be Isaac’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy gas, copper stick and bronze and has paid back the loans successfully. He hopes to get this third loan to increase his capital so that he can improve his business.

Isaac will share this loan with Subgroup D of the Msasani group. This subgroup has six members, who run a salon, sell charcoal and clothes. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Isaac is the only man.

loans.use: To increase capital for fridge repair business

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Agripina es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Agripina junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego transporta y vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Agripina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Agripina sueña con mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the San Miguel de Ayacucho Communal Bank. Agripina is married, is 44 years old and has 3 children. Together with her husband Agripina is dedicated to growing vegetables that she then transports and sells in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Agripina needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and seed. Agripina dreams of improving her business and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Eulogia es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Eulogia junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego transporta y vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Eulogia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the San Miguel de Ayacucho Microfinance Institute.

Eulogia is a 31-year-old married mother of 2. She and her husband grow vegetables, which they then transport to the city of Ayacucho’s wholesale market to be sold.

Eulogia needs a 900.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

Eulogia dreams of providing her children with an education and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Felicitas Fortunata

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Felicitas es divorciada, tiene 65 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas, bebidas, regalos. Además Felicitas viaja a Andahuaylas en donde vende ropa de bebe.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe, azúcar, golosinas.
Felicitas sueña con ahorrar para la vejez.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Microfinance Institute called Amaquella, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua.

Felicitas is a 65-year-old divorced mother of 6. She owns a general store, which she runs in her home, in which she sells groceries, candy, beverages, and gifts. She also travels to Anahuaylas to sell baby clothing.

Felicitas needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing baby apparel, sugar, and candy.

Felicitas dreams of saving enough money for retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing, sugar, and candy

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Lorenza es casada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Lorenza tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lorenza necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosa, cerveza.
Los sueños de Lorenza son ahorrar para la vejez y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Microfinance Institute called Amaquella, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua.

Lorenza is a 65-year-old married mother of two. She has a general store in her own home. She runs the store everyday with the help of her husband.

Lorenza needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing beer and soft drinks. Lorenza dreams of saving enough money for her retirement age, and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Doña Celestina González tiene 45 años de edad, reside en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo es albañil y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de cd y dvd, desde hace dos años que inicio con fondos de prestamos, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa y hacer divisiones para poder tener privacidad con su familia. Este préstamo lo quiere para hacer un muro, para eso va  a comprar materiales de construcción y hacer divisiones de cuarto. Sus metas a futuro es poder adquirir un local donde pueda ofrecer su venta de bonitas y buenas películas, este negocio es rentable ya que se vende mucho y espera aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Celestina González is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a bricklayer, and they have three grown-up children. She started selling CD’s and DVD’s for a living two years ago with the help of loans. Her plan is to be able to finish building her house and make room partitions to give her family more privacy. She needs this loan so that she can build a wall, and for this, she will purchase building materials for the partitions. Her future goal is to be able to obtain an office space so that she can sell her high-quality movies. This business is profitable because she sells a lot of merchandise, so she hopes to increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make room partitions

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Leonora es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Leonora tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual D. sus hijos.
Leonora necesita un préstamo D. 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Leonora son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the Microfinance Institute called Amaquella, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua.

Leonora is a 49-year-old married mother of 4. She has her own store in a rented business space in which she sells groceries, which she does every day with the temporary help of her children.

Leonora needs a 2,100.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

Leonora dreams of providing her children with an education and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Aquila

texts.es:
Aquila es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Aquila Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Aquila tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los dias.
Aquila necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo.
Aquila sueña con educar a sus hijos sacarlos adelante y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquila is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella, which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quechua. Aquila lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 2 children. Aquila owns a small grocery store in a rented locale where she sells general groceries and drinks; she works at her store every day. Aquila needs a loan of 1050 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and noodles. Aquila dreams of educating her children so that they can get ahead in life, and also dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma A. Díaz, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo se desempeña de técnico en atención al cliente, tiene cuatro hijos  mayores, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace treinta dos años, inicio con capital propio, pero luego para fortalecer su negocio con prestamos en Afodenic que se ha beneficiado para mantener su negocio y a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos,  sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa y apoyar siempre a sus hijos, con este préstamo es su quinta ciclo en cual va invertir en la compra de materiales para levantar una pared, y cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado. A futuro es poder invertir en más inventario, captar clientes y poder tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Vilma A. Díaz is 50 years old, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her husband is a customer service representative, and she has 4 older children. Her business is in the sale of clothing; she began this business thirty-two years ago with her own funds, but later to strengthened her business she sought loans from Afodenic, which have helped her support her business and her family. Her business is in the sale of clothing and shoes, and her plans are to be able to carry out home improvements and always support her children. With this loan she will be in her fifth loan cycle, which she will invest in the purchase of materials to build a wall, and change her home’s roof, which is in poor conditions. In the future Vilma hopes to be able to invest in more inventory, capture more clients, and have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, build a concrete wall, and change the roof.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda compra cochinilla, tara, actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además viaja a las ferias a comprar cochinilla, tara, productos que luego vende a los intermediarios.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara y cochinilla.
Los sueños de Yolanda son educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella, which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quechua. Yolanda is married, 41 years old, and has 3 children. Yolanda purchases cochineal insects used for crimson-colored dye, and Tara used as an ornamental plant and a source of tannins; she sells these products as ambulant vendor in the wholesale market in the city, and she also travels to different markets to purchase cochineal insects and Tara, products that she then sells to middlemen. Yolanda needs a loan of 1200 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of Tara and cochineal insects. Yolanda’s dreams are to educate her children until they become professionals and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye).

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Teofila es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Teofila venD. hoja D. coca en las ferias D. la región a donD. viaja dos veces por semana, producto que adquiere D. la empresa D. la coca, además Teofila compra y venD. tara y cochinilla.
Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara, cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Teofila son educar a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella, which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quechua. Teofila is married, 49 years old, and has 6 children. Teofila sells coca leaves at the regional markets that she travels to twice a week; she acquires this product from the coca company. Teofila also buys and sells Tara used as an ornamental plant and a source of tannins, and cochineal insects used for crimson-colored dye. Teofila needs a loan of 1050 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of Tara and cochineal insects. Teofila’s dreams are to educate her children and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye).

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. compra queso, carne, animales menores que luego beneficia, sus productos los venD. D. casa en casa. Además Felicitas hace papa seca que prepara en su casa.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. carne y queso.
Los sueños D. Felicitas son que sus últimos 2 hijos terminen D. estudiar y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank Rainbow. Felicitas is married, 55 years old, and has 6 children. Felicitas travels to regional markets where she purchases cheese, meat, and small animals that she later fattens; she sells her products from house to house. Felicitas also makes papa seca (dried potatoes, which are first boiled then dried in the sun), which she prepares at home. Felicitas needs a loan of 2000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of meat and cheese. Felicitas dreams of her two last children finishing their studies, and that her business improves.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat and cheese.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Margarita es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Margarita viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra animales menores y quesos, productos que venden de casa en casa.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y gallinas.
Margarita sueña con construir su casa y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) Village Bank. She is 36, married, and has 2 children. She travels around her region to fairs selling clothing, and buying young animals and cheeses, which she sells door-to-door. She is seeking a loan of 2,600 soles to buy pigs and hens. Margarita dreams of building her own house where she can have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and hens.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
Simeona es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Simeona es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Simeona viaja a las ferias de donde compra queso, cereales, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Simeona vende leña en su casa.
Simeona necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Simeona sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Simeona is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris". She is married, 39 years old and has 2 children. Simeona travels to the fairs where she buys cheese and cereals, products she sells on the markets of the town of Ayacucho. She also sells firewood at her house. Simeona needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of firewood. It is Simeona's dream that her children become professionals and that she will finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Victoria es separada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Victoria viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra papa, queso, cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Victoria sueña con educar a sus hijos y ahorrar para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She is separated, 44 years old and has 3 children. Victoria travels to the regional fairs where she sells groceries and buys potato, cheese, and cereal to be sold at the wholesale food market in the town of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 3000 soles to be invested in buying cereals. It is Victoria's dream to provide her children with schooling and to save money to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Emiliana Adela

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Emiliana es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Emiliana tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, confecciona ropa típica como faldas, mandiles, sus ventas los realiza en los pueblos de la región.
Emiliana necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Emiliana son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios e implementar con maquinas modernas su taller.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She lives with her partner, is 43 years old and has 4 children. Emiliana has a workshop at her house where she makes garments such as skirts and aprons to be sold in the villages of the region.

Emiliana needs a loan of 2200 soles to be invested in buying material. It is her dream that her children finish their studies and to install modern machines in her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Victoria es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carne, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y teléfono publico.
Los sueños de Victoria son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She is married, 37 years old, and has 1 son. Victoria has a store at her house where she sells vegetables, groceries, meat, and beverages every day.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and a pay phone. It is her dream to expand her business and build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and a pay phone.

loans.name: Victoria Pelagia

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Victoria es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Victoria vende chicharrón (comida preparada con carne de cerdo) de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de un terminal terrestre, además los días sábados y domingos vende en la puerta de una iglesia. 
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de cerdo.
Los sueños de Victoria son mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Cielo".

She is married, 40 years old, and has 5 children. Victoria sells "chicharrón" (food prepared with pork) as a street vendor at the entrance of a bus terminal, and on Saturdays and Sundays she also sells by a church.

Victoria needs a loan of 900 soles to be invested in buying pork. It is Victoria's dreams to increase business and save money to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana R.,  tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el bario Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 3 hijos, su compañero le ayuda económicamente. Los planes de doña Ana es mejorar su nivel de vida. Se desempeña como operadora en  una empresa textilera desde hace un año. El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lo invertirá en la realización de mejoras en su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedra y ladrillos. Con estas modificaciones en su vivienda le ofrecerá a su familia mayor seguridad y protección, da las gracias ala institución  por los beneficios adquiridos el cual espera seguir trabajando ya que es su séptimo ciclo y espera poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana R. is 38 and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has 3 children and her partner helps her out financially. Her plan is to improve her quality of life. For the past year she has worked as a laborer at a textile company. She plans to use the loan she is seeking from Afodenic to buy construction materials, including cement, iron, stone and bricks for home improvements. The changes to her house will provide her family greater safety and security. Ana is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits they offer her, which she hopes will continue. This will be her seventh loan and she hopes to be able to continue improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Ana es casada, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene cabinas de internet en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, además vende golosinas y artículos de librería.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de memorias.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio, tener otra sucursal y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a partner of "Banco Comunal Cielo".

She is married, 26 years old, and has 2 children. Ana, with the support of her sister, has an internet café in a rented facility and she also sells candy and stationary.

Ana needs a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in upgrading computer memories. It is Ana's dreams to improve her business, set up a branch and have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade computer memories.

loans.name: Rio De Oro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Río D. Oro, el Banco inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, comidas, animales menores, prendas D. vestir, artesanía y frutas.

Como es el caso Rosa es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Rosa se dedica a L. crianza D. ganado porcino y lo comercializa en su misma casa.

Norma es viuda y tiene 10 hijos, Norma junto a sus hijos realizan bellos trabajos en telar como pasadizos, sus ventas lo realiza en un puesto del mercado artesanal, en algunas oportunidades compra y venD. cereales.

Martina es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Martina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales variados.
	

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 5,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. hilos, tintes, lanas, ropa, arroz, azucar, trigo, maiz.

Los sueños D. las socias son aumentar su negocio, surtir con mas productos sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
"Banco Comunal Río D. Oro" is initiating its second season with 13 partners. The partners have different businesses such as sale of cereals, food, small animals, garments, artcraft, and fruit.

Eg. Rosa is married, 34 years old, and has 5 children. Rosa breeds pigs and sells the meat at her house.

Norma is a widow and has 10 children. Together with her children she makes beautiful woven fabrics such as "pasadizos" (carpets). She sells from a stand at the artcraft market. Eventually she also buys and sells cereals.

Martina is married, 45 years old, and has 3 children. She has a general store at her house, and sometimes she travels to the fairs to buy a variety of cereals.

The partners need to lend different amounts such as 300 soles, and 900 soles, making a total of 5,100 soles in loans from the Banco Comunal. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of thread, dye, wool, fabric, rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

The partners' dreams are to increase business, to supply their businesses with more products, that their children finish their schooling and to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, dye, wool, fabric, rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Miriam esta esperando su segundo hijo, Miriam junto a su esposo tienen dos mototaxis con el cual trabaja su esposo y el otro lo alquila.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de las motos.
Los sueños de Miriam son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, comprar un carro y su hija salga adelante.
texts.en:
Miriam is a partner of "Banco Comunal Magnolia".

She lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 1 child. Miriam is expecting her second child. Together with her husband she owns two motorcycle taxies, one driven by her husband and the other rented out.

Miriam needs a loan of 1200 soles to be invested in maintenance of the motorcycles. It is Miriam's dream to purchase land to build her house, buy a car and that her daughter get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of motorcycles.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es:
Katy es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Katy es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Katy tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, en donde también tiene 3 locutorios. Además Katy tiene 2 locutorios en lugares distintos en donde tiene 2 empleados.
Katy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Los sueños de Katy es mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio, una flota de taxi y sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Magnolia community bank. Katy, 27, is in a common law marriage and has 2 children. She rents a local space where she has a shop. She sells vegetables, groceries, and she also has 3 calling booths. Katy has 2 calling booths in different locations where she has 2 employees. Katy needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy beer. Katy’s dreams are to improve her business, have her own capital, have a taxi fleet, and that her children go to school and get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Teodora es viuda, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Teodora vende ropa de segunda en la feria de las Américas y en Nazarenas, la ropa lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Teodora tiene una mototaxi que alquila.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de segunda.
Los sueños de Teodora son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Magnolia community bank. Teodora, 52, is a widow and has 6 children. Teodora sells second hand clothing in the fair of the Américas and in Nazarenas. She gets the clothes in Lima city. Teodora also has a “mototaxi” (a taxi pulled by a motorcycle) that she rents. Teodora needs a loan of 1,600 PEN to buy second hand clothes. Teodora’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Maria vende golosinas variadas en la puerta del estadio de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, además Maria vende las golosinas en las diferentes fiestas. También Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, golosinas y azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria son aumentar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus 3 últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Magnolia community bank. Maria, 37, is married and has 5 children. Maria, a street vendor, uses a tricycle and sells a variety of sweets in the entry to the stadium on Saturdays and Sundays. She also sells sweets at the different festivals. Maria also has a grocery store in her house. Maria needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy soft drinks, sweets, and sugar. Maria’s dreams are to increase her business and give her last 3 children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, and sugar

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener casa propia, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Community Bank Magnolia.

Vilma is married common-law, she is 25 years old and has 2 children. Vilma runs a store run from her home where she sells grocery items, vegetables, and snacks. This is something she does during the days.

Vilma requires a loan of 800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and soft drinks. Vilma's dream is to have her own home and to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Rodrigo J. tiene 31 años de edad, soltero y habita en laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,  con dos hijos que su esposa le tiene
Con los prestamos en afodenic ha realizado poco a poco la construcción de su vivienda, ya que sus planes es ir superándose y al paso del tiempo tener  mejor comodidad  en su casa. Este préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es para la realización de entechar y enladrillar comprando los materiales necesarios tales como: ladrillos, cemento y láminas de zinc para hacer las mejoras. Sus planes a futuro es apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Rodrigo J., 31, is single and lives with his two children in Laureles Norte, Managua. With loans from Afodenic he has, little by little, been doing construction on his house. His plans are to keep improving and, in time, have a more comfortable home. The loan he is asking Afodenic for is to put a roof and bricks on his house. To make these improvements he will buy the necessary materials like bricks, cement, and zinc sheets. His future plans are to support his children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to change the roof on his house

loans.name: Sinthia Grisel

texts.es:
Synthia es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Synthia es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Synthia vende golosinas, bebidas en las lozas de la residencia universitaria, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, y los demás días vende refrescos y gaseosas.
