Synthia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Synthia son tener casa propia y tener capital propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Synthia is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. She is 22, and has a common law husband and one child. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells candy and drinks in the common areas outside the dorms at the university. On the other days she sells sodas and other soft drinks. She is seeking a loan of 800 soles to buy soft drinks and candy. Synthia dreams of having her own house and her own capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and candy.

loans.name: Somos De Cristo Group

texts.es:
el Grupo Somos de Cristo esta formado por tres personas de ls cuales todas tienen su negocio propio y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y cabe mensionar que en ocasiones han trabajado juntos y se han destacado como buenos amigos y comerciantes.
las actividades de este grupo son las siguientes:
El Sr. Francisco M. tiene 37 años de edad, soltero y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales a todos apoya economicamente, el se de dica a la venta de refrescos de botella, papitas fritas, chicharrones y agua, tambien realiza viajes a domicilio en su bicitaxi, cabe mensionar que es una persona luchadora y que tiene pasion por el trabajo, en la comunidad lo conocen como una persona honorable, su mayor sueño es tener una bodega y un busito para transportar personas.
La Sra. Maria M. tiene una pulperia en la cual vende frijoles, maiz, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, leche, mantequilla, pollo, jugos, refrescos de botella. este neegocio lo tiene desde hace 11 años y esta ubicado en el barrio santa maria.
la Sra. Alba N. tiene 35 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y chicharrones en el mercado de nacaome, esto lo hace desde hace 8 años atra, cabe mensionar que los productos que ofrece la Sra. N. son de bastante aceptacion en la zona ya que las personas de esa comunidad les gusta mucho el sabor de sus comidas y tambien que son muy higienicas. 
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante y asi tener una mejor condicion de vida,
texts.en:
The group Somos de Cristo (We are of Christ) is made up of three persons all of which have their own businesses and know each other for a long time. It is worth mentioning that they have at times worked together and have shown to be good friends and business people. The activities of this group are as follows: Mr. Francisco M. is 37 years old, single and has 4 children whom he supports financially. He sells bottled beverages, potato chips, chicharrones (pork rinds) and water. He also provides transportation on his taxi cycle. It bears mentioning that he is a go-getter and has a passion for work. He is known in the community as an honorable person. His goal is to have a general store and a van to transport people. Mrs. Maria M. has a general store where she sells beans, corn, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, butter, chicken, juices, bottled beverages. She has this business for the last 11 years. It is located in the Santa Maria neighborhood. Mrs. Alba N. is 35 years old and makes a living selling potato chips and pork rind in the Macaome market. She has been doing this for the last 8 years. The products that she sells are popular in the area since the people in the community like the taste of her food and the fact that it is very sanitary. They all need this loan to be able to get ahead and thus have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, soy products, beverages, water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Melchi R. tiene 34 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Francisco Flores, ellos tienen dos hijos que estan en el colegio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de plastico al por mayor y al detalle, inicio su actividad hace 8 años, y en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas producto ya que ella quiere salir a vender a varias comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive, y para comprar el producto necesita viajar a la frontera con el Salvador ya que ahi se compran las cosas mas baratas y de mejor calidad, es por eso que necesita el credito asi ella se va a abastecer de productos y tendra una mejor ganancia. su sueño es poder graduar sus hijos de la universidad para que puedan salir adelante en esta vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melchi R. is 34 years old and married to Francisco Flores. They have two children that are in school. She sells plastic products wholesale and retail. She started doing this 8 years ago and currently needs a loan to purchase more products. She wants to be able to sell in various areas near where she lives and to buy merchandise she needs to travel to the El Salvador border where she can obtain it cheaper and of better quality. She needs the loan to supply her business with products and be able to make more income. Her dream is to be able to put her children through the university so that they can move ahead in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas plastics, buckets, bowls, glasses, plates, garbage cans, collanders, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.en:
Irene P. R. is the group coordinator for Mujeres Triunfadoras. The owner of a business selling used clothing in her community, Irene and her husband Ramon Gomez have four children and four grandchildren. With her loan, she plans to stock up on used clothing to sell in her business.

Irene dreams of being able to buy a truck that would allow her to travel and sell her used clothing wherever she went. Her house currently is under construction and she is also hoping that she will be able to afford to finish that project. In her spare time, Irene likes to work on her house. She says that her business has benefited a great deal from her Esperanza loans and she would like to continue to develop it. This will be her third loan with Esperanza, and she has been granted larger loan amounts each cycle because of her faithfulness in repayment.

On behalf of Irene P. R., Mujeres Triunfadoras, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your contribution and efforts in the global fight against poverty!

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Lealtad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lealtad, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, carne, artesanía, abarrotes en general, tubérculos, ropa, bebidas, leña.

Como es el caso D. Ana es conviviente tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los compra en las ferias y los beneficia en el camal, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo.

Por otro lado Susana es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, integrante D. la junta directiva D. su Banco Comunal, Susana junto a su esposo son artesanos en piedra D. Huamanga, realizan tallados, sus artesanías los venD. en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad. Además Susana venD. golosinas y leña en su casa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,400 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. piedra D. huamanga, arroz, azucar, verduras, animales menores y ropa.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio, sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
The community bank Lealtad (Loyalty) is beginning its fourth cycle with 18 associates. The members have various businesses such as sales of vegetables, meats, crafts, general groceries, root vegetables, clothing, beverages, firewood. In the case of Ana; she lives with her spouse and has two children. Ana has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meats. She buys the animals at markets and butchers them. Her son helps her with this. On the other hand, Susana is married, 30 years old and has 2 children. She is a member of the board of directors of her community bank. Susana and her husband are craftspeople, working with stone in Huamanga. They make sculptures and sell their works in the crafts market in the city. Additionally, Susana sells sweets and firewood out of her home. The members need differing amounts of credit, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, adding to a total loan of 10,400 soles for the community bank. Their loan proceeds will be invested in the purchase of stone from Huarnanga, rice, sugar, vegetables, small animals and clothing. The dreams of the members are to see their children become professionals, grow their businesses, move their children ahead and have other branches of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of Huarnanga stoen, rice, sugar, vegetables, small animals and clothing.

loans.name: Nur

texts.es:
Nur es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes, es conviviente tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos de 27, 25 y 19 años que estudian y trabajan.

Nur estudio computación, trabajo en el ministerio de pesquería, lo dejo por que se caso y se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, hasta que se separo de su esposo vio en la necesidad  económica y  empezó con el negocio de alquiler de ecran y lo dejo por que le robaron entro en el negocio de  venta las joyas por una amiga que le animo, ella vista colegios, oficinas, empresas desde hace cinco años. 

Nur necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de joyas de plata y de fantasía, collares, pulseras y aretes. 

Desde que esta en Finca, da gracias por la oportunidad de los prestamos, ella inicio su negocio con los prestamos compro un  ecran para proyectar películas, aprendió a organizarse en su negocio, el curso que ha recibido de Finca le ayudo a sacar sus costos y ganancias, puede llevar una mejor contabilidad.        
El sueño de Nur es tener una tienda  propia de joyas.
texts.en:
Nur is a member of the community bank Virgin of the Mercy, lives with her spouse, is 49 years old and has three children of 27, 25 and 19 years of age. They all work and study. Nur studied computers and worked in the department of fishing. She stopped working when she got married and dedicated her time to the care of her children. When she separated from her husband, her financial needs prompted her to start a business of renting video screens. She had to give this up when she got burglarized. Her friend got her interested in the business of selling jewelry. She has been visiting schools, offices, and companies for the last five years. Nur needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase silver and costume jewelry, necklaces, bracelets and earrings. Since she has been with Finca, she is grateful for the loans. She started her business with a loan, purchased a movie screen and learned to organize her business. The course that she received from Finca helped her keep track of her expenses and revenues. She can now account for them better. Her dream is to have her own jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nur needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase silver and costume jewelry, necklaces, bracelets and earrings.

loans.name: Albertina Cleotilde

texts.es: La Sra. Albertina Z. tiene 42 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con el Sr. Juan Sorto con el que han procreado 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad en la cual le va bien y logra salir con los gastos del hogar, en estos momentos ella esta pasando una situacion muy dificil y se ve en la necesidad de comprar mas producto para poder tener mejores ganancias, ella tiene mucha fe y nos comento que de ahora en adelante todo le va a salir bien en su vida, lo mas preciado que ella tiene son sus hijos y desea que sean hombres honestos y profesionales para que puedan salir adelante en esta vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina Zambro is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Juan Sorto. They have three children. She sells clothes. It has taken her ten years to achieve profits that pay her household expenses. She is currently living in very difficult circumstances and sees the necessity to purchase more product in order to increase profits. Having a great deal of faith, she told us that from now on everything in her life is going to take a positive turn. Her children are most precious to her, and she hopes they become honest men and professionals, so they can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase new clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francy

texts.es:
Francy  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Francy es conviviente tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos de 23, 15, 14 y 9 años, los tres menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Francy  trabajando en una tienda con su tío, le enseño el negocio hasta que se independizó, empezó haciendo presupuestos  sin compromiso y fue formando su cartera de clientas, ella  se contacto con clientes que tienen hoteles, los cuales le da servicio de decoración de cortinas y otros, también  hace decoraciones cuando hay eventos, tiene dos personas que trabajan para ella cuando es temporada alta.  
Francy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de accesorios para las cortinas, rieles, soportes, cordones.
Desdés que esta en Finca cuenta con  más capital de trabajo, antes ella no daba crédito a sus clientes, es una entidad que se preocupan por que ahorres con un propósito. 
El sueño de francy es  ver a sus hijos perfecciónales  y poner una tienda de decoraciones.
texts.en:
Francy is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Forty years old, she is a common-law wife. She has four children, ages 23, 15, 14, and 9. The three younger children are studying in the public school. When she worked in a store with her uncle, he taught her the business. She began to give free estimates and establish a base of customers. She has contact with hotel owners, for whom she decorates with curtains and other items. She also decorates for special events. She has two part-time employees who help her when she has a great deal of work. Francy needs a loan of $350 to purchase assessories for curtains: rods, brackets, and cords. Since she began to work with FINCA, she counts on more capital for her business. Previously, she did not grant credit to her customers. Her need for capital is worrisome because the capital is needed for her business. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to have a store devoted to interior design.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Francy needs a loan of $350 to purchase curtain accessories: rods, brackets, and cords.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Liliana es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Liliana vende pescado fresco y congelado, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta de su casa los días sábados y domingos. Además Liliana trabaja en una tienda como ayudante.
Liliana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Liliana son ampliar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of the Desarrollo (Progress) Village Bank. She is 25, single, and has one child. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells fresh and frozen fish from outside her front door. She also works as an assistant in a store. She is seeking a loan of 800 soles to buy fish. She dreams of growing her business and having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Leonarda tiene 49 años, cinco hijos de 26, 24, 20,15 y 14 años, estos dos últimos están en la escuela estatal.
Leonarda es cuzqueña, empezó  llevando menú al trabajo de su esposo, el trabaja en una fabrica y los trabajadores le pidieron que les traiga a ellos también, actualmente ella reparte 10 menús diarios de lunes a sábado, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.   
Leonarda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de ollas, licuadora, también víveres arroz, aceite. 
Desde que esta en Finca,  con los prestamos empezó su negocio  de reparto de menú   le gustan las charlas  por que aprendió como manejar su negocio, como ahorrar,   ha podido construir un poco su casita. 
El sueño de Leonarda es abrir un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of Virgen de las Mercedes Communal Bank. She is 49 years of age and has five children who are 26, 24, 20,15 and 14 years old. These last two are still in school. Leonarda is from the Cuzco region. She began by taking meals to her husband where he works. That place is a factory and the other workers asked her to bring them some too. Currently she delivers ten meals a day from Monday to Saturday. Her children help her. Leonarda needs a loan of 1,000 Sols to purchase pots, a blender, and supplies such as rice and cooking oil. Since she has been with FINCA Peru she has started her business of delivering meals. She likes the discussions because she has learned how to manage her business and how to save. And she has been able to fix up her house a little. Leonardo's dream is to open a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, a blender, and supplies such as rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Juana es casada, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos de manera artesanal, para lo cual cuentan con un horno a leña, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Juana son mejorar su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Desarrollo ("Development") Community Bank. She is a 29-year-old married mother of three. Along with her husband she makes artisan-style bricks in a firewood oven. She sells her product in the same place. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of land. Juana's dreams are to improve her business and build a second floor on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Justina es separada tiene 39 años, tres hijos de 21, 18 y 7 años este ultimo estudia en la escuela estatal.
Justina tiene una bodega en su casa, empezó vendiendo cerveza, ella estudio computación y le ayuda a organizar mejor su negocio, tener todo en orden.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles. para la compra  de cerveza, va poner piso a su negocio.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ha desarrollarse mas en el negocio, aprende de las socias que son muy trabajadoras, son solidarias, cuando alguna socia tiene problemas están dispuestas a apoyarles.    
El sueño de Justina es contratar una persona que le ayude en su negocio de bodega, para que ella descanse.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Virgin of Mercedes Community Bank. She is 39 years old and has three children ages 21, 18 and 7, the youngest of which attends a state school. She is separated from her husband. Justina runs a bodega out of her home. She started out selling beer. She studied computation and that helped her better organize her business. Now everything is in order. Justina is requesting a loan of 2,400 soles for the purchase of beer and to put a floor on her business. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she learned to better develop her business, and learned from the hard-working, united group members. When any member has a problem, the others are there for support. Justina's dream is to hire a worker to help her with her bodega business, so she can relax.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer for her bodega and put in a floor

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe de Jesus C. tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra mayra Funez, ellos tienen 2 hijos pequeños, el se dedica a la reparacion de llantas de automovil y motocicletas, tambien vende lubricantes, neumaticos. el tiene 4 años de tener su negocio en el cual le va muy bien porque es unico en la zona, pero en estos momentos el tuvo un problema y ahora quiere reponerse comprando mercaderia para su negocio, este negocio le a dado la oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia, el esta muy feliz ya que de ahora en adelante todo le va a salir bien, el tiene mucha voluntad para trabajar, es dinamico y con muchas ganas de superacion. su meta o su sueño es lograr tener una llantera muy grande en la cual haga mantenimientos y afinamientos a los carros, vender llantas, rines, que sea un negocio completo.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesus C. is 33 years old and is married to Mayra Funez. They have two small children. Felipe makes a living repairing tires for cars and motorcycles and also sells lubricants and tires. He has had the business for four years, and it is going very well because it is the only one in its area. At the moment, he has had a problem and now he wants to rebuy supplies for his business. This business has given him the opportunity to make headway for his family. He his very happy because he's confident from now on things are going to go well. He has lot of will to work, is dynamic and has a strong desire to keep moving up. His goal and his dream is to have a very big tire shop that performs maintenance and makes improvements to cars, and sells tires and rims, making it a complete business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase patches, glue, tires and lubricants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Laura es separada tiene 59 años, dos hijos de 34 y 39 años.
Ella estudio cosmetología, trabajo en una peluquería por años y hace tres años decido independizarse, actualmente Laura da servicios de corte, tinte, peinados, atiende a domicilio. 
Laura necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para la compra de materiales de peluquería como tintes, líquidos de ondulación, y una secadora.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mayor oportunidad para poder invertir, aprendió a manejar mejor el negocio, lleva mejor sus cuentas.
El sueño de Laura es abrir un salón de belleza y spa amplio.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes Microfinance Institute.

Laura is a 59-year-old separated mother of two children, ages 34 and 39. She studied cosmetology. She worked at a hair salon for years, but three years ago, she decided to work for herself. Laura currently provides at-home hair cut, color, and style services.

Laura needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be used to purchase hairstylist supplies such as hair dye, perm solutions, and a hair dryer.

Ever since she joined Finca, she has had a greater opportunity to invest, and she has learned how to better manage both her business and her accounts.

Laura dreams of opening up her own spacious beauty salon and spa.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair salon supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Rosa es separada tiene 58 años  tres hijos de 32,30 y 25 años que estudian.
Rosa estudio costura lo ejerció por un tiempo, lo dejo por que es ñope y la ñopia fue avanzando tuvo que dedicarse a la venta de postres  dulces y salados.  Siempre ha vendido picarones, papa rellena y platos criollos.   
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de utensilios de cocina, sartén, ollas y cubiertos, quiere comprar un carrito samwichero.
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, tiene mas clientas, aprendió como administrar mejor su negocio, y como atender a la clientela.     
El sueño de Rosa es  tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes cooperative bank. Rosa is separated, 58 years old, and has three children ages 32, 30 and 25, who are studying. Rosa studied sewing, which she practiced for a while, but had to stop and dedicated herself instead to selling sweet desserts and salted snacks. She has always sold picarones, papa rellena and criolle dishes (traditional Peruvian foods). Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy kitchen utensils such as skillets, pans and cutlery. She would also like to buy a sandwich cart. Since starting with Finca her finances have improved, she has more customers, she has learned how to manage her business better and how to tend to her customers. Rosa’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy kitchen utensils such as a skillet, pans and cutlery.  She would like to purchase a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Yolanda viaja a la selva ayacuchana una vez por semana en donde vende abarrotes en  general y de allá trae café, cacao, maní que vende a los intermediarios.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Yolanda sueña con mejorar su negocio, comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Desarrollo Microfinance Institute.

She is a 24-year-old with a live-in partner and two children. Yolanda travels to the Ayacucho jungle once a week to sell general provisions. From there, she brings coffee, cacao, and peanuts, which she then sells to middlemen.

Yolanda needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing rice and sugar.

Yolanda dreams of improving her business and buying a plot of land so that she can have her house built.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Julia es separada tiene 55 años, tres hijos de 29, 25 y 14 años, este ultimo esta en la escuela estatal.
Julia siempre ha dado menú, en su casa tiene quince comensales diarios, también  se dedica ala ventas de   kékes, alfajores reparte por cientos a las bodegas, hace tortas para quinceaños matrimonios, ella estudio repostería, tiene el apoyo de su hija.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para alquilar un local para ampliar su negocio.
Desde que esta en Finca ha recibido capacitaciones que le han ayudado a su negocio, aprendiendo a llevar sus cuentas de ingresos, egresos y hasta como debe de invertir.
El sueño de Julia es tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. She is 55 years old, separated, and has three children aged 29, 25, and 14. Her14-year old son attends the local school. Julia has always cooked set meals, and fifteen people eat at her house on a daily basis. She also makes cakes, alfajores (a local sweet delicacy), and special cakes for 15th birthday celebrations and weddings. She is studying pastry making. Her daughter helps her with her work. Julia needs a loan of 1200 soles to rent premises in which to expand her business. Since starting with Kiva partner Finca, she has been on training courses which have helped her with her business; she has learned how to keep accounts and even about investing. Julia’s dream is to own a small café.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent premises so she can expand her business

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johann  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Johann es conviviente  tiene 25 años, dos hijos de 8 y 4 años que están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Termino el colegio  y salio embarazada tuvo que ponerse a trabajar,  se puso a vender ropa por catalogo pero  la mercadería se  demoraba en llegar mas de quince días, y muchos de los pedidos no llegaban por que estaban agotados y sus clientas se desanimaban, hasta que llego ha Finca y puede comprar mercadería al contado y ofrecer a sus clientes, ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa. 
Johann necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de ropa  para venta. 
Desde que esta en Finca se siente espaldada por los préstamos puede comprar ropa y dar a sus clientas a crédito, ha aprendido a ahorrar.
El sueño de Johann es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Johann is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. 25-year old Johann lives with her partner and has two children aged 8 and 4 who are students in the local school. She finished high school, became pregnant, and had to start work. She sold clothes via catalogue, but the goods were slow to arrive, sometimes taking more than fifteen days, and also many of her orders didn’t come because the items were out of stock. Eventually her customers became discouraged. Finally Johann made her way to Kiva partner, Finca, and she can now buy merchanise on credit to offer her clients. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothing. Ever since she has been with Finca, she has been able to count on their support to buy clothing, and she can now offer credit to her customers. She has also learned how to save money. Johann’s dream is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Totorilla Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Totorilla, inicia su quinto ciclo con 24 socias.
	
Las socias realizan principalmente la agricultura D. verduras, crianza D. animales y entre otras actividades la venta D. ropa, comida y abarrotes en general.

Judith es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, pertenece a la junta directiva D. su Banco Comunal, Judith se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa y verduras, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Judith tiene proyectado comenzar con el negocio D. compra y venta D. animales.

Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Yolanda siembra verduras, productos que venD. ambulatoriamente en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 14,050 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra fertilizantes, remedios, para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un carro para transportar sus productos,
texts.en:
The Totorilla Community Bank has 24 members and is beginning its fifth cycle of loans. For the most part the members work in agriculture, growing vegetables, raising animals, as well as such activities as selling clothes, food, and groceries. 30-year old Judith lives with her partner and has one son. She is a director of the Bank. She grows alfalfa and vegetables and sells them in the market in Ayacucho. Her plan is to one day start a business buying and selling animals. 30-year old Yolanda lives with her partner and has two children. She grows vegetables and sells them in the streets of the market in Ayacucho. The members of the Bank need various amounts of money, 300, 600, or 900 soles adding up to a total of 14,050 soles. The loans will be used to buy fertilizer, medicines, and to pay workmen. The members dream of building their own homes, providing their children with a good education, and having a vehicle to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicines, and to pay workmen

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
Josefina F. is a group coordinator for the larger group called “Mujeres D. Fe,” which means Women of Faith in English. Josefina owns a business selling clothing and undergarments in her community. With her first loan, Josefina is planning on restocking her business with clothing and is excited about the opportunity. She first heard about Esperanza from her sister-in-law who invited her to join, saying that Esperanza was a great opportunity. She wants this loan to make herself and her business more independent and to have a better future.

Josefina and her husband, Silverio G., have two sons ages 3 and 6.  Josefina and Silverio hope that their children grow up to be well-educated in both school and in their Christian faith and that they follow the path God chooses for them. Josefina’s dreams for her business incluD. developing it, and continuing forward along with having her own building for her business. She hopes that the extra money generated from this loan will help her make some improvements on her house. Pictured with Josefina F. is their loan officer and the office loan representative.

On behalf of Josefina F., Mujeres D. Fe, and Esperanza International, thank you for your contribution and effort to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: To replenish stock in business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Bertha es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Bertha tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama e hijo, además Bertha junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños de Bertha son tener un negocio mayorista y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Dignidad Community Bank. 30-year old Bertha lives with her partner and has two children. She has a small store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She does this on a daily basis with the help of her mother and son. She and her husband also run a motorbike taxi service. Bertha needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and noodles. Her dreams are to have her own wholesale business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Gabe Abelina

texts.es:
Gabe es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Gabe es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Gabe vende ropa como lencería, de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Gabe necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior.
Los sueños de Gabe son tener un local estable para su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gabe is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. 43-year old Gabe lives with her partner and has two children. Every day she walks along the streets of the Nery García Market selling lingerie and other clothing which she got in Lima. Gabe needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy underwear to sell. Her dreams are to run her business from a permanent location and to have her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Bendicion Divina Group

texts.en:
Nancy B. D. R. is an entrepreneur and the group coordinator for the microfinance bank called “Bendicion Divina”, or in English, Divine Blessing. Nancy is the owner of a mini-cafeteria and operates a homework resource room where she helps students after school with their studies. With her Kiva loan, Nancy plans to purchase pencils, pencil sharpeners, paper, backpacks and other school supplies to sell in her homework resource room. For her mini-cafeteria, Nancy will buy things like juice, ice, soda, and sandwich supplies.  

Happily married for sixteen years, Nancy and her husband Felix have two girls aged 20 and 21 and one seven year old son. Currently her two girls are studying marketing and tourism at a university here in the Dominican Republic.

Nancy dreams of developing her cafeteria to be bigger not only in its physical location, but also in terms of profit.  She hopes to be able to buy computers for her homework room, as well as better chairs and tables for her students.  In her personal life, she hopes to have time to grow and work on a beautiful garden. She hopes to be better off each coming day not only financially, but also with her family and their relationship with God. She hopes her children continue to learn about God and trust him. In her free time, Nancy enjoys helping out in her community and often gives talks to groups of children.

When asked what she would like to say to the Kiva lenders for this loan, Nancy said that poor communities like hers need opportunities to realize their dreams. Through giving them the finances needed, they are then aided in climbing out of the poverty hole. She is grateful for the opportunity and support that Esperanza and Kiva will provide!

loans.use: To pay for items for her cafeteria and education center.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Francisca es separada tiene 52 años tres hijos de 30, 25 y 22 años.
Cuando estaba casada tuvo conocimiento del negocio, y se le presento la oportunidad de comprar maquinarias de segunda y la compro con apoyo de sus hijos, hace cuatro años que alquila a las empresas maquinarias para construcción. Sus hijos le ayuda a repartir las maquinarias y su hijo le ayuda atendiendo a los clientes.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de repuestos de sus maquinas, como piñones, motor.
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía es mejor, ha podido adquirir un rotó-martillo para romper paredes, aprendió a ser puntual, responsable con los prestamos, ha recibido capacitaciones en la cuales ha aprendido el manejo del negocio, ahorrar para las emergencias.    
El sueño de Francisca es tener una flota de maquinas nuevas
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. 52-year old Fransisca is separated and has three children aged 30, 25, and 22. When she was married, she learnt how to run a business and had the opportunity to buy some used machinery which she bought with the help of her children. For the last four years she has rented out machinery used in construction. Her children help to repair the machines, and she and one of her sons attend to the clients. Francisca needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy spare parts such as pinions and engines. Since she has been with Kiva partner, Finca, her finances are better; she has been able to obtain a jack hammer for breaking up walls; she has learned to be on-time and responsible for her loans; she has undergone training and learned how to manage a business and how to save for emergencies. Francisca’s dream is to own a range of new machines.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as pinions and engines

loans.name: Rosaura Adelaida

texts.es:
Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Rosaura es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura es Obstetriz de profesión y tiene una botica llamada Ángel Luz en un local alquilado, cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleadas. Además Rosaura tiene 2 consultorios obstétricos en locales alquilados.
Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antiimflamatorios.
Rosaura sueña con tener una clínica que cuente con todos los equipos necesarios.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. 34-year old Rosaura is married and has two children. She is an obstetrician by profession and runs a pharmacy called Ángel Luz in rented premises with the help of two employees. She also rents two consulting offices. Rosaura needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy anti-inflammatory medicines. Her dream is to own a fully-equipped clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase anti-inflammatory medicines

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Isabel M. tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Milton Casco, con quien ha tenido 3 hijos de los cuales todos estan en la escuala comunal. su esposo es motorista y trabaja en la empresa San Benito, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 1 año, ella necesita el credito para comprar mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio en el cual le va muy bien y es su unica fuente de ingresos y como lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion no descuida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel M. is 33 years old and married to Mr. Milton Casco, with whom she has three children, all in the community school. Her husband is a driver and works for the San Benito company. She has been a trader for a year. She needs credit to purchase merchandise to better stock her business, which is going well for her and is her sole source of income. As it is located in her home, she doesn't have to leave her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sugar, beans, rice, soap, coffee, bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso se encuentra en su noveno ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprededoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya.  Están en la zonas de Paiñu y Ñemby. Todas ellas son vecinas que colaboran con el fortalecimiento de su comité y su comunidad. Ellas ya tienen mas de 2 años trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y son un grupo fortalecido. Ellas están sacando entre Gs. 1.000.000 las mas antiguas, y 300.000 las nuevas, tienen un ahorro de Gs.2.500.000. La mayoria de ellas son madres solteras y son el sosten de sus familias, madres trabajadoras, que sobresalen con su esfuerzo, son esforsadas en su comité.

Las integrantes son: 

Marta Irene Y..	Venta de ropa.
Juana R..	Venta de frutas y verduras.
Claudia B..	Costurera.
Maria de B..	Venta de merceria
Ilse R.	Venta de ccomidas. .
Analia Y..	Ventas de comestible.
Marcia L..	Venta de lenceria, ropas.
Josefa G..	Venta de verduras y frutas.
Elva P..	Venta de Comidas
Josefina C..	Venta de remedios naturales.
Aurora C..	Venta de ropas.
Miguela C..	Venta de comidas.
Karina G..	Venta de bazar.
Aurora E..	Ventas de calzaqdos nuevos y usados.
Ilsa A..	Venta de dulces.
Celestina B..	Venta de comestibles.
Juana A..	Venta de bebidas.
Maria C..	Venta de articulos de primera necesidad. (despensa)
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso (Women Fighting for Progress) is in its ninth loan cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women program of Fundación Paraguaya. They are located in the areas of Paiñu and Ñemby. They are all neighbors who collaborate with the strength of their group and their community. They have now been working with Fundación Paraguaya for over two years and are a very strong group. The older members are withdrawing 1,000,000 guaranis, and the newer ones 300,000 guaranis. They have a savings of 2,500,000 guaranis. The majority of them are single mothers and are the sole support for their families. These working mothers, who excel through their efforts, are strengthened by their group. The constituents are: Marta Irene Y. - Clothing sales Juana R. - Fruit and vegetable sales Claudia B. - Tailoring Maria de B. - Haberdashery Ilse R. - Food sales Analia Y. - Food sales Marcia L. - Clothing and linen sales Josefa G. - Fruit and vegetable sales Elva P. - Food sales Josefina C. - Natural remedy sales Aurora C. - Clothing sales Miguela C. - Food sales Karina G. - Bazaar Aurora E. - New and used shoe sales Ilsa A. - Candy sales Celestina B. - Food sales Juana A. - Beverage sales Maria C. - Basic goods sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Bautista F. tiene 47 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Emelina Lopez y tienen una niña que esta en primer grado, su esposa es ama de casa y el se dedica al negocio de la pulperia que tiene desde hace 6 años, el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que su familia tiene, su meta es poder tener una tienda grande y que su familia no pase necesidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Bautista F. is 47 years old, lives in a commonlaw marriage with Ms. Emelina Lopez, and has a daughter in the first grade. His spouse is a housewife and he works at a general store he has owned for the past six years. He needs a loan to stock his business, which is his family's sole source of income. His goal is to have a large store and provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, margarine, sugar, beans, tortillas, spices, eggs, milk, bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Raul R. de 56 años de edad esta en union libre con la sra. Santos Alvarez, no tienen hijos a su cargo, el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, su compañera de hogar es ama de casa y el atiende la pulperia, este negocio lo tiene desde hace mas de 15 años. el esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio, el quiere comprar mercaderia al por mayor para poder sacarle mas ganancias a sus ventas. su meta es poder tener una tienda mas grande y remodelar su casa de habitacion para vivir tranquilo los años que le quedan
texts.en:
Raul R. is 56 years old, in a commonlaw marriage with Santos Alvarez, and does not have any children. He sells popular consumer goods. His companion is a housewife, while he takes care of the grocery store he has owned for more than 15 years. He is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for his business. He wants to buy merchandise wholesale in order to reap better profits. His goal is to have a larger store and remodel his home to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, butter, beans, rice, sugar, bread, churros, soft drinks, juices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Cesar L. le está haciendo falta la instalación eléctrica y los acabados del exterior e interior, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo está mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su familia vivirá en un mejor ambiente. 
 Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Cesar el se encontraba en su empleo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Dinora González y si hija, quien son las personas que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
The home of Cesar L. is in need of electric installation and exterior and interior final touches, but he does not have the money necessary to finish these improvements. This is why he is soliciting a loan--so that his family will live in a better environment. When we visited Cesar's home, he was at work, so his wife, Dinora González, and his daughter appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric installation and finishing interior and exterior of home

loans.name: Amalia Elena

texts.es: Doña Amalia C. cuenta con 26 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Talabartera, “Elaboración de Calzado para dama” cuenta con un taller de 2 maquinas, habita junto a con  sus Papas,  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 6 años de elaborar calzado en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Amalia C. is 26 years old and single. She is a saddler at "Elaboración de Calzado para dama” (Development of Ladies' Footwear) and has a workshop with two machines. She lives with her parents, who work in the same business and have three employees. She has been making shoes for six years in her home in Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Her customers' demand is currently growing, but the economic conditions are insufficient to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to ASDIR to solicit a loan to buy raw materials and thus increase her sales. She hopes to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Señor  José Ángel Z., tiene 42 años de edad, acompañado, su esposa le tiene cuatros hijos. Los planes para su familia en ofrecerle mayor comodidad. Se desempeña como conductor de transporte desde hace 6 años. El préstamo  que solicita en Afodenic es para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: hierro, perlines, láminas, estribos, alambre, clavo y bloques. Con La construcción de una parte de la casa le brindara seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
José Ángel Z. is 42 years old, married, and has four children. His plan is to provide more comfort to his family. He has worked as a transport driver for six years. The loan he is seeking from Afodenic is for the purchase of construction materials like: iron, Perlina, laminates, stirrups, wire, nails and blocks. In constructing a new part of his home, he will provide greater security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco A. ha tenido ya más de tres créditos con FVP, los cuales  pago puntualmente, fueran para la elaboración de unos cuartos en la planta alta de la vivienda.
  Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la construcción de las recamaras que serán para sus hijos que ya están creciendo necesitan su espacio.
  Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Francisco el se encontraba en su trabaja, quien nos atendieron fue su esposa la señora María Francisca Salazar y dos de sus hijos, quines son los que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Francisco A. has had more than three loans with FVP, which he paid in a timely manner. He used them to build some bedrooms on the top floor of his house. He is now requesting a loan to finish building rooms that will be his children’s, as they are growing and need space. When the visit to his home took place, Francisco was at work. Due to this, his wife María Francisca Salazar gave us the tour and is who appears in the picture along with two of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction on the top floor of his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es: Amalio tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una hija, acaban de mudarse a su casa nueva. Desde muy niño se dedica a los cultivos de la tierra, siembra papas y alverjas, sus cosechas siempre fueron muy buenas, para ello abona constantemente, lo que requiere de mucha inversión. A pesar de lo arduo de su labor termina contento al final del día porque es la única fuente de ingresos que conoce. Amalio recalca que para cosechar bueno productos para el mercado exigente, cuesta de mucho sacrificio y generalmente depende del tiempo, ya que siembra en chacras temporales, así que el se encuentra sujeto a los factores climatológicos. Por ello, su meta es de adquirir terrenos de regadío, donde no invierta mucho para cosechar. Amalio ha sido un cliente muy responsable durante estos 9 préstamos consecutivos que viene trabajando con MFP, y las veces que dispone de tiempo apoya en las labores de la junta directiva para el desarrollo y el progreso de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, ya sin ello las cosechas no están aseguradas, le alcanzará para diez sacos de abono y para la compra de semillas de alverjas.
texts.en:
Amalio is a 27-year-old man who lives with his partner, with whom he has one daughter. They have just finished moving into their new home. Ever since he was a child, he has been involved in agriculture. He grows peas and potatoes for a living. His crops have always done well because he is constantly fertilizing them, which requires a lot of investment. Despite how arduous his work is, he is happy at the end of the day because it is the only thing he knows how to do and his sole source of income. Amalio stresses that in order to harvest good crops for the demanding market, it takes a lot of sacrifice and it generally depends on the weather. He grows crops on seasonal farms, so he is subject to climate factors. For this reason, his goal is to obtain irrigated lands in which he does not have to invest too much to grow his crops. Amalio has been a very responsible client during the 9 consecutive months that he has been working with MFP. Furthermore, whenever he has time, he helps out the executive board for the progress and development of his microfinance institute. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers because without them, he has no way of ensuring a good harvest. He will have enough money to purchase pea seeds and 10 sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora María Dolores C. está muy agradecida con su apoyo en el crédito anterior el cual le ayudo mucho en su negocio a crecido y tiene mas ventas de paltillos.
En esté momento esta solicitando su apoyo para un nuevo préstamo para comprar un vehículo para la entrega de platillos, ya que tiene pedidos en diferentes partes de la cuidad y es muy difícil entregarlos a tiempo. 
Es por eso que decido adquirir un carro para  la entrega y así también contratar a otra persona quien le pueda ayudar a repartir los platillos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Ms. María Dolores C. is very grateful for your supporting her with the previous loan, which helped her out a lot with her business. Since then, her business has grown, and her food sales have increased.

At this time, she is requesting your support in the form of a new loan so that she can purchase a vehicle for food distribution because she gets orders from different parts of the city, and it is very difficult to deliver them on time. For this reason, she has decided to obtain a delivery car, as well as hire another person who can help her deliver the meals on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for food delivery

loans.name: Irma Karina

texts.es:
Irma Karina, ha pesar de su condición de estar privada de su libertad, no pierde su espíritu de empresaria.

Ella decidió adelantar los pagos de su préstamo, para solicitar otro, esta vez por Q.4,000.00 el cual va a utilizar para la compra de materiales para las manualidades que elabora, con ello puede obtener un mejor precio, y aprovechar la época de celebración del día de la madre, la cual es el 10 de mayo y en el mes de junio se celebra el día del maestro, esos días muchas personas compran regalos por la ocasión.

Los sueños de Irma Karina siguen siendo, el recuperar su libertad, y aprovechar toda la experiencia que ha tenido para salir adelante en la vida como una mujer de éxito y empresaria.

Este es su tercer préstamo que solicita en FAPE.
texts.en:
Irma Karina, despite being incarcerated, has not lost her entrepreneurial spirit. She decided to pay off her loan early in order to request another one, this time for Q.4,000.00, which she will use to buy crafting supplies. That way she'll be able to get a better price and take advantage of Mother's Day on May 10, and of Teacher's Day in June, two occasions on which many people purchase gifts. Irma Karina's dreams are still to regain her liberty and take advantage of the experiences she's had in order to become a successful entrepreneur. This is the third loan she's requested from FAPE.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crafting supplies

loans.name: Flavia Velantina

texts.es: Doña Flavio O. cuenta con 47 años de edad, es casada de oficios Talabartera, “Elaboración de Calzado para dama” cuenta con un taller de 2 maquinas, habita junto a con  su  esposo e hijos,  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 12 años de elaborar calzado en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hija, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flavio O. is 47 years old and in the leather crafts trade making women’s footwear. She has a workshop with 2 machines, and lives with her husband and children who also dedicate themselves to this craft. They have three employees and have been running the business from their house, in the town of Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala, for twelve years. Currently, they find that customer demand has gone up but they don’t have the financial resources to augment their working capital. For this reason, they turned to the ASDIR Association to request a loan with the intention of using it to purchase raw materials. This would allow them to increase their sales and, they hope, help them support their daughter and afford them all a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Increase of Capital).

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto S. está agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en el crédito anterior su negocio a crecido bastante y tiene mas ingresos.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para la comprar de mercancía de verdura y carnes frías, ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo. y así su negocio tendrá más ingresos para darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto S. is grateful for the great assistance he received through his previous loan--his business has grown quite a bit and he has more income. He is once again seeking a loan to purchase merchandise such as vegetables and fried meats, which his customers are ordering. His business will earn more and he will be able to provide all the best for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: J Concepción

texts.es:
El señor J Concepción J. desea construir un baño de materia mas duradero ya que el actual es de madera, se encuentra en malas condiciones y teme que pueda posar algo. 
  Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se dedica a la construcción de vivienda y se encargara de ser la mejora.
texts.en:
Mr. J Concepción J. wishes to build a bathroom of sturdier materials since his current one is wooden. It is currently in poor condition and he fears it may fall apart. He is seeking a loan to buy materials. He works in construction and will perform the improvements himself.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 41 años es una madre de familia muy luchadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes no dudan en ayudarla para que pueda sobresalir en la vida. El puesto de venta de ropa de Carmen, esta ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende ropa para niños y es muy buena vendedora, puesto que siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle un prenda de vestir. Carmen disfruta mucho de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lo cual hace menos fastidiosas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poderlo descuidar, anhela tener una tienda de ropa más grande, donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus prendas de vestir. Este es el primer préstamo de Carmen en MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles de préstamo, Carmen comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Carmen, 41, is a mother who is very determined. She lives in her parents’ house, and they help her so that she can get ahead in life. The stand where she sells clothes is in the Laguna Temporal plaza (a place in the city of Juliaca where they have fairs). She sells children’s clothes. She is a very good sales person; she can always convince her customers to buy an article of clothing. Carmen really enjoys talking with her neighboring vendors; it makes the long work day seem less tiring. She has been doing this for 10 years. What she likes least about her work is having to stay in her stand all day without being able to leave. She yearns to have a larger clothing store where she could sell her clothes more calmly. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to repay on time so that the she does not cause problems for the members of her community bank. With 1,000 PEN Carmen will buy more clothes to increase the merchandise she has at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, tiene 34 años y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas Lucero de 9 y Anghie de 2 y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación. Elizabet se encuentra en el negocio de la venta de ropa, ella entrega sus pedidos a instituciones educativas, las cuales solicitan sus servicios debido a la rapidez y calidad de su trabajo, para Elizabet este negocio es muy rentable, ya que siempre acaba con toda su mercadería. Lo que más le gusta a Elizabet de su negocio es que puede realizar los quehaceres de su hogar al mismo tiempo que su trabajo, lleva 4 años en esta actividad  y lo más difícil para ella es traer la ropa desde Tacna, puesto que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y espera más adelante tener una tienda donde pueda vender ropa más variada. Este es el primer préstamo de Elizabet en MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta depuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre es muy puntual en sus reuniones. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles de préstamo, Elizabet comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene
texts.en:
Elizabet, 34, is a happy and charismatic woman. She lives in her own home with her two children; Lucero is 9, and Anghie is 2. What Elizabeth wants most is to give them a good education. Elizabet sells clothes. She delivers her orders to educational institutions. They request her services because of the speed and quality of her work. The business is very profitable for her. She always sells all of her merchandise. What Elizabet likes best about her business is that she can do her chores around the house at the same time that she works. She has been doing this for 4 years. The hardest thing for her is bringing the clothes from Tacna; it is very tiring. Even so, she knows that she has to work hard to achieve her goals. She hopes in the future to have a store where she can sell a bigger variety of clothes. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is a beloved and respected member of her community bank; she is always on time to the meetings. With a loan of 800 PEN she will buy more clothes to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María De Jesús C. tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de venta de ropa usada, es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para surtir el negocio.
Portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo y así invertir en la compra de ropa nueva para que su negocio tenga mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. María De Jesús C. has been at her used-clothing business for a year already and is her family’s breadwinner. Her business needs more of a variety of merchandise, but she doesn't have enough money to stock it. This is why she is asking for a loan. She will invest it in buying new clothing so her business earns more for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz siempre ha trabajado mucho por tener un futuro más prospero, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Joselin de 10 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La vida de Emperatriz no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupo por ayudar con los gastos de su casa, actualmente ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, supuesto esta ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual ofrece muchas prendas de vestir, como casacas, chompas, pantalones, etc.
Lleva 7 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, anhela mejorar su puesto y llenarlo de mas prendas de vestir, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir, aun así esta dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Emperatriz en MFP y esta decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, así como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus socias. Con los mil nuevos comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende en su puesto.
texts.en:
Emperatriz has always worked hard to have a more prosperous future. She lives in a rented house with her dear daughter Joselin, age 10, who is the reason for all Emperatriz's work efforts. Emperatriz's life hasn't been easy, since she was very young she has had to worry about helping with household expenses. Currently she has a business selling clothes, located in the Tupac Amaru market (a very well-known market in Juliaca city), which offers different types of clothing such as jackets, sweaters, pants, etc. She has done this work for seven years and what she likes best is chatting with neighboring vendors and finding out what is happening in the market. Emperatriz longs to improve her stand and fill it with more clothing. What she likes least about the work is having to stay inside her store all day without leaving, although she is willing to make any sacrifice as long as she reaches her goals. This is her fifth loan with MFP and Emperatriz is determined to make her payments on time, as she did for her previous loans. In her community bank she is loved and respected by the other members. With the 1,000 PEN she will buy more clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells in her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 53 años, es muy admirada en su barrio debido a la persistencia que le pone a todo lo que hace, vive en su casa propia junto a su único hijo Carlos D. 19 años, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. La venta D. ropa es para Felicia un negocio muy rentable, debido a que sus prendas se venden rápidamente y su mercadería esta en constante movimiento, ella es una vendedora muy hábil y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Lleva 7 años realizando este trabajo y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, ya que así se mantiene informada D. las cosas que suceden en su barrio, pero lo más difícil para ella es traer la ropa desD. Desaguadero (Distrito D. Puno), ya que le es muy costos y cansado, a un así no pierD. las esperanzas D. hacer progresar su negocio y D. en el futuro poner su tienda propia donD. pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos textiles. Felicia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer crédito y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy responsable con los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos planea comprar más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Felicia is 53 years old and is much admired in her neighborhood because of the way she applies herself to everything she does. She lives in her home with her only son, Carlos, who is 19 years old and to whom she hopes to give a good college education. Selling clothing is a very profitable business for Felicia because her articles of clothing sell quickly and her merchandise is constantly turning over. She is a very capable vendor who always receives her clients with a smile on her face. She has been working in this job for 7 years and the part she likes best is chatting with her fellow vendors. This keeps her up-to-date on what's happening in the neighborhood. The hardest thing for her is bringing the clothing from Desaguadero (Puno district) because it's costly and tiring. But even so, she doesn't lose hope of making her businesses progress, and in the future have her own store where she will be able to sell her textile products in more comfort. This is Felicia's second loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loan and hopes to be again. In her communal bank, she is very responsible with the agreements to those who are at her meetings. She plans to buy more clothing to improve the post she sells from with the new thousand.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa L. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente. 
  En esté  momento solicita un préstamo para surtir el negocio que tiene actualmente dentro de una escuela. Le hace falta más variedad de mercancía para venderles a los niños y desea también vender desayunos y comida que sean más saludables. 
 Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para llevar acabo su proyecto.
texts.en:
Ms. Alma Rosa L. has already had two loans with FVP, which she paid on time. Right now she is asking for a loan to stock her business that, at present, is inside a school. Her merchandise needs more variety to sell to the children and she also wants to sells breakfast and healthier foods. This is why she is asking for your cooperation in bringing her project to fruition.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversión para el negocio

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 44 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Graciela tiene un negocio muy divertido, vende peluches en las ferias de Puno y Juliaca, ella es una vendedora muy hábil y siempre consigue la forma de venderle algo a las personas que concurren a su puesto, a quienes trata con mucha cortesía y siempre les brinda una sonrisa.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre los peluches que puede comprar, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que vender bajo el inclemente sol, ya que esto la cansa mucho, espera más adelante tener su tienda donde pueda vender sus peluches con más tranquilidad. Este es el primer préstamo de Graciela en MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad y desea pagarlo a tiempo ya que quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Con los mil nuevos soles de préstamo, Graciela comprará más peluches para tener mas mercadería que vender.
texts.en:
Graciela, 44, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to get ahead in life. She has a fun business, selling stuffed toys in the markets at Puno and Juliaca. She is a skillful saleswoman who knows what approach will work best with each prospective customer, all of whom she treats with courtesy and a smile. The thing that she most likes about her job is talking with prospective customers and advising them on which stuffed toy they should buy. She's operated the business for 5 years and the thing that she likes least about it is working in the hot sun, something that completely exhausts her. She hopes to one day have her own shop where she might sell her stuffed toys more easily. This is Graciela's first MFP loan. She is very happy for the opportunity and wants to repay the loan on time so that she can have the chance to borrow again in the future. She's an active member of her community bank. With the S/.1,000 (one-thousand new soles) loan, Graciela will buy more stuffed toys so that she has plenty of merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stuffed toys to resell.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.es: Jesica es una joven madre soltera de 27 años, que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en la casa de su familia junto a sus 2 hijos, Jeferson de 5 y Yasselin de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una buena vida. Muy cerca al mercado Bellavista (mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), se encuentra la tienda de descartables de Jessica, ella vende platos, vasos, y demás artículos descartables a muy buen precio, lo que ha hecho que tenga muchos más clientes que el resto de tiendas. Para Jesica su trabajo es muy importante, pues es muy conciente de que gracias a este puede darle a su familia lo necesario para vivir, lleva un año en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es vender y convencer a sus clientes de llevarse algo, espera más adelante mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Este es el primer préstamo de Jesica en MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal en donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Jesica planea invertir los novecientos nuevos en comprar más descartables, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 27 years old single mother. She lives in her family’s house with her two children, 5 years old, Jeferson and 2 years old, Yasselin. She has struggled to excel in life and hopes to give her children a good life.

Jessica’s store of disposables is located near the Bellavista Market, an important market in the city of Puno. She sells plates, cups, glasses and other disposable goods at very good prices. This has given her more costumers than other stores in the area. Work is very important for Jessica, because she knows that through it she has been able to provide her family with the necessary resources. She has been working at the store for a year and enjoys selling and being able to persuade the costumers who come into the store to buy something. The least favorite part of her work is to stay at the store all day without being able to go anywhere. She would like to enlarge her business and knows that this will require hard work.

This is Jessica’s first loan with MFP. She is committed to pay it on time as not to cause problems to the other members of the communal bank where she is appreciated. Jessica plans to use the nine hundred nuevos to buy more disposable goods to better supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: J. Socorro

texts.es:
El señor J. Socorro A. y su esposa la señora Anastacia Guerra ya son personas grandes de edad, ellos viven solos ya que sus hijos están casados y tiene su propia familia.
Están construyendo un cuarto para ellos y acondicionarlo según sus necesidades, pero no cuentan con el capital necesario para terminar la construcción ya que les está haciendo falta terminar las paredes y poner el techo de madero. Portal motivo están solicitando un préstamo y planean pagarlo con la pensión que recibe cada mes.Ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. 
 (La persona que aparece en la foto es la doña Anastacia Guerra.)
texts.en:
Mr. J. Socorro A. and his wife, Mrs. Anastacia Guerra are senior citizens. They live alone because their children are married and have their own families. They are building a room for themselves but do no have the money necessary to complete the construction. They need to finish the walls and the wooden ceiling. This is the reason to request the loan that they plan to pay with their monthly pension since their children help them with the house expenses. (The person in the photo is Mrs. Anastacia Guerra.)

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building the house walls and placing the wooden ceiling

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth es una joven de 20 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una vida digna y tranquila. Desde que tenia 10 años Lizbeth a trabajado en el negocio de la lana, junto a sus padres realizaba el acopia de fibra de ovino, actualmente ella continua con esta actividad, pero ahora lo hace de manera individual, ayudando así con los gastos familiares. Lizbeth compra a los ganaderos la fibra de sus ovinos, para luego llevarla a vender a otros lugares, lleva 4 años realizando este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que también puede realizar las tareas de su casa al mismo tiempo que trabaja, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda recolectar mucho más fibra, para poder vender más, para Lizbeth lo más difícil de su trabajo es recolectar la fibra, puesto que tiene que ir a lugares muy lejanos, aun así esta dispuesta a poner todo de su parte para alcanzar sus metas. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Lizbeth en MFP, en sus anteriores créditos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles incrementará su capital de trabajo, así podrá comprar más fibra de ovino y vender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a 20 years old, cheerful and hardworking person. She lives with her parents and wishes to give them a dignified and peaceful life. Lizbeth worked with her parents since she was ten years old collecting the fiber from sheep. She continues with this kind of work but now does it in an independent manner as to help with the family expenses.

For four years, she has been buying the fiber from shepherds and selling it in several locations. She is able to do this work and at the same time help with the housework. She hopes that in the future her collecting and selling of the fiber will increase. Even though it is difficult for Lizbeth to collect it, because she has to go to distant places, she is determined to reach her goals.
