This is Lizbeth’s fourth loan with MFP, she has always been punctual with the repayment and she will be the same this time. She is very much appreciated at her communal bank. She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital to buy sheep fiber and sell it to more costumers.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: Manaen

texts.es: El señor Manaen I. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales le han servido para hacerle mejoras a su casa, pero le está haciendo falta el vitropiso, para poder habitarla ya que actual mente está vivienda con una hermana y su familia ya necesita su propio espacio y privacidad.  Portal motivo esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo lo más pronto posible su mejora.
texts.en:
Mr. Manaen I. has had two loans with FVP that he utilized to make improvements in his house. He still needs the complete the flooring to be able to move into it. He is presently living with his sister but he and his family need their own space and privacy. Therefore he requests a new loan to be able to proceed with the necessary improvements as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing of flooring in his house

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa tiene 42 años y es una mujer muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares con sus 3 hijos Brayan de 13, Ingrith de 10 y Anghie de 7, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Narcisa tiene su puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado Laykakota (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), su puesto es muy visitado por sus clientes, quines siempre se llevan algo para sus casas, ella trae la ropa desde La Paz (Ciudad del país de Bolivia), es por eso que siempre tiene modelos más novedoso que sus vecinas de venta. A Narcisa le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre los nuevos modelos que le llegaron, lleva 15 años realizando este negocio y lo más difícil para ella, es transportar las ropas desde La Paz – Bolivia, ya que es un trayecto largo y cansado, anhela más adelante tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender una mayor variedad de ropa y atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el primer préstamo de Narcisa en MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad y desea pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles de préstamo, Narcisa comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de ropa.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old and a very happy person. She lives in her family’s house with her three children Brayan 13, Ingrith 10 and Anghie 7. They are the reason for all her efforts.

Narcisa has a clothing stand in the Laykakota Market, an important market in the city of Puno. She has regular costumers, who usually buy something to take home every time they visit the stand. She gets the clothing from La Paz, Bolivia. This allows her to provide newer styles than the other merchants in the market. Narcisa enjoys talking with her costumers and letting them know about the new arrivals. She has been working on this business for 15 years. The most difficult part is transporting the goods from La Paz; it is a long and tiresome journey.

She wishes to have a large store selling a wider variety of clothing to better serve her costumers. This is Narcisa’s first loan with MFP, she is very happy for this opportunity and is committed to pay it on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. She will buy more merchandise with the loan to better supply her clothing stand.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo R. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
Como desea tener su propia casa está tramitando una vivienda por medio de Infonavit (crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la casa es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 
 El trabaja como guardia de seguridad, portal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el crédito gubernamental, y así adquirir su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelo Rodriguez lives with his wife and two daughters in a house that someone lent him. He wishes to have his own home, so he is processing a house through Infonavit (a government loan). He could not afford the house with the loan that his income allows him to obtain.

He works as a security guard. He is requesting a loan to supplement the government loan and obtain his house. He wishes to secure some assets for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference for housing through Infonavit (Government loan)

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 23 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida y forjarse un futuro mejor. Trabaja en una vidriería, es un joven muy cumplido y responsable con sus actividades, él realiza todos los trabajos de cortado de vidrio y a veces cuando el cliente lo solicita lleva los vidrios hasta sus casas y los coloca. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que llevar los vidrios hasta las casa de sus clientes, ya que algunos viven en pisos muy altos y esto le genera trabajo extra y le causa cansancio, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo pues es su trabajo, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cumplir con sus pedidos y no fallarle a sus clientes, espera más adelante poner su propia vidriería, ya que actualmente solo es un trabajador contratado. Este es el primer préstamo de Rene en MFP, está dispuesto a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuoso con el resto de socias. Rene planea aportar los novecientos nuevos soles al capital de la vidriería, para compra más materiales.
texts.en:
Rene is 23 years old and is a hard worker. He lives in a rented room. He desires to excel in life and build a better future. He works in a glass-shop where he sizes the glass, and if the costumers request it, takes the glass to their homes and installs it. The most difficult part of his work is transporting the glass because many times the costumers live in upper floors. Even though this creates extra and tiresome work, he does it because it is part of his job.

He has been doing this work for three years and what he likes the most is to be punctual with the orders. He hopes to be able to open his own glass shop because he is only a hired worker at this time.

This is Rene’s first loan with MFP and he is committed to paying it on time since he does not want to cause problems to his communal bank where is respected by the other members. Rene plans to add the nine hundred new soles to the capital of the glass shop to purchase additional materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the shop

loans.name: Sergio Gerardo

texts.es: A la vivienda del señor Sergio Gerardo G. le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas para su mama ya que está bajo su responsabilidad, y es una persona ya grande de edad, necesita su espacio. Como en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la construcción, está solicitando un préstamo para llevar a cabo la mejora y así su mama estar mas como en su propia recamara.
texts.en:
Sergio Gerardo G. needs a room in his home for his mother, who lives with him now that she is elderly and under his care. Since he does not currently have the money to purchase materials or to pay someone to build the room, he is requesting a loan to carry out this project so his mother can have her own living space.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamin C. tiene un terreno en el cual está construyendo una vivienda y le está haciendo falta el techo, tiene el proyecto de elaborarla de concreto ya que es más segura y duradera. 
  Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material ya que el sabe algo de construcción y  se encargara de realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible. Para terminar el patrimonio de su familia, y así dejar de pagar renta.
texts.en:
Benjamin C. is building a home on a plot of land that he owns. The house currently lacks a roof, and he hopes to build one out of concrete roofing tiles, as it will be safer and more durable. He is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials. As he knows something about construction, he will be able to do the work himself. He will complete construction as quickly as possible to be able to stop paying rent and to ensure his family's legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a tile roof

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos R. ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente, nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la mejora que está realizando, le falta terminar de colocar el vitropiso en las recamaras de sus hijas. Solicita el crédito para comprar el material y pagar a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto sin su esposa la señora Sandra Guadalupe Alvarado y una hija, don Carlos se encontraba en su empleo como gerente de un óptica en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Carlos R. is requesting a loan to install floor tiles in his daughters' rooms. Since he does not currently have the money to finish this project, he will use the loan to purchase materials and to pay the person who will do the work. This is his second loan from FVP, and he repaid the first loan on time.

The photograph shows Carlos's wife, Sandra Guadalupe Alvarado, and one of his daughters, as Carlos was working at his job managing an optical store in the city center when the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the installation of tile floors in his home

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: A la vivienda del señor Francisco C. le está haciendo falta el techo pero él desea ponerlo de concreto ya que es más seguro para su familia. Solicita un préstamo ya en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para terminar la mejora y así poder habitar la casa. Por el momento está pagando renta y se le ase muy difícil ya que le han aumentado la mensualidad y con lo que gana en su trabajo casi no le alcanza para terminar su casa y pagar renta.
texts.en:
The home of Francisco C. does not have a roof and he wishes to install a concrete roof to provide greater safety to his family. He is requesting a loan because he currently does not have the funds to complete this home improvement. For the moment is renting and it has been very difficult for him because they have just increased the rent. With what he earns he cannot afford to finish building his house as well as pay the rent.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase concrete building blocks.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Claudia Cecilia S. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior de la casa, pero en está momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar la pintura que desea para realizar la mejora ya que su esposa el señor Juan Gabriel Ordaz realizara los acabados. 
Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa de la señora Claudia no se encontraba estaba trabajando ya que es encargada de una guardería del gobierno y don Juan Gabriel quien es la persona que aparece en la foto trabaja en una funeraria como empleado general, estos son los ingresos que tiene para darle los mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The interior of Mrs. Claudia Cecilia S.’ house is not finished. She does not have the money to buy the paint she wants. Her husband, Juan Gabriel Ordaz, will make the improvements. When the home visit was made, Claudia was at work. She is in charge of a government child care facility. Juan Gabriel, the man in the photo, works as a general employee in a funeral parlor. This is the income they have to give the best to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the interior of the house

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida O. is 50 years old, married with two children and resides at Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer.

Nida grows orchids in her backyard both as a hobby and as a business. Now she wants to expand and buy a variety of orchid seedlings. Her loyal customers are her friends, relatives and neighbors. She wishes to give her family a better life someday.

loans.use: To buy a variety of orchid seedlings

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando P., a 54 year old member of Paglaum, is married with four children and resides in Panaon, Misamis Occ.

The rice land he is tending is an inheritance from his parents. When he got married, this then became the family's source of income. He plans to add more capital to the farm to increase its yield. He dreams of a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Apolinario Gaudencio

texts.en: Apolinario A., a 37-year-old fish vendor, is married with two kids. He is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  The family's main source of income is his fish-vending business.  Recently he applied for a loan from Paglaum for additional capital for his business. If the business grows in the future, he plans to expand the business and buy a fish car so he can cater to more consumers not only in the town of Aloran but in the province of Misamis Occidental as well.

loans.use: Capital for his fish-selling business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Featured in this story is Mrs. Rosita Q. G., 59 years old and a resident of P5 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married to Mr. Vicente G. and is blessed with six children, five of whom are grown with their own families.

As a young woman growing up in a poor family, she worked as a vendor of malagkit rice cake, locally known as “puto maya." At 21, in the mid-1960s, she got married and started a little sari-sari store business with a starting capital of P500.00. Today, her business is still progressing. With the help of her husband’s income from farming (tenanted Riceland, one-quarter hectare), she has been able to send their children to school and even to college.

Now she’s applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000.00, primarily for additional capital for her sari-sari store, with the remaining amount to be used for the purchase of feed for her pigs.

Her future dream is to run a big grocery store and to become a wholesaler of soft-drinks someday. She is also hoping that her daughter will finish her nursing course in the near future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

location.town: P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Mrs. Angelita I. is married to Mauricio I. and has two children. She requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 as additional capital for her hog-raising venture.  She will use the proceeds for the purchase of feed and vitamins for her hogs and for the purchase of more piglets. She is planning to put up capital for her own sari-sari store as an expansion to her hog-raising business and for added income as well. Her other future plan is for her children to finish their studies and hopefully establish their own careers.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Mrs. Agustina L. buys and sells dried fish and longanisa (processed meat). She is 55-years old, residing at Gango, Ozamiz City, with her five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She is a new member of PMPC and she joined the Coop to benefit from their good programs and services. Right now, she is applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase housing materials to renovate her house. The loan will be repaid from her husband's income on carpentry jobs and income from her little business. In the future, she hopes to be able to send her two children to college, to renovate her house and to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for renovations

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Ms. Rhoda M. is now engaged in a business, a sari – sari store. She used start-up capital of 2,000 from her salary at a grocery store to set up a small sari-sari store at home. Her customers are her neighbors. To focus on her business, she decided to leave her job. She is now residing at P-5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. At the age of 34, she is still single and planning to settle down soon. She is living with her parents and taking care of them.

To add more capital to her business, she decided to join Paglaum MPC and obtain a loan.With the encouragement of her neighbors, she is now an active member of Paglaum MPC at Kauswagan Center, Gango, Ozamiz City. She is a very active leader in her group. Now on her 2nd loan cycle, she wishes to borrow 12,000 PHP to buy more grocery items. She is hoping that someday, with the help of Paglaum MPC and through Kiva funds, her small store will become a mini-grocery store at their place.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a sari-sari store

location.town: P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel L. de 49 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón junto a su hijo el cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María posee una venta de ropa para bebé, de la cual obtiene el dinero para todos los gastos del hogar, a pesar que su hijo colabora, ella necesita mejorar sus ingresos, es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar más ropa de bebé de manera que aumente su inventario para tener mucha más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera María espera poder mejorar su economía y así mismo obtener una vida más tranquila junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Isabel L. is 49 years old. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her son, who helps her with the household expenses. María owns a baby clothing business, from which she earns the money for the household expenses. Even though her son helps out, she needs to improve her income. This is why she is requesting a loan, with which she will have the capital she needs to buy more baby clothing so she can increase her inventory and have more variety to offer her customers. In this way María hopes to improve her economic situation and achieve a more tranquil life along with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael Antonio R. H. reside en el municipio de Comasagua junto a su compañera de vida. Rafael posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propio hogar, él se encarga de hacer el pan y su compañera de vida le ayuda únicamente a repartirlo.
Rafael solícita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para poder comprar una motocicleta, la cual contribuya a que pueda repartir en pan de manera más segura y más rápida. Así él espera brindar un mejor servicio por medio del cual pueda mejorar su reputación y de esta manera obtener mayor clientela, todo esto ayudara a que el pueda obtener una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposa y puedan forma un mejor hogar juntos.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio R. H. lives in Comasagua with his life partner. He has a bakery business located in his own home. He is in charge of making bread while his partner helps deliver it.

Rafael is requesting a loan to have enough money to be able to purchase a motorcycle to deliver his products in a safer and faster manner. He hopes to provide his customers better service, which will improve his reputation and attract new customers. This will help him have a more stable financial situation so that he and his wife can create a better home together.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Patricia Janeth

texts.es: Patricia Janeth R. V. reside en San Juan Opico junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, su esposo reside en Los Estado Unidos y este le envía dinero mensualmente. Patricia posee un comedor en el mercado de San Juan Opico. Ella desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más granos básicos y poder guardar una amplia provisión de manera que no tenga que comprarlos por algún tiempo, todo esto con el fin de poder obtener más ganancias, ya que su esposo le ayuda con $100 dólares mensuales lo cual es muy poco para todos los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijo, es por ello que Patricia anhela mejorar las ganancias de su negocio esperando mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Patricia Janeth R. V. lives in San Juan Opico with her three dependent children. Her husband lives in the United States and sends her money every month. Patricia has a cafeteria in the San Juan Opico market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more staple grains so that she can have a good supply on hand and not need to buy them for a while. This will help her increase her income, as her husband sends only $100 a month which is not enough to cover the cost of her children's education and other household expenses. Patricia dreams of increasing the earnings from her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 53 years old and married to an ordinary carpenter. They are blessed with healthy children who are now helping them with their financial needs. Antonia lives with her husband and her children in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. She has been in the hog-raising business for the past eight years. In this way, she helps her husband meet the needs of their family. She and her husband also work together to improve their rice farming, which adds to their income.

Antonia works hard in order to make her hog-raising business more productive. She is a very responsible wife and mother to her children. Aside from that, she is also a good neighbor and friend to everyone. She always wants to have a better living and to earn more profit. Therefore, she wants a loan of PHP11,000 for the maintenance of her hog- raising business. She wishes to add capital to buy more sacks of hog grower and feed for her pigs to become healthy. She also wants more piglets to raise in order to expand her business in the village. She believes that the loan will be of great help in developing a good standard of living.

loans.use: Buy more sacks of hog grower and feed

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota Rumbaua is 44 years old and already married. She lives with her husband and her two children in Barangay Minanga Sur of Iguig, Cagayan. Her eldest child is Rodalyne who is 29 years old and a college graduate; her youngest child is Rodel, 17 years old, currently studying in college. Carlota hopes that her youngest child will be able to finish his course and she plans to improve their living into a progressive and better one. That’s why she is very patient in working harder in order to attain her goals in life.

She manages a small general store in their village, which serves as her source of income. But she needs more capital to maintain her business and to be able to increase her income. She is now requesting a loan of Php13,000.00 that will be of great help to buy more products for her store as well as for her cell phone load retailing. She hopes to increase her income daily to assist her husband financially in their farming business. She believes that through her patience and strong faith in God, she will be able to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is engaged in direct selling AVON cosmetics products. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children namely: Jerald, 25; Maynard, 19 who is currently in college; and Jerwin, 16 who just graduated high school and will be enrolling in college soon.

They live happily in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. The village where they live is an agricultural based community where farming is the main source of income. She is hoping to improve her small business in their village and be able to work hand in hand with her husband to improve their way of life. 

Edna is hoping that she will be able to receive a loan of PHP10,000.00 for her direct selling business. She intends to use the loan as additional capital for her business to purchase more items, thus increasing her profit. She carefully budgets her income in order to support her family's basic needs. She also wants to save for the education of her children. The loan will be a big help towards increasing her income, which will help to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a woman who tries her best to give her family a better life. She sells different items and commodities that she buys in the market. She roams house to house and even visits different agencies and institutions just to sell her products. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 as additional working capital for her business, so that she can buy products to sell and increase her income. She believes that if she has more products she can earn more profit.

Her family lives peacefully in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. She is already a widow and strives hard to support her family's immediate needs. Her children are Carlota, 44 years old and Rodrigo, 41 years old, and they are both married and have their own families. Estelita works patiently to support the needs of her children and to provide a good education for her grandchildren. She hopes that her loan request will be granted to further expand her selling business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen M. is 28 years old and a mother of a four year old child named Jim-Owen, who is entering kindergarten. Her husband is a local proprietor of a furniture business in their village. They are happily living in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. Kathleen sells different kinds of vegetables to help her husband provide for their basic needs. 

Kathleen plans to make their businesses more productive, and to accomplish this, Kathleen wants to borrow a loan of PHP5,000.00 for additional capital for their furniture and vending businesses. The amount will be a big help for the development of their businesses and to increase their income. Their daily income of PHP200.00 is not enough to provide for all their family's needs, and that is why she really hopes to improve their businesses with the additional capital she is requesting. She will use the loan to buy wood and other materials to manufacture more furniture that they will able to sell. Also, the loan will be used to buy more vegetable products for her vending business. Through this loan, they will be able to send their child to school and hopefully finish a college course some day. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, God will make a way for them to attain their goals in life.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials for their furniture business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C. is 53 years old and married to Loreto C. who works as a jeepney driver. They live happily in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Edna manages a small variety store in their village, which serves as additional income for them. Edna retails different goods and basic commodities. She has many customers because she is approachable to everyone. She wants to make her business more productive to be able to earn a good profit. But they don’t have enough capital to improve their business.

Then, Edna heard about ASKI, and she learned that it helps entrepreneurs with their financial matters and also provides them with good benefits. That’s why Edna is now asking for financial assistance to expand her variety store. She is asking for a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy more items to sell and stock more products in her store. The loan will be a great help in making her business profitable, and she will then be able to help her husband to provide for their basic daily living needs.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita B. lives peacefully in the village of San Jose Noret I, Mallig, Isabela. She is blessed with three children and they all have their stable jobs and their own families. Estrelita has managed a rice retailing business for many years. It is this business that has been her source of income, and is why she was able to send her children to school to finish their studies. 

Estrelita wants to have another source of income, rather than rice retailing. She wants to maintain a hog raising business in order to increase her income, because she plans to renovate her old house. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP20,000.00 for additional capital for her small piggery business. She wants to buy more piglets to raise and feed supply for her pigs to keep them healthy. She dreams of earning more profits in order to repair her old house and be able to have a comfortable life. She believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith in God, she will be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn is married to Nestor P. and they are blessed with three children who are all studying at the elementary level. Their family lives happily in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. The couple is always helping each other in order to give their very best to support their children. They believe that the greatest wealth they could give to their children is a good education. That’s why they patiently work hard to sustain their family's needs and the educational needs of their children.

Amilyn has a small business of a piggery in their backyard, and that serves as her source of income to meet the necessities of her family. Her husband assists her in her hog raising business in order to make it grow. But Amilyn doesn’t have enough capital to sustain her business, and in this connection, she is requesting a loan of PHP6,000.00 to buy more feed supply for her pigs. She also wants to allocate an extra amount to sell a variety of foods. This will provide additional income to provide for the basic needs of her family and send her children to school. She hopes that she can earn more profits from their business and become a successful entrepreneur some day.

loans.use: To buy more feed supply.
